text: Love the location and vibe here. There is a great space to relax, meet up with friends or just enjoy some healthy food and drinks. I tried the Violet Wave. It was a great smoothie, however the prices are really high at $7.50. I've lived in many juice friendly cities that have organic fresh juices and smoothies and this is by far the most expensive place I've tried. I'm not sure my wallet can handle frequent visits but for a splurge once in awhile, I'll  definitely come back.

I am a big fan of mac & cheese. I could eat it all day, everyday if I had to. So when I happened to see this place as we were walking, I just knew we had to try it out!

We ended up eating here for dinner the next night, and I was so happy with our decision! They had so many options for toppings on their delicious classic mac recipe. I ended up deciding on the crabby mac, and my husband chose the basil chicken pesto. We didn't have to wait too long for our food to be ready, and we sat down in the restaurant because all of the outdoor seating was taken. We absolutely loved our meal! It was so filling that I had to take some of it back to our hotel with us. Next time we go back to Philadelphia for a visit, coming back to this place is going to be a priority on our list of things to do!

I had high hopes for this spot because I looooove middle eastern food. Unfortunately, it wasn't the outstanding experience I imagined it would be. Went with my work team so started off with a few apps - whipped feta, hummus and bacon wrapped dates. The table loved the whipped feta the best I would say. The hummus had great texture but tasted a little too lemony to be my favorite. The chickpeas however gave it a nice crunch. I also appreciate cucumbers along with the pita. For my personal meal I had the turkey sandwich. I had hoped for a little spice with the banana pepper vinaigrette, but alas the aioli overpowered the boring sandwich. The people who got the lamb sandwich loved it so that may be the way to go. The bahn bee had very hard bread and was greasy. The worst though were the sides. The fries were so hard that they were more like the potato stick snacks I recall as a kid. The vegetable salad side was too sweet with a weird sauce that no one enjoyed. All and all I doubt I would give it another try even though service was great and the atmosphere is cute. The food needs to step up the game!

I've been dying to step foot in this place ever since it opened so I was thrilled when a friend suggested we stop in after dinner.

It's a small place, but bright with elegant and simple decorations. The macarons are neatly displayed like jewelry in their case. There are so many varieties of flavors, but I ultimately ended up with the Coconut. It was delicious. Nice crunch on the outside and then soft as you bite down. And lots of flavor. The four stars is merely because I have had very few macarons in my day so not sure if it's the best one I've had yet or not. But so far it is!

They also have Norman Love chocolates...one of the best chocolatiers in the area. I tried a hazelnut truffle and it was truly heavenly.

They have gelato as well, but I was too distracted by the macarons and chocolates to give that case a look. 

The guy who waited on us was also very nice...and French! Thinking he may have been the owner, or at least a manager.

Can't wait to go again!

Artsy fartsy Elite Events are my fave, and Yelp Reno and Board & Brush certainly delivered! I am a performer, not really a visual artist, but I love coming in not sure about what I want to do and just figuring it out along the way, buffing and blending as I go...Working on wood is particularly therapeutic to me- I love distressing the wood and then lovingly sanding, staining, and dolling it up it afterwards.

After a friendly welcome from Reno's favorite Michael,
 we got to meet the lovely Ashly, owner of Board & Brush, and her charming team of helpers, all creative and fun-loving, who have a great time helping folks out with their projects. I'm fairly autonomous when working on creative projects, but Board & Brush really has a great balance of when to step in and help someone find their way, and when to just let folks get their art on. They're also full of helpful painting tips and techniques to help you create what you're going for.

What was also cool about this event was that I didn't even know anyone there, but we were all singing and jamming along together as we worked on our signs. All the finished signs I saw turned out really cute, and everyone seemed to be happy with their final product. Thank you Yelp Reno and Board & Brush for a fantabulous evening! Can't wait to come back for my birthday!

Service was excellent! The server answered all questions and was very polite. Never seemed frustrated or rushed. I ordered the pizza trying to be safe. She informed me about the spicy sausage that is also on the pizza. I was so glad she did because I cannot do spicy  she must have read my mind!   I loved the thin crust pizza. You could taste all the flavors plus the crust is delicious  

I was very very satisfied with my meal and will be back. Everyone in the group was happy!

FYI the individual pizza was enough for lunch and I was able to carry the rest home for dinner. 

The only downside was they don't have to go cups. I always take the rest of my soda to go.

Other than that it would be 5 stars!

This is an awesome way to team build or hang out with friends and family. The instructors make you look like a rock star even if you have zero talent. The paintings are simple and easily customizable. 

I love that you can bring snacks and drinks for your private classes. I will definitely do this again!

Loved my chicken quesadilla. Super filling and tasty, couldn't finish it all. I think this place is a pretty affordable, convenient, and great lunch stop. It's not much to look at on the inside but their menu is stock full of possibilities and I need to get back to try some other items they have on the menu!

I've been here for a few times, and I'm in love with this place. The menu is quite impressive, and it will seriously take more than a few minutes to read through the choices.  (The huge star in the middle of the menu can be quite distracting!). If you need a good sushi lunch place, then get the lunch special. They have an awesome deal at 3 rolls for $12, which includes either soup or salad. Guess how many choices of rolls you get to choose from? 43!!! Lots of choices to choose from, and I really digged the Pepper Tuna roll and the Alaskan roll. I had the crabmeat apple roll, but didn't care much for it.

More reasons to love this place: Service is fast and friendly, and they have LOW-sodium soy sauce. 

My challenge is to try different rolls/dishes each time I go there, except the California roll. :)

Walking down 104 is always makes me feel good. I see a bunch of new places to check out and I'm just so excited to try them.

I finally took the plunge one lunch to try their lunch menu.

The interior is super swanky, super chic vibe but with the sun out, my friend and I couldn't resist sitting on the patio to take in the nice weather. I was a little disappointed to discover that a lot trucks like to rip down this road which kind of took away the experience but I always enjoy patios nonetheless.

Although I didn't try any of their wines, I still enjoyed the always default water. Their water had lemons in it which was a nice change.

I decided to try their sandwich: panino italiano. I don't have a palette for Italian food but I'm working on it. I think this was my first experience eating authentic Italian meats so the taste was a little overwhelming. I came away feeling "this meat tastes game-y".
To be honest, it was a struggle to get through the sandwich. Only until I got to the middle I tried to focus on mixing the flavors of the tomato-y spread with the meat and cheese and the flavors mixed better.

Waitress was friendly and came by to check on us frequently.
My sandwich came with a very small salad with oil and balsalmic vinegar.

Sandwich came out to about $12. 

I'd really love to come back and try their pasta but until I can figure out what I'm supposed to expect for Italian meats, I probably won't order the sandwich again.

What are some other reviewers talking about when suggesting that...  The portions are too small?  Truly insane.  We ordered the rabbit ragout and were shocked at how large the portion was for a "small plate".  The same goes for all the plates we ordered.  The cocktails were inventive...loved the seelbach and the dark and stormy although the amexica had a few too many bold flavors to work for me (drank it though didn't I?).   The chicken liver pâté was phenomenal!  Duck breast was cooked very well!  The mussels were quite tasty but a little lacking in salt for my taste.  Four solid stars. Looking forward to my next visit.

I've been holding off on writing a review for this place. Only because we've eaten here multiple times and every time was a different experience. 

First visit was great. We met the owners and everyone was so helpful and accommodating. Their suggestions for sauce choices were on point. Food were delicious and fresh. 

Second visit was ok. This time my salad tasted dirty, as if it wasn't washed and prepped before serving. I did saw the guy open a bag and dumped it in. I'm sure a lot of businesses do this as well but maybe we just had a bad batch? I don't know. It threw off my entire meal. I ended up having to pick around it.

Third visit was better. I wish I remembered which combination of sauces I created the first time. Pretty sure I've tried every sauce they offer. 

Overall, nice place. Clean setting and bright, open space. You can either build your own bowl or choose one of their specialties. Love the freshness of the seafood. So far the best poke we've had in the city.

The Warhol Foundation don't give dough to "friggin jokes" [cf the snide 3 word review below].  This place earned that seminal grant the hard way - by scraping barely-sufficient pennies together in crumbling warehouses for a decade - and earning the loyalty of area artists and art lovers for the duration.  Warhol allowed it to move into a clean, well lighted space finally...

... with a gallery space large enough to do some good shows, & the other spaces - former admin offices of Tucson's Fire Dept. - the impromptu meditations on this space's history and future - just what I'd expect from a MoCA.

I reconnected in 1 of those with a Walter Benjamin essay I hadn't read in decades, particularly apt for our contemporary situation [something about art and reproduction, you either know it or not], in another met the living room furniture for our near-future downsized living quarters, and in the gift shop discovered a local writer, Aaron Michael Morales.

Few 'BIG CITY' museums have ever given me more.

Can I review this if all I did was have a drink, or if I had two drinks? Well, I'm gonna. Vieux Carre' was the drink of choice and they/he clearly knew what to do... perfect drink it was, but almost better than that was the fact that no bar stools existed and silly tourists would venture in and be confused/bothered that they couldn't sit...

Love it.

:)

I have been living in NYC for the last 4 years, so I have admittedly become a bit of a bagel snob with the bevy of high quality options in the bagel capital of the US. With that being said, I was pretty impressed with the bagel quality at this spot in St Pete! Crispy on the outside and nicely toasted inside with ample thickness, it really would have no trouble fitting in on any NYC street corner. Also had a large iced coffee that was Texas-sized gigantic and well priced. Would love to return!

Have been here twice - both time for work-related happy hours.
Good service from the sweet Irish barkeep - Connor - and a good big shot of Tullimorew Dew.  (Sweet and smooth.)

Food is just OK.

Love the witty quotes/sayings on the blackboard that changes every day.

Great place to meet friends for a meal, and maybe some darts....batting cages...or a game of pool? (There are also a few other old school games that are more arcade like).   This place has regulars...and that makes it OK in my book.  :-). The food is good, and the service is excellent...but honestly...its the dive bar, sports bar kinda feel that has me smitten. 
Pictures on the wall....classic rock on the jukebox...and games that grown up kids love to play.   Great friends, good food, cold beer...excellent memories.   Give this place a try if you live here...or are visiting.

Oh my goodness this salad place is heaven! There are so many great ingredient offerings and unique, flavorful dressing offerings as well. I loved creating my own salad and putting in a bunch of different tasty toppings, and having them chop them all up to yummy bite sized pieces. These salads are huge and filling too- easy for those with big appetites to stay healthy! My favorite dressings were the lemon tahini and chile hatch ranch. I will have to try some more dressings next time!

I've never had Japanese food before, well maybe a few pieces of sushi, so going to this restaurant was a real eye opener! I immediately loved the atmosphere of this restaurant, it was very calm and classy and the servers were incredibly responsive and professional. 

Although afterwards it was clear I was not a fan of Japanese food, I still had a wonderful time. It helped that I was with great company but in addition, the atmosphere and impeccable service. 

If you're a fan of Japanese food, or would like to try it out, this is the place to do it. The prices are also quite reasonable and the amount of food provided is impressive.

I was reluctant to come over at the beginning then loved everything about it. Especially the freedom to create your own salad and pizza. The combo of mini salad and pizza is just perfect for me. And I love the unlimited toppings that you can choose, pretty amazing.

I came to Mahony's with my friends for Brunch one Saints Sunday. When we got there it was a little packed but it was to be expected because it was brunch time on Magazine and it was gameday. It didn't take us long to be seated. When we got there we walked in and took out seats. Our waiter was really cool. Beware super friendly and nice. I ordered a roast beef poboy. Yeah, interesting choice for brunch. But i didn't mind. I really wanted something hearty and it was a poboy spot so why not. I must say, the food was really delicious. I loved every bite of it. Not to mention, we had bottomless mimosas. That's literally one of my favorite things about brunch to be honest.

it's really hard to find a great bagel place in the area that you can just pick up a dozen bagels and cream cheese for some friends after a long night out but newtown bagel is it!

picked up a dozen bagels, so many different kinds which was awesome and also so many different kinds of cream cheese! i personally love their garlic & herb cream cheese, scallion is also delicious. this place is always poppin when i come in so if you have a big order, might be worth it to call ahead.

This was my favorite part of our trip this past week! We really wanted to do a swamp tour and read through reviews and ended up with Cajun Encounters. We liked the idea of not having an airboat which can be super noisy and windy. 

A few people from our hotel were going to the same tour. The concierge came outside to ask if we were all going and said the bus had called and asked us to meet them elsewhere because it was actually too big to fit down the narrow French Quarter streets! We walked about 3-4 blocks to Canal St. to meet the full size coach bus. (Cajun Encounters offers the pick up service for an extra charge, but it's worth it for ease). 

The first thing I loved was that the bus driver was super friendly, a native of NOLA. A bachelor party was being kind of bro-y in the back and she quickly shut them up with made me want to hug her. She told them the night before they were so bad she'd called the police to have them escort the guys back to their hotel...

Anyway! She asked if we wanted to hear some New Orleans info on our ride down and the majority of us said sure. The ride out to the swamp was about ~40 minutes. She told us about the different areas we were passing through, the graveyards, Hurricane Katrina, stealing crabs as a teenager, etc. etc. She was really enjoyable to listen to. 

We got to the Encounters spot and she gave us very clear directions on how to check in, what will happen, etc. You go inside and show the counter your ticket/reservation/phone receipt and they give you a colored stretchy bracelet (like a livestrong one). That tells you what boat/group you'll be with. We waited outside for about 15 minutes and they started calling all the groups and walking us down to the water. We (and the girls who also came from our hotel) breathed a sigh of relief when the bachelor bros were not on our boat :)

Our boat sat about 25 people - two long bench type seats, each facing outward. We were on the tail end so occasionally we sat on the very front of the boat more up at water level. I don't remember our guide's name but he was informative and funny. On our tour, we saw a few alligators - the guides know where to find some favorites. We also spotted some babies, some cool herons/cranes, A BALD EAGLE SWOOPING DOWN TO CATCH PREY (so cool! So mad I didn't get a photo), and even a baby and adult raccoon! At first our tour was primarily in a wider water area and I thought "huh, not exactly what I pictured as much" but later on in the tour, we went past our boarding dock and went the other way and THAT'S where the swamp I was picturing was. Narrow routes - I'm pretty amazed the boat captains can steer so well to not just hit every tree in the way. A few times he'd just turn the motor off and we'd try to spot critters in the woods. I got the sweetest video of him feeding the adult raccoon - it used its little paws to grab the hot dog! (I may like animals a teeny bit). 

The tour was about 2 hours total. Fantastic. It was fun, relaxing, informative, and friendly - the other people in the boat were all easy going and helped point out cool animals and spots so everyone could get photos. Definitely go to this place if you're in the area! (also look for coupons - I think I saved us $20!)

You know what I really love about these guys? There's no pressure and no bs. They tell you what's wrong and how much it's going to cost and that's that. Their prices are fair and the customer service is top notch! 
And hey - if you're lucky you might get to hear the service guys rocking out the Katy Perry. 
I've been here twice and I'm definitely keeping them.

I was looking through the YELP reviews trying to find something interesting to try.  I  stumbled onto "Chef Ron's Gumbo Stop".  I think my search was focused on corny names.  Anyhow, based on the good reviews, we stopped in on a Saturday evening.  Easily the best decision I made all week.

The food was awesome!

The "Stop"  is located in a strip mall just north of the I-10 Causeway cloverleaf.  There is a well lit sign on the east side of the cloverleaf.  If you are coming from I-10 you have a choice, You can make an illegal u-turn, dive into the right lane and pull up to the front of the restaurant.  The faint of heart can make a legal left turn, make the next two lefts and pull right up next to the strip mall .

This is a relatively small place.  Maybe 20 seats, a couple more at the bar. Decor stretches the boundaries of eclectic.....  We obviously missed the dinner rush, I think maybe 3 - 4 people were seated when we arrived.  We sat right next to the mermaid.  

Service was quick and friendly.  Someone I assume is Chef Ron was out a couple of times to check on us.  Nice, polite but not clingy - no war stories or life histories.  Interesting that he assumed we were from out of town (must be worldly demeanor and classic good looks).  When he found out we were from Destrehan, he commented that "he loved to get locals in".

Down to the food - nothing short of great.  All the reviews raving about the seafood gumbo is absolutely accurate. The turkey wrap was enormous and stuffed full of real turkey.  My real find was the potato salad.  This is the best potato salad I have had in New Orleans.   

$50 for 2 including drinks and tips.  I'm excited about going back and trying some of the other sides.

I liked the salon it was nice and clean. I didnt know you had to pay extra to have your hair styled! Usually where I get my haircut the blow dry is included into the cost. 
Haircut was okay $50 plus tip. Wouldn't go back for this price. I love my chinatown haircut better

This is the first AMEX lounge I've visited. It was a quiet Wednesday early afternoon, so when I arrived to the lounge the front desk people were friendly.  The lounge is bright and modern. Certainly, geared towards the business traveler. There are not many couches or comfy chairs. 
The bar is fully stocked with creative cocktails and a diverse wine list. I didn't look at the beer list in detail, but did notice they carried local beers on draft. The food is buffet style and Mediterranean forward. If it's not your jam, you may want to eat before heading in. I love Mediterranean so I enjoyed  the majority of the options. They have a small salad area with spring mix, beets, roasted acorn squash, tomatoes, tabbouleh, beans, and some others. For hot food there was brisket with carrrots, roasted potatoes, rice, lamb meatballs, and a squash/tomato soup. It was good, not great. They also had an assortment of cookies and a passion fruit custard that was entirely too bitter and sour. 

I didn't have coffee or tea, but they had some great options there. Because it was close to the holidays Santa made a brief appearance. 
Note: you can only order one drink per person. So if you're with others they will need to get their own drink. Mild inconvenience, but again the bar was wonderfully stocked. 

f you bring children ensure they are well-behaved as this is geared towards the business person. There's not a lot of room for them to move around. It's fairly small. 

I spent a good four hours there due to a delay, enjoyed the drinks and left with a full tummy. The bartenders and people clearing tables were incredibly friendly and service was prompt. 

Overall, good lounge experience.

If you like beer at all and are around the Philadelphia area, you really should do yourself a favor and take a trip to this brewery.  There are many interesting beers that I would actively seek out, and they come in a variety of sizes. I normally don't get excited about beer as wine or cocktails are my drinks of choice.  However, I felt differently after tasting the beers here.  I joined the UYE here last month, and I was impressed with everything about this place.  From the food, to the beer, to the service, it was a home run.

I stuck with the 4 and 8 oz pours.  The 4 is great if you just want to taste something and are unsure.  The 8 is perfect for me to satisfy a craving for a particular beer.  I tasted many things I liked but my favorite was the Lil' Lady.  So tart, tangy, lemony, and refreshing which is my favorite style of beer. I also enjoyed the one that was brewed with spelt and guava, and also the experimental one with sushi rice and yuzu (Japanese citrus). I love the interesting combos going on here.  I usually only like sours, but Tired Hands proved me wrong!  

Service was excellent!  We had a big group of over ten Yelpers and water glasses were kept full and servers made sure we were able to order more beer when our glasses were running low.  It was also crazy crowded in there as it was a busy Saturday which made the level of service even more impressive.  In addition, the server has no problem giving our large group separate checks.

The Fermentaria serves up some tasty bar far as well.  I had a veggie burger and honestly wasn't expecting much, but it was very flavorful and the guacamole added some nice texture.  The bun was soft and fluffy (potato roll maybe?) and the fries appeared to be fresh cut.  It was a good sized portion, but not too much to where you push yourself to eat it and feel gross.  Just right!  

I will most definitely return for the brews and the bites.  It looks like the draft choices are always changing, so I am excited to see what is available on my next visit!

My work has Fooda and Pita Chip was the restaurant they brought in for the day.  I ordered a salad bowl with falafel and chicken shawarma and it was amazing!  All of the food was so fresh. Their hot sauce and tahina are so damn good too. The hot sauce definitely had a kick to it but I love spicy stuff so I didn't mind. People more sensitive to heat may not like it.  I hope Fooda brings Pita Chip back to my work but I'm lucky it's not too far from my apartment.  I will definitely order again.

Five stars for this location easily! Not sure why it took me so long to contribute to the reviews of this place, but better late than never. Everyone at this location is friendly and it's always sincere. Aside from having customer service that would shame some high end Philadelphia restaurants the food here is great. It is delivered efficiently, hot, and cooked properly. I personally am addicted to the spicy chicken sandwich and love to dip my fires in the Chick-fil-A Sauce. I also like that this location has family friendly nights: my favorite is taking my daughter to the annual father daughter date night around Valentine's. My little girl and I look forward to it - probably me more than her she is five and has no sense of time. I also really like their milk shakes and breakfast sandwich selections. Keep up the good work team Chick-fil-A, it isn't going unnoticed or unappreciated!

It's time to update my review since I wrote it back in 2017 (when they first opened). It's still 5 stars. Wish I could give it more after multiple visits and takeout orders. This is my favorite Thai restaurant. I love that they have a separate vegan menu with way more choices than any other restaurant. I'm not vegan, but I like the option and have found many wonderful items such as the eggplant basil stir fry, veggie spring rolls, and vegetable noodle soup. Everything they make is homemade including the sauces. There are no store bought sauces with added preservatives. They cook healthy and with lots of fresh veggies even in the regular menu items. They also don't skimp on the heat level. If you ask for it, you'll get it at whatever level you want. My husband won't go anywhere else but this place for Thai food. He's a Texan who loves spicy food. He gets his beef basil stir fry in Thai hot and absolutely loves it. He was actually the first person to recommend this restaurant to me. He happened to go there during one of my hospital visits. He said Preeda warned him of the spice level, and apparently was even impressed that he ate it all with no complaints. I asked him if it was Thai Boat. The previous restaurant that occupied that space (which was also good).  He corrected me and said that it's under new ownership and called Thai Legacy. We've been going ever since that time along with my mother.

We've been to all the other Thai restaurants in the area. They are all unique in their own way. I just like this one the best because of the variety. I've come to appreciate it even more after my recent visit to the Thai temple. I was drawn to the noodle soup and the flower teas at their Sunday market. I was craving that soup during the week so I pulled up the Thai Legacy menu and noticed that they have many variations of this soup on their menu. So far, I've had the pork noodle soup and the veggie one with tofu. The pork noodle soup has 4 different noodle options (small rice noodles, large rice noodles, yellow egg noodles, or clear bean noodles) and the veggie one has 3 types (no egg noodles). I got the clear bean noodles and asked for the spice tray on the side so that I could add my own heat. The takeout soup orders come with chili pepper spice, paste, and pickled jalapenos. It's a huge portion that can definitely be 2 meals or split between 2 people. It was so good, and reminded me of my morning at the Sunday market. It so comforting and I'm so happy that I can get it Tuesday thru Sunday when needed. I was also happy to see that they are now serving exotic iced teas such as Roselle Hibiscus, Butterfly Pea Flower, and Lemongrass tea. I've had the first 2 teas and they are refreshing. It's unlimited refills during lunch.

This restaurant gets better and better each time. It's a wonderful and hard-working family that owns it. They cook with love and health in mind. The service is always friendly and welcoming. They remember us every time we come in (especially my mother). We'll continue to return often.

I will be updating my review, but so far I'm really impressed. 

Enerjuicer has been open only a day or so, and offering free wheat grass shots all week for their opening. Looking at their menu, I was very impressed with the variety and especially with prices. Definitely not as pricey as my normal juice stop. I love that all the fresh fruits and veggies are on display also. I chose a regular sized "garden state" smoothie which was sweet and light. I can't wait to come back and try the juices, though. Less than 6 bucks as opposed to the normal 9/10 range? Maybe the bottles are alot smaller. We shall see. I'd also like to mention how friendly the staff was....super welcoming and informative, they seem very excited about their new business. I wish them luck and I will for sure be a repeat customer.

The Natural Cafe is A-OK. Located on State Street, we stopped in here on a Friday afternoon as we were strolling down to the beach. It's order-at-the-counter, and there wasn't much of a line, so the wait was quick. I ordered the fish tacos (I'm from North Texas, so any excuse to eat fish in a coastal town I'm going to take). My boyfriend ordered the tuna fish sandwich with a side salad. My mom ordered the cup of vegetable soup, and my dad ordered the nachos. 

Only my boyfriend was truly wowed by his food. If he were writing this review based on his experience of the food alone, I think he probably would give them 5 stars. He loved the sandwich and the salad, and I tasted both and have to say they were great. The rest of us were okay with our meals, but not all that impressed. My fish tacos were a little strange. They were smothered in tomato sauce and cheese, and topped with lots of shredded carrot. It wasn't bad, just a little odd. It was served with blue corn tortilla chips and salsa, which were pretty good. 

My mom found her soup to be too salty, and the bread served with it tasted stale to her. My dad's nachos weren't too warm when they arrived, and quickly got cold as he ate them. He found it odd that there was so much salsa and no beans at all.

Overall, not our favorite spot, but a good option for a healthy meal. The place has lots of vegetarian options, which is awesome. Come here for a sandwich and salad!

Let me start off by saying I loved it here and cannot wait to return! With that out of the way, went to brunch -- there was mimosas! The end! LOL!

Of course, I wanted the mimosa tower for $69 (it's better for maybe 3 or more people). It was just my friend and I. She met me here (drove over an hour to Philly). We opted for the bottle of champagne w/ OJ $35. I got a shot of peach flavor to go with my mimosa. I enjoyed every drop and loved mixing in the OJ, champagne and peach! On point...delicious. 
Buzzzzzed! I ordered the hangover tots!!! I did not know I wanted this in my life! I loved this yummy,  hot mess, of a concoction! Friend is vegan and she enjoyed her meal too!

Made reservations several days in advance for Sunday brunch on OpenTable. Outdoor seating was the only spots available (at the time)-- I snagged it! The reservations are a hot commodity I see. We were both running a bit late. There's a little bit of a grace period and the employees here were very accommodating to our delay. Customer service was good too!

Love...this...spot...for...BRUNCH!

I love the street car. The operators are always lovely and were especially accommodating when we took some of our engagement photos on it during the Fringe festival last year (2012). Whether you're visiting the city or have lived here your entire life, it's definitely worth a ride at least once. The cars ooze history and charm (as do most of the operators), and I will continue taking a ride at least once a year.

Was a little disappointing because it was so small. About 1/2 the size of Johnny Cash's down stairs. Being a fan it was amazing to see her clothes and see the real history.  My favorite was her wedding albums and family pics.  If you love her go. But I don't think it was worth the price.

This is always a pleasure. The atmosphere is fantastic. Our waitress was a bit confused and we didn't all get the things we ordered, but she was so sweet and called everybody "lovey", that nobody even got upset about the orders being mixed up a bit. 
The bacon here is absolutely the best. Nice and crisp without being burned beyond recognition. The coffee is great and the omelettes rock. 
The biscuit and gravy are another story though. It's more like a slice of bread and the gravy was just odd. The whole thing did neither look nor taste like biscuits and gravy. So if that is a favorite dish of yours, don't order it.

This restaurant review is really only about the Happy Hour.  Lately, that has been my MO.  In the summer I don't like to eat huge meals so Happy Hours work great.  It's really hard to judge a restaurant correctly this way.  So guys, just remember this was a Happy Hour review and doesn't reflect their true menu.  Went there Friday night with our friends.  It was the four of us all looking to share some delectables.  Unfortunately, it didn't quite make it for us.  We shared the Calamari which was fried but came dry without a sauce, no lemon.  It was tasty but I believe could have been better.  Also the smash burger.  I couldn't understand why they called it that.  Except that is a new term for a trend in burgers these days.  Since one is opening up in town with just that name (Smash Burger) on Grant and Swan.The burger was very plain and tasteless.  Also ordered the Mahi tacos which just got a so so for us.  The highlight was the fish and chips.  Actually, the fish was made to perfection.  Crispy, dry on the outside with a beautiful white fish inside.  I'd highly recommend that.  The fries were very plain and ordinary to say the least.  Ordered the salad on the happy hour and it was totally bland. I would come back just for the fish and disregard the chips. The service was fine.  We had a lovely, cheery server.  The place is trendy and quite lovely with the views of the mountains.  By the time we left the place was hopping mostly at the bar.  It is definitely worthwhile going to.  I love to see Restaurants do well here in Tucson. I will be back.  I'm not trying to bad mouth this place but  because I am an honest reviewer I might be coming off a little harsh.   I will be back and get the fish and try some other interesting dishes.  They do have an extensive selection of Happy Hour dishes.  Even more than other restaurants.  So certainly it is worth coming here and enjoying this trendy spot.

I wasn't really expecting to love Hablo Taco based on the mixed Yelp reviews, but I actually really liked it!

Upon arrival, I noted a very touristy vibe in here (daiquiri machines on the walls, over the top decor, etc).  I was a bit nervous about the food due to this, but the food was actually very very good.

I started with a sangria rita (2 of my favorite things mixed together).  It was a very large drink and for the size, I don't think that the $9 price tag was too bad.  We started with the sriracha guacamole (YUM) and the loaded queso (it had bacon in it) and both were very tasty.  For my meal I had the grilled avocado (filled with fresh ahi tuna and crema sauce) and the Mexican street corn.  The ahi tuna was SO incredibly fresh and the avocado was just perfect - highly recommend this dish.  The Mexican street corn was also very well done and quite scrumptious!  Everyone at my table was happy with their meals from tacos to salads.

Our server was very sweet and was prompt on refilling our chips and getting us anything we requested.   Honestly, I had a very good experience here and I look forward to coming back in the future.

I love Vietnamese food and when I have a craving for it, Asian Pho is my go to although it's the furthest from my home. For those who don't know me I don't mind traveling anywhere for great food. Please Note: **The five stars is strictly for the food.** I have always had good service, but I come with my half Vietnamese friends so I'm not sure if that's why. Based on other reviews, service here is hit or miss.
I generally visit on Saturdays or Sundays so I can order their special the Bahn Xeo  since they are only offered those two days and I always have to have a bowl of their delicious pho. There is something about their broth that keeps me coming back. For those who don't really like pho, they also offer combo plates with rice with generous portions of meat and rice. Once you overlook this restaurant is located in a gas station you'll be happy you gave it a shot.

I go to this place pretty much every time I visit my parent in Gulfport and I am fan.I love the happy hour specials. If you are a local you get a card and you get happy hour all day everyday so having my parents live there always gives me a discount. The staff is very friendly, the drinks aren't expensive. It's a great place to sit down with friends and have some drinks and catch up. The upstairs section has a great view of the beach and it's definitely worth checking out!
Delicious tuna tartare & boiled shrimp.  Lovely outside dining.

A very different mexican food. We ordered - #6, with chile and cheese (Delish!), #4 with pork (good), chilly relleno with cheese (BEST), tamales pork (ok but the fish tamal looked better over sauce). I loved it but husband not so much.

This place is an adorable house in Greenwood that specializes in wine and Italian-esque food. In the summer, you can sit outside, under a gazebo, if you're lucky to score seats. The service is slightly slow, but perfect if you're just wanting to sit back, drink wine, and eat food. 

We ordered the goat cheese and caramelized onion pizza with the baked brie as an appetizer. The appetizer came out fairly quickly, but our pizza order apparently got lost. The server informed us and gave us a free appetizer while we waited, which was awesome. The brie was amazing, but I love brie so I might be biased. It came with a blackberry jam, which complimented the cheese nicely. The pizza was just okay. I wouldn't order it again, but I'm curious to try other things from the menu. Overall, good first impression of this place. I'd love to come back to drink more wine and try some other foods.

I finally got to try Seoul Fried Chicken the other night, and I think my mind is blown. I went for the five-piece combo with original chicken, slaw as my salad, and the corn fritter as my side (as opposed to fries). The chicken was crunchy and extremely juicy, while the slaw was fresh and had lots of hearty carrot in it. I loved the corn fritter, which was served in a milky, sweet liquid. I did not find the chicken too greasy, and the price point was great. The place is rather small with most people doing take out. You might have a hard time finding a seat if you want to dine in during the lunch or supper rush.

The staff here is super friendly. I dropped off a ridiculous amount of stuff (I think I had 7 pants and 5 sweaters) over the weekend, and they were ready for me Wednesday despite the lovely blizzard coming our way. Fairly priced, especially for Old City, I'm sure they will be getting a lot of business from me. I do wish they had some kind of deal though, like drop off stuff on Tuesdays, get 15 % off.   I can dream...

Love love Dutch bros. My favorite drink is the galaxy fish black tea with extra blackberry.  Omg so amazing. Definitely get that when you go. We also love the annihilator too.  I haven't tried very many drinks since their menu is humongous but will continue to try new drinks whenever I go.

For restaurant week, I decided to come back to the restaurant that was so good, it inspired me to start yelping. Unfortunately, I came away more disappointed than the first time. But...I feel like I can't complain too much. I mean, it was restaurant week, so they were packed. And I got SO much food for $30.12. Let me summarize the pros and cons of this visit:

PROS: Exceptional service. They were busy, so I almost expected slow service. But not at all- we were seated right away and had two people waiting on us. Love it when the waitstaff take initiative rather than wait for someone else to take care of the table. The appetizers were delicious- chicken cheese pot pie had an amazingly flaky crust and love the cherries inside. Ox tail was also great. Desserts were semi-sweet, as advertised. Love the apple, pumpkin beignets were okay- probably wouldn't order it again. Generally, though, flavors were spot on.

CONS: The main taysts were disappointing. The lamb came out and half of my cut had the texture of meatloaf. The other half was fine, which made me think it was not on purpose. So I looked over at a neighbor's lamb, and it was also the consistency of ground meat. Is that right? My neighbor was also not pleased and complained about his lamb. The meatballs were dry. The textures of the meats were just not good.

It was a great deal. But I feel like Tayst can do better.

The Matthew Ryan Veterinary Hospital was recommended to me by Banfield at Petsmart, after months of a smaller vet clinic telling me that it was just my dog's diet. It turns out that the bleeding in the stool was due to gastrointestinal cancer, and a tumor was removed during surgery. The surgery was gratis by the main veterinarian that took care of our 9 year old Shih Tzu, Max. My sister and I opted to do the cancer treatment which lasted for about a month and a half, until we had to take Max to the ER and have him put down. The warning that the main vet gave us was that if Max wasn't eating and not moving, he was in pain and had to be taken to the ER. The desk didn't offer any condolences as I was sobbing and telling them my choice to have Max cremated by himself so we could keep his ashes. About a week or so later, my sister went back to pick up his ashes, which was housed in a nice wooden chest with his name engraved on the top as well as two keys to open the lock. The experience was very hard for us. I had especially grown very attached to Max and was willing to do what it takes to try to save him. Although a vet had initially said he had 6 months, cancer is unpredictable. One day you could be fine, but the next day, you could be close to death. 

The veterinarians are one of the best in the country. They are very knowledgeable and answer any questions you may have. The vet that I often communicated with was very prompt in returning our phone calls and giving us very good information about what to expect. It was a very nice gesture that they removed the surgery fee which was the largest on the bill. Like all the vets I've seen, they genuinely care about your pet and it's QUALITY OF LIFE. I want to emphasize that because it was something that was often said, especially with a disease like cancer. At one point, the vet techs let us check out Max early because he was distressed and wanted to go home.

The vet techs are awesome. You can often see them walking dogs outside. They shower your dogs with kisses and really love animals. They provided the best support and really wanted the animals to feel at ease. This was important to us because Max had separation anxiety. The vet techs are awesome and I'm glad they had loving people to watch over Max.

The hospital is expensive, it made me glad I had decided to get pet insurance. If you are unable to pay the high bills, they do have a payment program. I think the price is worth it because you are getting the best care for your pet. 

The location is accessible by public transportation. You can park in the little lot in front of the hospital but there is a small fee. There is also metered street parking. The drop off area is pretty tight. I had to bring Max in for his chemotherapy pretty often so I was there about every other week. I dropped him off in the morning and picked him up at night when he was done. There is a small waiting area and I remember other owners waiting and talking about their pets and chemotherapy. Yeah, I wasn't the only one. Past the waiting area are some vending machines for soda, candy, and coffee.

Lastly, Banfield and the vet and the vet techs of Matthew Ryan sent us a condolence card after Max went to the Rainbow Bridge. It wasn't just a short message of "I'm sorry for your loss." They left nice messages talking about how sweet Max was and other things. There had to be about 10 people who signed that card. It really made us so incredibly happy. 

Max is in a happier place, ruling his shih tzu tribe. He really changed our lives and started this love affair for all dogs. He was given to us in his senior age and although we only had him for about 2 years, he made a huge impact on our lives. 

This was 2 years ago and I hope I don't have to go back for a long time but I do recommend this hospital and I think they are the best you can get for your pet.

My company had their holiday party in the Market and the General Store was open giving away chocolate covered pretzels. My drunk greedy ass went back several times over the course of the night and they put up with me every time and didn't argue with me. I woke up the next day hungover but happy when I saw all the chocolate covered pretzels in the fridge. I love the fun flavors and combination of candies they threw on the pretzels.

This was easily the highlight of our recent trip to New Orleans. Our tour guide was fun, knowledgeable, and easy to follow. We loved walking around the city at night and learning about the history. I wasn't expecting to enjoy the ghost tour as much as I did, but I would recommend it to anyone! 

The only bad part was the actual buying of the tickets. We stopped by throughout the day and no one was there at the ticket stand. When we arrived at the tour time, the woman siting there told us not to tell anyone that she wasn't there throughout the day. Then, she refused to take our credit card. Thank god we had cash. 

All in all, minus this minor mishap, check them out. Hopefully the woman who gave us so much trouble is no longer working here.

Can't really complain when it comes to all you can eat steak! I particularly loved the well seasoned sirloin cuts. The sides they provide for you including the bread and the mash potatoes were also worth noting. Even my friend who dislikes cheese love the cheesy bread. But of course, it was quite an amazing experience when it came to the meats. There was just so much my stomach didn't quite know how to respond at times, so definitely do pace yourself. In terms of the salad bar they had, they had a nice selection of items that provided a refreshing cleanse throughout the meal. The oranges were particularly sweet and so my friends and I loaded up on those at the end HAHA.

I've been searching for a Charming Charlies in the area of Indianapolis. I love Charming Charlies because:
1) It is a fashion jewelry store! I lovethis stuff!
2) Not only do they sell jewelry but a lot of accessories too! I've been able to score some really cute items such like my pink leopard print iPad holder.
3) Selection: Charming Charlies has a great selection of items that will dress up your everyday outfits. But they also have huge section for prom or a big night out. They now have a section just dedicated in this location for little girls.
4) Sale: There's always a very big clearance area. This the clearance section was buy one get one free so I scored three pairs of earrings and two big necklaces for only just $12!

So as you see I probably can tell if my review that I get overly excited just walking into the place. Of course I love the store is always color code in a coordinated but I love that I can always find something that I can quickly add to my wardrobe at a decent price. I LOVE Charming Charlie's! I'll be back!!!!

I am not a huge pizza person so when my group of friends decided that this is where we were going for dinner I wasn't that excited... but I'm here to tell you that I was surprised. 

We ordered a family style house salad and it was perfect. I loved that we could share it amongst four people pretty evenly. We then ordered a large BBQ chicken pizza and OMG was I wrong to not be excited. 

This pizza had so many layers of flavors. It was by far the most delicious BBQ chicken pizza I've ever had. The cheese and sauce and chicken were all to die for. I'm pretty sure I had two slices and let's be honest, that should be illegal. Lol 

But needless to say it has made its way on my crave list and I will be back.

If I were eating my last meal on Earth, raw oysters would definitely be one of the appetizers.  When my wife finally nagged me to make the 5 1/2 hour drive to New Orleans, Drago's immediately became a must stop during our culinary eating weekend.  My wife and I are BIG fans of the raw oysters but we had to stop at Drago's to try their much beloved chargrilled oysters.  We arrived at this location at 7 p.m. on Friday night and were quickly seated without any wait. As we walked by the open kitchen, where we saw the oysters getting shucked and grilled, our mouths began to water like a rabid canine.  

We ordered a dozen chargrilled oysters and a dozen of the raw oysters. I also ordered the grilled drum (similar to redfish) but the oysters were the reason we came.  The raw and chargrilled oysters arrived and we quickly noticed these oysters must have been hormone fed because they were gigantic.  The chargrilled oysters are as good as other reviewers say they are and lived up to our expectations.  

HOWEVER, we still loved the raw oysters more. That's because when you cook an oyster, you basically kill the natural flavors and they become whatever ingredient you put on them. In this case, they tasted like garlic, butter and wood fired smoke.  The sweet/salty brine and plumpness were gone from the chargrilled oysters. To us, it's like taking a piece of toro and chargrilling it.  Some things are meant to be eaten raw.  Thankfully, we were also able to enjoy the fantastic raw oysters.

As a footnote, the grilled drum was very good and would be a formidable star, if not for the brighter oyster star in this universe.

Came back with some friends for some bar food and I LOVE THIS PLACE. They have a set menu but their menu specials that change monthly are amazing! We got the filet tips which were amazing and the wings are always great. I recommend this place for anyone in the area for some delicious bar food and great vibes
LOVE this place! One of my favorites for dumplings in the city. Pork soup dumplings are a must here. Casual, bright setting with lots of windows.

I love zoos. Philly Zoo is no exception. Easy to navigate around, kept pretty clean, staff is friendly enough, and lots of animals and shade! The coolest part was the outside netted tunnels or whatever they're called that the monkeys and big cats could walk through to roam... right above you! It's like looking danger in the face! But safely.

I love this place, but it's very hit-or-miss. Some of the nights are much better than others, and even those can vary (sometimes depending on the weather). Tigerbeats is your best bet for a good Monday night dance party, especially in the summer, and the "ox blood" drink special really speaks to me. I have been on some other really fun dance nights too, like the new Mondo Trasho gay dance night, and look forward to the next "Through Being Cool" party too. 

Though I have heard horror stories about people being rude here, I have never felt anything but welcome, and it's nice to have a unique bar that definitely caters to the clientele it serves. Yeah, it's a bit dank and divey... I don't want to know the last time the bathrooms were cleaned. But every city needs a place like that, right?

I love all my Philly Ritzes. I can always count on at least one of them to be showing a film that I want to see. More often than not Ritz East, Ritz at the Bourse and Ritz 5 are ALL featuring films on my "wanna see" list.

I love independent films the most. I love foreign films and art joints. Here's where you find em in Filmadelphia (I'm the worst). Ritz East is well-maintained, clean and comfortable. I am a fan.

 I love going to see films and then being able to ramble incessantly with friends willing or otherwise about what we've seen. Judging by the thin-lipped smiles and glazed over expressions on their faces, I'm sure that I take it to an insufferable level; as is my way. Maybe it's just that I keep repeating the word, "film," over and over. I really geek over this stuff. 

One of my favorite things in Philly life is to hatch a plan where we go catch what's playing at one of the Ritzes, then go for a drink/meal/bite along our walking way to another nearby Ritz, another movie. 

How bout a movie-meal crawl? For when you're feelin like you deserve some fun and special treatment. It's a nice little movie-meal-movie-meal cycle. Double double feature, get me?

I do love all my Ritzes, and this one is a beaute.

We decided to stop in one Sunday for brunch Don't expect to be seated immediately, we waited for about half an hour outside before we got a table. Seating is community-style, which was great as we are very friendly people and there were just two of us. 

I could see how this may not be good for groups due to the community seating. That being said, I loved that we got to make friends with the couple of ladies sitting next to us.

We ordered the bologna scone (no longer available), ancient grain porridge, and potato & celeriac latke. The scone was excellent and delightfully surprising with the bits of salty bologna. The porridge was very good and I would wait in line again just for that. The latke was unique and lighter than a traditional normal all potato latke, and the onion marmalade was tasty.

The vibe was relaxed and friendly, but service was relatively slow and pretty loud. The building it is in is very unique and has tall ceilings and that may have been what caused the higher volume. 

All in all, this is my favorite $30 brunch in the city- a little pricey but a great place to eat and hang out, something that is not common at other brunch places.

Love this place! Definitely found my new Poke spot in Philly. Quick/Fresh/Healthy. Super simple setup with a friendly staff. I did the create your own - regular size. 

More than enough food to feel full for the price of $9.67.

I'll back soon enough =D

My husband and so love to eat here - particularly for lunch. Others have figured it out as well because it is always packed! 30 minute wait at noon today so we sat at the bar. Their lunch menu is HUGE and CHEAP!  Service was fast, even with the bar being busy. The bread and olive oil is always warm and fresh. We both had different soups. Lobster bisque was flavorful, although not necessarily the best I've had. Husband loved the steak chili. He had a side salad and we shared two sides - deviled eggs and sweet potato fries. Everything tasted great. We've eaten here many times - dinner is great, but the lunch value is what keeps bringing us back!

We order pizzas and desserts all the time. Everything is awesome! The delivery is quick, and the food is awesome. We just tried the bbq chicken pizza for the first time and loved it! My husband says he has never liked bbq chickenn pizza, but agreed to try it- very good surprise! Also favorite: pesto and white zas.

Loved it!

Great location and food. The whole fish special was more than I could handle: amazing taste, hearty, perfectly prepped cauliflower... what a meal. 

Apps of bacon wrapped dates, mussels in a tangy sauce, well prepared and not heavily battered fresh calamari, and a few other small plates served our group well. Wine list long though prices not friendly, oh well.

This Mexican restaurant is decent at best. It is a tiny spot in the Fishtown area, but was able to accommodate a large group of 15 in a side room area. I do love the fact that the place is byob also, so you can save a little cash from buying drinks. They will also make margaritas for you if you bring your own tequila. Our waiter was patient with our large group and was able to accommodate our large group.

The food wasn't bad I felt. The nachos were stacked with toppings, but the chicken was a bit dry. I ordered Cancun tacos as my entree. They were ok, but needed more of that spicy sauce and more than a tiny piece of tilapia. At least the prices weren't high there. Not bad, I would go again if I wanna save on drinking.

I had wanted to visit this Cafe for months and when I got off work early Friday afternoon, I figured it was the perfect time to drop in. 

First impressions were great - I loved the decor and the atmosphere. There was ample seating inside the bright and airy cafe. I chose to sit outside as it was the first lovely day of summer and they had almost a dozen tables outside to pick from. 

I understand they have a great menu but I just had a chai latte. It was the perfect drink for Friday afternoon, sitting on the patio. And the staff were lovely!

I'll be back to check out more of this cute and local cafe!

Because I live out of my car, and am a coffee junkie, I normally frequent coffee shops with green awnings, white letters, and a siren adorning their paper cups.  I do this out of necessity.

When I have more time to linger, and require something more "real" and less franchise, I stop by Monon Coffee Company.  

I love the self-serve "honor system" coffee station.  It's also a great place to grab some delicious Rene's baked goods.

If you just need a little treat, try one of the walnut bites.

Popped in here for the first time today for a very late lunch. Win.

Template: Cafe on the left, beer lover's paradise on the right. I'm not a beer drinker so I can only judge on the food - which was superb.

Ham and brie on a croissant could be a win, or a fail... here it is definitely win. Flaky fresh perfect croissant + thinly sliced ham + brie = delicious. Add sides of a small pile of nuts, a handful of fresh red grapes and an apple sliced and then drenched in honey? Oh, yes please.

The build out is excellent - heck, I remember when the joint was a dog grooming place and a junky furniture shop - huge step up from there. Side room has a small stage for music acts, and I'm told the happy hour can be SRO. Chatted with the bartender and food prep guys for a while - great neighborhood place. Wish it was here back when I lived in Seminole Heights. Yeah, a definite great addition to the 'hood.
They sell Framboise, I mean really? I love this place even more purely because of this fact alone!

Visited this place twice and they definitely have earned their 5 star rating! Both experiences began with a nice warm welcome, followed by quick service, great coffee, and delicious little desserts!

One instance, the woman who helped us (possibly the manager/owner?) was very friendly and helped our incredibly indecisive group make decisions we were all happy with! She made some really great recommendations and even let us try a couple samples! I can't remember specifically what we ordered because we just ordered a bunch as a group and honestly everything we got was delicious!!

The second visit, same woman helped us, same great attitude and service! This time I tried a creme brûlée special they had which was FANTASTIC! So happy that I tried it!!

The place is always nice and clean, they love dogs, parking is on Central and usually not an issue, and the whole experience is just nice and positive!!

So much fun here. Free old school video games I. The top floor. I went here on the anniversary and saw a wedding party. Kind of magical

The beers are strong nothing outside of mainstream.

They have a fun that I want to try. I have heard it is outside the normal St. Louis distribution. But is will go back gain. 

I love this place come twice support your people!!!

From the moment we walked in Rincon Beach Club we were greeted by warmth and hospitality. After visiting numerous venues we accidentally came across Rincon Beach Club through Yelp. Right after dinner we drove there and knew that this was the place for us. We scheduled an appointment and after the first meeting we were in love! Every venue we had visited made us feel like an "appointment" but Carol and Marc made us feel like we were at home. It was all the little things...The way they had a box of desserts as a gift for us (and their desserts are BOMB), or the way they dressed up the venue for a mock wedding for us that brought me to tears. This couple is really such an inspiration because they are doing what they love. Every step of the way they strive to make your event so special. It's because of this passion they have helped us make our wedding a reality. 

Guests could not stop talking about how great the food was and so many people told me they had 2-3 plates of food. All our desserts were gone at the end of the night! I love this catering company from the bottom of my heart! They host events at their venue and are also able to cater to the venue of your choice.

Highly recommend them!

Sometimes while shopping at this buffalo, I feel like they are selling used clothing for the same price as new clothing but it is still possible to find some rarities or even some real steals. You can even find new clothing there. I like how they arrange the clothes according to which holiday/celebration is coming up, for example, all of the red dresses are placed on the front racks before The Red Dress Run comes up. It is a fun place to try new things since they have every kind of style, from hardcore punk stuff to preppy things. They also have some of the cutest jewelry but almost every piece I've bought has broken super quickly. Sometimes I barely make it out of the store before it breaks. I also wasn't a huge fan of the dress selection last time I was in, lots of patterns that kind of hurt your eyes and cuts that were not flattering. When trading or selling, Buffalo loves brand names, in season items or extremely unique pieces. They wont take most of your clothes but they can donate items you no longer want. The new store is a lot bigger with way more breathing room.

My goodness. For starters if you are not native to Indianapolis and are visiting our just moved here Yats is a MUST! It is a staple in Indy and for all intensive purposes, its is a site to see and a meal to taste. I ALWAYS get the Chilli Cheese Etoufee with extra bread - the bread is to DIE for... Sometimes when I make Spaghetti or pasta (at home), I stop in and grab some bread for my meal... Its .50 cents and that amazing!

The thing that puts Yats over the top is their famous Peanut Butter Pie.... My goodness! Sometimes me and the hubz crave it and go just to get the pie alone. If they dont have it, we are in a bad mood for up to a week and are hella cranky. 

But we love us some Yats and the prices are unbeatable. We also love the dining experience! Yay Yats!

I am a fan.

Wait, I am more than a fan. I am in awe of the awesomeness that is Revolucion.

It's like Nacho Libre meets a street food taco stand meets a full bar meets your senses and it's a fantastic experience.  

Best parts:

1. Exposed rafters in the roof. Mexican art all around. Nice touch that keeps the place authentic and real.
2. Full bar. We're talking my dream of tequila options, your import and domestic bottle beers, and a nice spread of craft beers on tap.
3. Fresh Mexican tacos. Not tex-mex.
4. Homemade salsa and a wide array of hot sauces to add for flavor and zest.
5. An elusive tiki bar that I haven't been to yet but which the idea of makes me an extremely excited toucan. Or whatever.
6. Beautiful, colorful, Mexican-themed paintings made by local artists. I mean, I would love a house full of this kind of art.
7. Space. Lots of it! The floor plan is nice and open, accommodating large parties easily, as well as lots of small tables. Looks like they could even fit a mariachi band in one corner no problem.

Basically, you can't go wrong at Revolucion. It's the last place in Indianapolis I'm planning to eat before moving, and that says something.

In my line of work I spend a great deal of time going to conferences all over the United States. I have had the opportunity to experience a number of schmancy hotels but this Ritz Carlton is by far my favorite.

If you were looking for a great place to host conferences, etc. The Ritz Carlton will work with you to help make the experience affordable and memorable. From the menus, to the venues. From the courtyard to the ballrooms. Everything is perfection.

I think what I find most humorous in having worked with this hotel on conference business is that my conference attendees commented most often about how much they loved the gardenia candle in the lobby. I have to admit, though. It is a pretty damn awesome candle.

In the conference managers at the hotel are top notch! I can't say enough about how great they are! I only wish I could host every conference here.

Love this theater and love the location! There are dinner spots around and who doesn't love dinner and a movie! Okay so love the large theaters the super duper great sound and the concession stand options! The usual popcorn (buy the loyalty shirt $25 for a whole year free medium popcorn or upgrade to large or extra lg for quarters on the $1) soda (loyalty cups like $6 and free refills for a year) and candy! Oh wait there's more- they have personal pizza s, cheese sticks, popcorn chicken and more! Oh and for those screaming babies they have a daycare!!! Please check in those screaming babies on an opening weekend- please!

My allegiance to my tried-and-true order of the Ultimate Warrior (sausage, pepperoni, olives, onions, mushrooms and green peppers) is wavering. That's because I tried the King of Hearts on my last visit. Needless to say, it's won a place in my heart.

Topped with slices of delicious artichoke hearts, this pizza pie is a winner. The mushrooms and olives (two of my favorite toppings) add to the party.

But the real winners? 1) The bacon. I'm not a bacon lover, but it adds just enough crunch and meatiness that I'm sold. 2) What are those little nuggets of salty flavor?? Ahh, CAPERS! Great addition -- get a bite of some artichoke heart, a little caper, and some bacon -- party in your mouth.

The first one in Edmonton, so we had to check it out. It was JUST like the ones we visiting in the States so this review started out as 4 stars with the food and vibe feeling right on par with our expectation. 
The biggest downside for us was the wait. We did read the reviews ahead of time and expected about an hour wait, the part that kind of threw us off was the hour wait and then a secondary line to go into after we handed in our buzzer...more waiting. Of course then there is the wait for food. When we did get in we noticed a huge empty section. I will say I am glad they took our phone number and we were free to wander the mall while we waited so we didn't have to stay super close and we could check on Yelp what number we were at in the wait. Since the mall was closing when we went there was no where to go but wait. They should really put in more benches around that area of the mall now that so many people are there waiting. 
Mind you our server was super and very lovely - kept us posted on food time and entertained us with some quotes and trivia. We love that Forest Gump is constantly playing on the tvs, our table wasn't facing one so that was a bit of a bummer but there was plenty of paraphernalia to look at and talk about. 
We always order shrimp here(Shrimpers Heaven to be specific), you have to get the coconut shrimp it is amazing! But this time we had a fairly big and Hungry group so we also ordered the southern fried chicken, Jenny's catch with lobster butter sauce, the Run Across America sampler platter, and one other fish dish. These other dishes were all super tasty! I would highly recommend any of them. But we definitely didn't have any leftovers from our hungry crew of 5.

I ordered DoorDash from here on the last night of my trip to New Orleans. After days of eating Cajun cuisine I was craving some veggies, broth and noodles, what I consider to be comfort food. I splurged and got enough for early dinner and a late night meal. Let me tell you THIS PLACE DID NOT DISAPPOINT!!!!!!

The pho broth is flavorful and came with so much beef and meatballs. The bean sprouts were super clean and crunchy. The broth was still hot and the rare brisket were sliced thin and cooked quickly in the hot soup. 

The dry noodle dish came loaded with fresh veggies. The egg roll I decided to add was so flavorful and the outside was still nice and crunchy. Loved the sauce that came on the side, perfect compliment to the noodles and veggies. 

Spring rolls were simply delicious also. All the foods were very well packaged. No leakage, plenty of silverware and napkins.

I've walked place this place so many times on the way to get brunch at Sabrina's but I never remembered to check it out at a different time (I don't explore all the great options on Callowhill as much as I should). Thanks to my classpass, though, I jumped at the opportunity to take a class here. I hear the drop in rates are decent and if I wanted to take more classes at this studio than my class pass allows, which I might!, I wouldn't be upset with the prices. This studio is SUPER clean. I know most studios that you go to are pretty clean, however, I found this place to be immaculate. It's got wood floors all throughout and walking around barefoot I didn't pick up any floor dust or anything. 

I went to the 90 min hot vinyasa flow with Cecile (spelling?- sorry if it's wrong). I think 90 min was too much for me, I usually go for 60 min classes and consider 75 min classes to be pushing myself. I loved the pace of the class though; it was slower, even though we were doing sun salutations and we were able to hold stretches for longer. It was really beneficial and I felt rejuvenated after leaving. Another great thing is that there are no windows and the heat is real! It's not some open air space (which is nice sometimes) that uses space heaters and claims to be a hot yoga studio. This is legit 95 degrees and you will sweat! Make sure to bring water to class and a towel for your mat and yourself. The instructor was great, she came around and helped every person at least once through the various poses. The only thing I didn't like is that we did a lot of hip stretches that required us to be on one of our knees and my knee started getting really irritated after our second set of hip openers. I would have preferred pigeon pose or something else. Lastly, I didn't think I wouldn't like the no mirrors deal at this place, but I actually really liked it. I felt like I had a greater awareness of where my body was and I wasn't concerned with what other people were doing or what I looked like to other people. I'll definitely be back here!

I'd give 4.5 stars if I could. This is a lovely space in a neighborhood that is reviving. Lovely warm colors, Edison lamps, and decor. Nice specialty cocktail list with something for everyone. I have had the pretzels (the honey Harissa dipping sauce is terrific), two different flatbreads, two different soups, and the schwarma. I think they excel at the starters and especially the cold fruit soups-one was mango Masala, the other apricot yogurt. Both amazing. Waitstaff is affable and timely, and nice mix of neighborhood folks, hipsters and everywhere in between. This is between my girlfriend's place in Tower Grove East and mine in Lafayette Square, so I envision many more visits. Easy access from Jefferson south off 44. This is worth a visit. Oh, they have a game night on Tuesday-have not been to that yet.

I've only been here twice and I already love this place.  I saw the sign for a bakery out of the corner of my eye as I was driving down Bearss Avenue and was curious what the place was like. La Familia is a charming Mexican bakery. While there are two small tables outside you can sit at this is more of a place where you grab your items and go. There are display cases to your front and left as you walk in showing all sorts of wonderful looking treats. There are donuts, conchas, muffins, cookies, cakes, just to name a few. My favorite dessert I've tried so far was a rectangular slice of vanilla cake with peach and guava waves decorating the top.  It was delicious!  Their cuban sandwich felt like a brick in my bag it had so much weight to it.  The cuban bread was excellent also.  I've also tried their ham and egg sandwich, which also was a substantial amount of food. Their prices are also great!  I was very surprised that every dessert in the side display cabinet is only 99 cents. The people that work here were very patient with me with my endless "What's that?" questions. I'm looking forward to coming back and trying many different things!

My good friend was providing us a tour of the Santa Barbara County Courthouse which is located at 1100 Anacapa Street, in downtown Santa Barbara. If you are a lover of architecture, this Spanish Colonial Revival style building is quite an enjoyable visit. I always was in great belief that Greeks had a hand in some way in almost every new architecture structure that exists and they definitely did with this structure. The new building replaced a smaller Greek revival courthouse at one time long ago.  

We visited the clock tower, which has many views from all directions. The clock tower mechanics some levels below was surely quite impressive engineering. I also enjoyed reading the history painted on the walls in the beautifully architected main court room. This is an active court house to this day and it is surely worth the visit and especially for those love creative architecture.
LOVE this place! they have a great selection and everybody who works here have always been so nice and helpful!!! check them out!

4 stars for the quality of service and food. Don't get me wrong, the food tasted fantastic but it came to us almost cold. Granted it is January and we are right by the harbor but it couldn't have been this cold the moment it came out of the kitchen and onto our table. I ordered clam chowder & lobster pasta. My boyfriend got the uni and scallop & lobster roll. He said he enjoyed them both, although he wasn't quite sure if the uni & scallop were worth their price. I loved the clam chowder - so much meat in it and it didn't feel like it was just all soup. Unfortunately, today was the day that I found out I am lactose intolerant so I didn't react well to the soup. My pasta was very flavorful, however. Big chunks of lobster in it!! Well worth its price.

Service was phenomenal - very nice and prompt. The wait time wasn't terrible, and I was surprised because it's New Year's Day! Parking wasn't too tough to find. There's a lot of places where you could park 90 minutes for free. Highly recommend this place if you're in the Santa Barbara area.

True Story.
The menu is huge.  

The owner is awesome and generous, and the food is as rich is New Orleans is hot.  Jacques-Imo's has the best red fish I have ever had.  Hands down.  The corn bread is uh-mazin.  Duck breast was delicious.  Fried green tomatoes are so freaking good.  Alligator cheese cake radical.  This sure is some down home cookin.  This place don't claim to be fancy, doesn't want to be delicate and doesn't try to be something it's not.  The locals love it, and for good reason.  Even the best food heads in town will recommend this place.  It's an institution!

Usually when a menu is very large I am skeptical, and I have trouble picking what to order.  The good news is that all of the food here is good so whatever is ordered will be tasty.  

I had one of the best times I had in New Orleans here with some of my local buddies and owe it all to them and Jacq.  Thanks.  Seriously!

I've been wanting to eat here ever since I had heard about it, but it's a bit of a drive (not really). It's also a bit pricey, so it's not a place I would normally just drop by if I'm in the area. The menu looks fantastic, so it was only a matter of time.

The decor is not what one would picture when thinking of a British restaurant, kind of rustic with lots of rough wood and brick. There are a bunch of British inspired accents of which my favorite was a large canvas with London busses and street signs.

The menu is filled with British staples like rarebit, scotch eggs, black pudding, sausage rolls, bangers and mash, and fish n chips, but invigorated with new ingredients. For example, take the fish n chips; Icelandic cod, anchovy dill remoulade, house made clam ketchup and malt vinegar. The whole menu is filled with unique and wonderful sounding food.

We started with a couple drinks and thankfully, the menu filled with a lot of European macro beers, also had a good selection of local craft beer. The wine selection was decent and varied and they offered gin, whiskey, and port as well.

After drinks, we chose the cucumber & charred cabbage salad (cucumber, caramelized pumpkin seeds, tarragon, mint and deep fried breadcrumbs) and the crispy fried eel (brown butter and birch stout emulsion, eel, and breadcrumbs again and some greens). Both were excellent and left us wanting more.

Thankfully, those were just appetizers and soon enough our chestnut pasta and braised beef cheek pie mains arrived. The chestnut pasta (pasta, brown butter, mushroom chestnut truffle sauce, crispy sage, pea shoots, stilton chunks, and more fried breadcrumbs) was excellent, but the truffle seemed overpowering initially. I don't know if I happened to get too much at once, or the flavour mellowed over time. I don't want to detract from this dish too much, because it was excellent. The beef cheek pie (beef cheeks, mixed with mushroom, anchovy, smoked champ with a layer of mash on top) was great. The pie crust was perfect the filling was fantastic but very rich. It took me a long time to eat this, not only because it was rich, but also quite big. However, there was no doubt in my mind that I was going to finish it.

Despite us both being full, we had to try at least one dessert and for our choice we got the trifle (custard, currant, saskatoon jam, sherry soaked cake, and fried breadcrumbs). This was another good dish and a nice finish to our meal.

Chef Lindsay has got a great menu here and I can't wait to try out some other amazing sounding dishes. However, we wondered if we chose the only 4 dishes on the menu with fried breadcrumbs, so we asked the waiter and we pretty much did, although he suggested that chef loves them. One final note, London Local does a 3 course Sunday roast for $30...that ought to be a winner.
