So, I love sweet potatoes.  I love them.  So, I really enjoy their fries.  I wish the fries were a bit crispier because they are pretty damned soggy and smushed down into that cup.

The presentation of both the burger and the side is also very well done.

The only major downside is the place fills up fast and has an incredible wait on Friday nights, Saturday nights, and so of the other weekdays as well. Basically, if you wait until 7 to try to go to Burger Up, then you are going to be eating around 8:30...  just a heads up.

I've been here a few times on the weekend for drinks. It has a fun vibe, but gets really packed. I've been meaning to come in sometime during the week to try the food and see the Trestle in a more relaxed state.

What I can comment on is: 
1.The large selection of whiskey AND beer. I'm not a whiskey person, so I love having the ability to order a craft beer at a whiskey bar.

2.The go-go dancers. They are there, and they are entertaining, but they don't have to be your main focus...there is enough going on elsewhere.

3. The fact that you can barely move on the weekends because it is so packed.

We finally made it to Vetri, a first for both my fiancé and me (with the exception of a preview night for their fabulous upstairs renovations). Of course, the entire evening was absolutely wonderful. 

I'm the kind of person who checks out a menu before I go to a restaurant, and I typically know exactly what I'm going to order. At Vetri, you are presented with a menu of possibilities and asked simply to mention anything that you definitely do not want, or even that you definitely do want. Despite my Type A tendencies, I absolutely loved sitting back and letting the kitchen run the show. 

We opted for the lesser of the two wine pairings, which was still very pricey. The pairings were spot on and every wine was terrific. I was impressed. I'm sure the higher-end pairing is mind blowing. 

Course after course arrived during the evening, and everything was perfectly paced. I can't recall every single thing that I ate but every course was exciting. My favorites were the pastas, and there were lots of them. Another big standout for me was the antelope. I had no idea what to expect but I was really pumped to try something new. The meat was absolutely delicious - tender and lean and super flavorful. I was pretty full by the dessert course, and I'm not a huge sweets person anyway, so I mostly focused on my dessert wine, which was great. 

As for a return visit, of course, I'd absolutely love one. However, with the cost for two topping out around the neighborhood of $600, it's going to be a while (or an unexpected financial windfall!) before it will happen again. Until then, I've got my memories!

Just as tasty as my 1st visit to Dewey's at the Webster Groves location.  I love that you can get your pizza split half red sauce, half white sauce (an olive oil blend).  This time we got the seasonal Italian-style for our red half and the Wild Mushroom for the white half.  The Wild Mushroom on cheese and olive oil was much better than I even expected.

The side salads are big enough to split between two people, especially if you're getting pizza as well.  We split a side of the House Salad and got the 17" (middle size) pizza between 2 of us and had 2 slices left over for later.

Dear Peppermill, 
Thank you for one of the greatest weekends of my life. About 20 of us showed up for a friends 30th birthday celebration. Your rooms were large, the suites we partied in were enormous. Three flat screen t.v.'s in one room? Your nuts! A bathtub the size of my house, and the biggest bathroom ever. Big comfortable beds helped me fall into a drunken sleep as soon as my head hit the pillow. 
We went to the Cafe for every meal and were able to find something different and tasty on the menu each time. On the last day of our stay I visited the amazing swimming pool with the biggest (unnatural) waterfall I have ever seen. Also ate at the all you can drink Champagne buffet, and the food was surprisingly good. Most buffets blow in my book. Hope to come back here again when in the area. 
Love, Noel. 
P.S. Thank you for letting me get away with just about anything and letting me win some at the roulette table.

Barbara's Home Cooking is based out of a house, which makes it all that much more adorable to me.  Doesn't get any more homey than that.  While we were driving down we even drove right past it, mistaking it for just another house.  It's got the cutest little patio, with tables and chairs scattered about, and a homemade menu sign just propped on a table.  I love places like this.  We went around 12:30 on a Friday afternoon and this little place was bustling!  They clearly do pretty well here.  Our server was the lady who owns the place (Barbara?  I feel terrible I didn't catch her name) and she happily chatted with us while still making her time to mosey around the restaurant and take care of other patrons.  I really like the relaxed atmosphere, it feels like going to eat at a relative's house.

After chewing down on the delicious warm rolls were served as soon as we sat down, I ordered the catfish as my entree, though I did give pause to consider the fried chicken and the pork chops.  Out of all the side options, I was very intrigued by the pineapple casserole and the sweet potato casserole, but I played it safe and picked collard greens and green beans instead.  

Mmm I need to go out of my way to eat more catfish.  Deliciously crispy and flaky on the outside, with the fish meat inside soft. My greens were on the bland side, but I nibbled at my fiancé's Mac and cheese side and it was delicious.  I simply  made the mistake of trying to be "healthy" and missed out on indulging properly.  Next time I'll try the casseroles.  Oh? And did I mention that this place has dessert?  Will have to update after I go back to stuff myself with some of their banana pudding!

Best Mexican food in Indy! I love Mexican food and this place has been consistently delicious! Me and my husband love it and we are customers for life. Don't let the size of the place fool you! Everything on the menu is good and the horchata drink is great to wash it down! Don't sleep on this place?
This place has it going on! Love love love it!! Wish I had more dinero to spend here!

My girlfriends and I went to Susanna Foo for Restaurant Week reservation #1. Decor is great, loved the beautiful plates that were on the table (even though they were cleared immediately). 

Service was very disappointing. Our waiter took quite a while to come over to us at all. When he did, he took our wine order without giving us menus. By the time we got our wine and menus, we were starving. He was semi-present all night.

Food was excellent. I had the butternut squash which was the best I've had. Entree was beef shortrib, which I could cut with a fork since it was so tender. For dessert I had the molten chocolate cake which was very good. Everyone else was happy with their food, but the only other thing I tried was the chicken dumplings, which were great.

I'm not sure if I'd go back, because I definitely like Buddakan better for Asian fusion. It was a good, not great, experience overall.

Last weekend, I decided to stop mourning the loss of Fathom Seafood and go to EGG for brunch. I wanted to hate this place out of sheer bitterness but I have to admit, my brunch was awesome. I cant' speak for dinner for yet, but everything we ordered for brunch was great. 

I had the crab hash with a sunny egg which was fantastic. I couldn't stop eating it. Everything went really well together and even better with a bit of ketchup. Next time I go back, I will definitely order the sunny eggs over grit cakes. My friend ordered it and it looked awesome. 

That aside, the atmosphere was easy going our waiter was amazing at refilling our waters which was absolutely necessary after the Saturday night we all had. I appreciated it more than he probably knew. 

All and all, I really loved my brunch and will absolutely go back in the future. I still miss Fathom, but EGG has given me hope that I may just get over that void in my life.

I love the setting and the dynamic of this swanky, neighborhood deli.  The eclectic staff made the experience worth every penny and more! Being a lover of all things Blues, the pictures of soulful vocalist lining the walls of the cozy restaurant made me feel right at home.  As I glanced at the pictures, blues tunes pranced through my head as I enjoyed my Benton Park sandwich, at the recommendation of the cashier, and an Abita Amber.  I was visiting St. Louis for work, but if I lived anywhere nearby, I would most certainly be a regular.  No complaints...

Holla, back to Pi almost exactly one year later! Because I'm all about devout worship of the thin crust I went for that this time, although fond memories of the deep dish almost made me choose otherwise.

Glad I went for the thin crust, as it too is cornmeal and perfectly crispy. For saucy me, I got extra sauce, plus mushroom, kalamata olives and spinach. Damn, that is some good pizza! 

Damn Damn DAMN that is some good pizza!

I'm staying in the Moonrise across the street and I have a feeling I'll be looking at all of these vintage moon photos that are everywhere, but instead of moons, I'll be seeing some Pi pizzas with big smiley faces in them. Maybe it'll be *me* transposed in Gibson girl attired in the photo as well, sitting on the pizza moons, gazing up at the pizza moons with love. Falling OFF the pizza moons. Fondling the nose of a pizza moon. OK, that's kind of creepy. But hilarious. Yup, I'm creepy, hilarious and I love Pi pizza.

In fact, I am going to make certain that I dream of Pi tonight as well. 

Love this place! Can't you tell?

There are a lot of places to get a burger out there, including restaurants that claim, like Burger Up, it as their specialty. 

What sets burger up apart from the competition is the quality of food they serve. I've been to this location twice, and to another location once, but I've had some of the best burgers each time. This time I had The Ramsey. Not sure why it's named such, but I go to Nacho Libre for answers. "The Ramsey is number one... The Ramsey's pimento cheese is number one... The Ramsey's bacon is number one..."

I loved this burger. The pimento cheese was creamy and flavorful, but didn't distract from the perfectly cooked burger. Throw a little local bacon in there and call it a southern burger like no other. I would come back for this burger again and again. 

My only "beef" keeping Burger Up from getting 5 stars is the service. The waitstaff, though kind, is typically slow and unattentive.

I ordered a bunch of pastries to go.
The carrot cake whoopie pie was delicious. It was moist and very flavorful.
The raspberry thumbprint cookie was passable. I wanted a bit more raspberry jam. Maybe it'd work better as a cookie sandwich.
The ginger cookie was dense and moist. I loved how mildly sweet it was and it definitely had a kick of ginger.
The pretzel chocolate chip cookie was also very good.
Overall, I found most of the pastries to have the perfect sweetness. They also had great texture and were moist.

Now that I've been here for a few concerts, it's time for a review. I can't give it 5 stars because it is an arena. I much prefer a smaller to medium size venue when I see live shows. Lucky for me that most of the bands I see play in the small to medium-sized venues. 

There are occasions where I do have to venture into a large space to see some of my favorites though. 

The shows I've been to here are Tool, A Perfect Circle, and most recently, Florence + The Machine. 

The first thing to be said for this arena is the size of it. Yes... it's an arena so it's large. Most arenas are built for NBA teams or college basketball teams. I'm not sure of the exact reason this arena was built but it seems to have been built for the local hockey team and as a concert space. Since that seems to be the case, it's somewhere in between a medium and large arena space. I don't love it but it's okay when seeing larger acts.

This last experience here, I had to take advantage of the First Aid station. I was starting to get a headache. I went straight to Bridgestone's website, found where the First Aid room was with ease and went there to get an ibuprofen. Kudos to the arena for making it easy. 

In closing, if you love smaller acts but they grow to support a venue like this and they play there... you'll have a good time I believe. Buy the tickets and go have fun.

How have I not written a review for this place yet?! That's insane. How have I not told the public about their delicious fried chicken with spicy honey? Or about their delicious 5-cheese Mac?! Or their beyond amazing collard greens that converted me into a lover of collards? And what of their crunchy fries? And those fricking biscuits with blackberry jam and honey butter?! And omg their spoonbread. Omg.

Okay y'all. It's okay. *slaps myself* You guys, this is not a drill. Any sweet tea fans out there? THEIR SWEET TEA IS MADE WITH MAPLE SYRUP!! It's honestly one of my most favorite sweet teas in town and I almost docked them a star on not having to-go cups available for me to enjoy this outside of their establishment after downing 15 cups of it during lunch or dinner.

Eagle. You guys work on getting me to-go cups. I'll keep bringing you business. I shit you not, I have coworkers from NYC and other big cities who beg to come back to eat here or have me ship them your food. What a great place. Service is always nice too!

August 23, 2014 Saturday - 5 PM VIP Ticket

Atmosphere - 4.5 stars
Beer - 4 stars
Service - 4 stars 

Background - Thanks to Yelp I got to go to another amazing beer festival.  Thanks Michael T! 
 
Soup Box - They did not list the designated driver option at all on their website for ticket sales.  I would have loved for my wife to go but to pay for a full price ticket was pointless as she was not going to drink.  After I was there I did find out that there was an option to buy.  The other thing I did not like about the website was that they did not describe what the difference between a regular ticket and VIP was.

Atmosphere - Peppermill's Tuscany Ballroom which is a huge ball room that was the home to the event this year.   Which I found made moving from one station to the next with ease even after the place filled up with all the participants.  The only thing I disliked was the darkness, it made picture taking of the beer cans difficult and to the point I just gave up.

Beer - The can beer has really taken off for the craft beer industry.  The two biggest advantages of a can is that it prevents light from destroying the beer.  Yes light hurts the beer, just like our skin is affected, kills cells.  The other big thing is the distribution cost; beer cans are much lighter then glass.  For me I think that some cans are more artistic, the imagery is amazing.  21st Amendment Brewery is leading the way with their clever beer names with art to match.  My favorite is Brew Free! Or Die IPA.  http://21st-amendment.com/beers/brew-free/
    There were several breweries listed on the website that were not in attendance.  I was disappointed as the breweries I did noticed missing from the activities were the ones that do not sell in the Reno area.  
  The best part of the night was the accessibility of some of the brew masters.  It was great talking to them and hearing the pride they take in their work.

Service - Thanks to all the volunteers working the event helping some these small breweries pour the beers for us.

Yelp's Booth - That place was rocking with a steady group of people checking the stuff out!

Future - Beer and lots of choices that you cannot get in Reno, yes I will be back.

The Good- First off, I love cuban food. I usually stick with the cuban sandwich (El Cubano) which includes roasted pork, ham, swiss cheese, mustard and pickles. I usually get it el mini sized (smallest size) with the combo of a drink and a side (I either go with sweet plaintains or the black bean soup). The sandwich itself is delicious, with awesome salty pork flavor. Their plaintains can be hit or miss, as I sometimes get really mushy plaintains. Definitely enough to fill up on with the el mini combo.

The Pad- Right on the broad ripple strip which is nice if you are walking around or grabbing a bite to eat with friends. The eating area isn't particularly large but it was clean and I loved being able to sit at the bar in the front window. The employees are also very friendly and happy to have you come in!

The Ugly- A little one the pricey side for what you are getting in my opinion. ~$10 a sandwich is the only thing stopping me from coming here constantly.

Working on the Eastside of Indy, I've received b-e-a-utiful arrangements from George Thomas on birthdays or "just because" occasions.  All have been vibrant and ever-so lovely.  Now, if I have a reason to give someone flowers, George Thomas is the first place I visit.  The staff is friendly, the prices are reasonable (even with the delivery charge), and the arrangements bring smiles to everyone's face.  It's a win-win-WIN situation for me!

I go to Tampa a few times for work and I always either drink the crappy coffee at the hotel, the crappy coffee at work, or Cuban coffee which keeps me up for days. I never thought to look for a cute little coffee shop until my bf accompanied me on a trip. He had to find one ASAP because there's no way he was drinking the coffee from the place where they wear green aprons. 

So, while I'm at work he finds Buddy Brew and tells me all about how cool it is. So now I'm jealous because all I've had is crappy work coffee. Then he bought a bag of beans for the house and I cherished every last bean. So good.

Now all I know is that I needs this coffee. He went with me again and took me to his new found coffee spot and I walk in and feel like, "yes, a cute little coffee shop with all the hipster love that I have at home". Unfortunately we didn't eat there because it was packed so we just grabbed some coffee and left. When we stopped in again before we headed to the airport the menu was sparse because they had sold a lot of food over the weekend and were wiped out. 

This is now a regular spot on my trips to Tampa.

For some reason, people love this little Italian eatery.

It is wicked small, and can get loud. But such makes a great Italian BYOB eatery's atmosphere.

The reason it gets 3 stars from me was the food. It wasn't spectacular Italian at all. Actually there is another reason: service. The wait is usually ridiculous (make reservations) and the servers are kinda cold and unfriendly. And if you are in an aisle seat, prepared to get bumped by the servers going in and out of the kitchen!

Alas, I'm ready for my Union 72 review. I've been here at least three times. That never happens, but it's so close to home, it's a different story. I've tried a good number of items on the menu.  I've finally figured out my favorite!

The sandwiches are where will get the extraordinary flavor. They mesh different flavors and they work pretty well. My favorite is the banh mi. It's not traditional by any means. It's a great fusion and I love it. I also ask for a side of Asian and Sweet barbecue sauce to dip it! I love dipping!! 

Far East is my second fave! It's with the Asian Bbq sauce. If u can't handle a little bit higher level of spicy. Ask for the kimchi on the side and test it out! 
I also tried the Conquistador, but that was the least favorite. If you like a sunny side egg on a sandwich that's your go to!

For their sides, their fries are the best! They are not too salty! Their mac and cheese is quite smokey(not my thing). Their corn on two occasions were good with the cheese, but overcooked & small kernels. If the kernels shrivel up, they r over cooked in my eyes. The fried okra is a close 2nd favorite but the ends r kinda hard. The potato is small. Half the size of your fist.

If You Are going to get brisket, get sliced so it can be moist. The chunks were dry and hard. The favorite meat of choice is pulled pork.

I do want to try the wings which seem to be a special on Tuesdays. I also want to try their ribs! 

Excited to have a new non chain spot in Wesley Chapel! Thank you for being in town!

[1016]

10/13/2019

This Fresh Market location is located in a strip mall with plenty of parking on Baltimore pike. 
 
I like coming here because I can find unique items such as whole wheat organic flour, Manchego cheese, gluten free items and Ton more of unique items.   Tons of bulk coffee and candy and olives. 

Staff was very friendly.  I picked up a ton of items including a warm
Pumpkin pie which my husband loved 

I'll definitely be back

Sips coffee is one of the best places! I love the charm and hospitality I receive every time I am there. It's so refreshing to have a "mom and pop" coffee house in such a big town with way too many chain coffee shops flooding the market here in Tampa. The treats, coffee, teas, and service are always top notch!

Why did it take me so long to come here???!!! I am not sure why this has always fallen off the radar for me but my husband and I were in the area, about to go to another restaurant but decided to give this a shot. We were seated right away in a quiet little corner table away from the door, which it was a cold night so I was really appreciative of being hidden away! Service was fantastic! Our server was brand new to Nashville (wish I remembered his name because we would definitely ask for him again) and he was friendly and helpful. We ordered the caesar salad and the lasagna, which holy smokes, that lasagna is something special. The caesar salad was good but the real star, the reason we will make Milk and Honey a usual spot will be that lasagna. We told our server and he said that it is a recipe from the chef's family. It was FANTASTIC! We loved it and could eat that, all day, every day! We also ordered some cookies for dessert and they were both pretty good, I don't think we would order those again but since it was our first time in there I wanted to try a little bit of different things. Really great, we will definitely become regulars!

This was our second time staying at the St Louis Hilton Curio. Our first trip was back in March. We had a great time and fell in love with the hotel.
This trip left a lot to be desired.
I will start off by saying that our room was "wet". Yes it was wet. The A/C was like an old swamp cooler. The humidity was over the top. Our bed felt wet. The floor was slick do to all the moisture. I ended up with an ear-ache due to the extreme cold moisture.
The second part that was frustrating, we stayed on the 3rd floor "Grand Hall" which means we are supposed to have access to the "Concierge Lounge". I looked all over and couldn't find the lounge. Saturday morning I decided to look again since we are supposed to be able to get breakfast there. I finally went down to the desk and asked about our free breakfast. He asked what room I was in and I told him 321. He said yes that we did get a free breakfast but it was in the main dining room and not in the "Concierge Lounge" as listed on their website and our reservation.
We received 2 complimentary drink tickets for their main bar but you can only use one per day? We went to a Cardinal's game Saturday evening. We were looking forward to coming back to the hotel and sitting in the big main hall where they do the light show on the ceiling and having a couple of drinks. When we walked into the hotel, that whole area was blocked off for a private party? That is one of the main reasons we chose this hotel. So I have 2 complimentary drink tickets that we couldn't use because we didn't have access to the area. We couldn't even go to the "Concierge Lounge". Wherever that may be.
The room is supposed to include bottles of water every day. That wasn't there.
Saturday morning I asked the maid in the hall for some new towels since ours wouldn't dry out due to the crazy amount of moisture in the room. She gave us a set. I asked her if she wanted the wet towels and she said she would get them from our room when she cleaned it. They were still there when we got in later as she never cleaned our room.
Some of the other things was a fire alarm that went off late Saturday night. The scary part was that the alarm didn't go off in our room. I heard it out in the hall. The alarm that is supposed to flash in our room never flashed. If I were a deaf person I would have never known the fire alarm went off.
All that to say that we were very disappointed in this stay.

This was my first time into this bakery, but my 3rd Time enjoying their treats. I had my annual red velvet cake from here 2018 and it was really good. It competes for my top three as I said I get it once a year. No nuts or coconuts. 

This time though I purchased some holiday treats and a gift certificate. I tell you. While I'm sure many do it, I love the hand written certificate to get my sweet treat on. Too bad it was a gift. But at least the person that got it said their homemade granola bars $1.25 or $1.50 were her top favorite thing here. 

$3.50 for 4 butter cookies, not bad. My family loved them. Even our visitors of the night indulged and had such pleasant things to say. So I'm sure I'll be back. So while it isn't new it's new to me and it's my local bakery!

Everyone there were helpful and kind. That just goes so far for me.

So over the top but so okay with it. Love this place. You really can't get a better cake shop in town... state... Midwest even! I've had 4-5 different cakes but I think my favorite has to be the carrot cake.

This is my favorite ice cream shop at St. Louis. This place is always crowded. It's open from 11am to 11:30pm. The shop is large enough to have enough room for ice cream made. The order can be placed and pick up from the outside of the shop. People can sit in their car or the bench to finish their ice cream. Drinking water is provided for who needs after finishing their ice cream. 
My favorite ice cream is Hawaiian concrete. It's ice cream blend with banana, pineapple, and nut. It's so delicious. My daughter ordered Oreo concrete. It's also delicious. My husband and my son tried Hawaiian concrete also. They love it. 
When you walk up to the ordering station, there's 2 windows next to each other. The one on the left is usually for ordering. The lines are pretty long even at 11pm but it's totally worth it. There's a big menu located on the side of the building. Also, when you're ordering at the window there are mini menus there too!! 5 sizes are available. After you order, they will call your order out when it's ready to pick up at the window next to it. Usually, more than one set of windows are open so remember where you ordered. I love the ice cream here. It's delicious and a great treat on a hot summer day. I always come here whenever I go to St. Louis.

Come gas up and get a Slurpee. 7-Eleven Usually doesn't have the cheapest gas but I'm in the area and I wanted a cold beverage. I didn't get a Slurpee but are used to love them when I was younger. Location is clean pretty busy. It's a little dirty outside and smells like urine. There is a Redbox here if you wanna rent a movie.  I can also buy propane and of coarse ice if your having a barbecue come here

I'm not a fan of the seating arrangement here but the salads and the pizzas are good.

They have a pizza bar seating area, two long rectangular tables, and a couple 2-4 seater tables...so if you're there when the small tables are all taken up, you'll likely end up on the long rectangular table with some other strangers sitting next to you.  Its not that I'm antisocial, it just doesn't give you much privacy to talk with the party you came with or you end up hearing the other party's conversation down to every detail. I'm not into that.

I do love the atmosphere.  Its dark, woody, intimate with a lit up sign that says OVEN instead of OPEN.  :)

Wow! This place is fabulous. We stopped in the other day, and shared the BLT GC sandwich and it was perfection. I am nuts for grilled cheese and this takes the cake. We also bought a couple of kinds of cheese and sampled some others. We loved everything we had. We found the staff to be super helpful and very friendly. We will be back, and often!

I came to Ashley Furniture store with one mission: to find a dining room table and a sectional! 

I came by myself, which was probably my first mistake. I don't know if it's because I'm a woman, if it's because I was alone, or if it's because I look a lot younger than 26 (oh PLEEEEASE let it be that one! Please!), but whenever I go furniture shopping, I get ignored completely. And that bugs the SHIT out of me. 

I moseyed in with that innocent "hey, someone please help me" look, and I managed to catch the eye of a few salespeople, who smiled politely, but then attended to the older couple that walked in together. Or the middle aged gentleman. Or the prada-wearing old lady who looked like she had money to spend. 

Pffft. Fine. I didn't need anyone to hold my hand, anyway. I roamed the store and had no luck finding a sectional, but I did find a gorgeous dining room table that I had to have. 

Just like at Weekends Only, I had to track down a salesperson and practically beg them to help me. 

What was funny was that she seemed to know that I hadn't been greeted or helped, as she immediately apologized for the lack of attention before any words even left my mouth. Perhaps my pissed off look spoke volumes. I sure hope these fools don't work on commission. 

Anyway, I bought the dining room table. I was able to pick a date for delivery. A few days before the delivery date, the company called and gave me a time frame for arrival. 

One thing I did like was that the furniture arrived already assembled. I do love assembling furniture, but it's nice to have that part completed already. I can't even imagine how long it would take me to assemble a dining room table and six chairs all by myself. 

The quality of the furniture is top notch, so I'm happy about that. 

But if there's one thing I can't stand, it's being ignored. Just because I'm young doesn't mean that I should be treated any differently than any other paying customer. Do better, Ashley Furniture (and furniture stores in general!)

I love Priya Hot Yoga and am officially hooked. While I've enjoyed yoga in the past, I've never felt so excited to go to class and felt so good afterwards.

While I still don't have any other hot yoga classes to compare it to, I've now taken classes with several instructors and really have been enjoying my experience overall. 

A few weeks after the grand opening trial class, I came back and got the new client package. For $40, I get 30 days of unlimited yoga. It's been great because I've been able to practice with several of the instructors including Julia, Ashley and Liz.

Several classes are offered each day and it's really easy to work them into my schedule. I love the fact that classes are offered at 6am on Tuesday and Thursday! 

All of the instructors have been great and have had similar philosophies on yoga- they really encourage you to practice at your own level. The classes have been challenging but I've really been comfortable knowing my own limits and not fearing judgment. 

I'm especially enjoying the class with Julia and most of my visits to Priya have been with her as the instructor. I've found her classes to vary from week to week, but still have a consistency to them. I like that she offers corrections and pose variations without drawing from the class or overall flow. She's friendly and has a great sense of humor which makes the class even more enjoyable. And as much as the core work hurts at the time, I know I am getting a killer ab workout. 

Everyone at the studio is just so great and the environment is very welcoming. I'm also really finding myself liking the music they play and I'm definitely able to recognize some tunes. For example some Jack Johnson music was playing at class the other day. While it's not the music I'd traditionally think of for yoga, it adds an extra fun element to my experience. 

With the winter months among us, the 95 degree heated room feels absolutely amazing. I've never felt more relaxed in Savasana in my life. 

Looking forward to many good times to come at Priya Hot Yoga.

Holy cow, I love love love Livery. 
I swear the Cunningham Restaurant Group knows what they are doing. 

Our server was very attentive and let us know about anything and everything. He was able to handle our party of 10 with ease. I wish I knew his name so I could give him props. (He has red hair lol) that's all I remember. 

I had the chicken empanadas and they were sooo good I also got a chance to try the steak ones and they were equally if not better! I split an elote and it was heaven sent! It had just the right amount of spices. 

The desserts, omg, were sooooo good. The chocolate flan was out of this world. Their rendition on tres leche was one of the best I've ever experienced. The churros were also perfect. (We did the dessert platter) 

I will definitely be back!

Now listen here. What I love about 30th Street Station, and about Philadelphia in general, is that public transportation is not stigmatized the way it is in south Jersey. In this case, "everybody's doing it" is actually a great reason for you to do it, too. I've only recently started making use of public transportation, and 30th Street Station has made me into a believer. 

It's architecturally (say it five times fast) stunning. It's wildly spacious and open, it almost feels like a museum. Food options are varied and good. Signage is clear and concise. Employees are helpful. Ticketing is easy. Getting a cab is even easier. 

Once I hit 30th Street, I fall in love with this city all over again. Excitement starts building as soon as I hit Lindenwold, and culminates as I shuffle up the steps to this gorgeous homage to everything that is Philadelphia.

My little sister and I came back (she really likes the hamburger here) and we gave it another shot!  We came on a Saturday night and it was busy but not too busy and they were on point!

We were seated promptly, our waitress was friendly and personable, the food was good and served promptly!  We love the two for twenty deal (my wallet does) so we can get an appetizer and two entrees and still afford to see a movie!

Better job Applebee's!

we had reservations for lunch but you didn't really need one because it wasn't packed. The restaurant is well lit and spacious.

We sat towards the open kitchen at the end of the restaurant. Our waiter was very eccentric and set a pretty good mood for the table. 

We ordered a dozen oysters to begin with. They were clean, juicy, briny, and meaty. I loved them. we contemplated ordering another dozen but decided against it, regretfully. 

my boyfriend got Cochon de Lait Pressed Sandwich and he's not even a big sandwich person but he really liked it. He couldn't finish it because it's soooo filling but he wanted to. 

I only got the mussels that are cooked in garlic chili sauce with your choice of ciabatta or fries. I prefer a white wine sauce with my mussels but these were really good took. not as big as i've had them but they were clean. They were all de-beareded and all opened.

Listen. As healthy as we all try to be, there's nothing wrong with waking up on a Sunday morning craving a freshly-baked donut. It happens to me quite a bit (probably way more than it should), and when the feeling hits, Donut Drive-In is where I go. I can confidently say that they have the best donuts anywhere in St. Louis, hands down. 

Heads up, the parking lot is a little small and can be interesting to navigate if it's busy inside. That brings me to my next point, which is that the inside of Donut Drive-In is smaller than you can imagine. As in, if there are more than a handful of people inside you'll have to wait out the door small. Which is something I'll gladly do, but I would've liked knowing that before my first visit. Third note: bring cash. You won't need a lot... if you're buying for less than three or so people, five bucks should cover it. On my most recent visit I had a chocolate long John (oh my God, drool-worthy) and a vanila custard donut for a grand total of $1.89. I felt like I was stealing. 

The donuts here just taste fresh and have the perfect texture and consistency... and I love seeing all the action behind the counter! The young girls that work the register are as sweet as can be, too. Just a wonderful, tiny, thriving local business. I'm a huge fan and there's a big chance you'll spot me if you stop in on a Sunday morning. Hooray for donuts!

This is our go-to pizza place!

Is it a little expensive compared to the major chains? Yeah, definitely. But the flavor and quality of the ingredients blows every other pizza place in the area out of the water.

We usually have a pizza and the fusion salad, which is fantastic. Even if you don't like salad, you'll like this one. I love that they serve Annie's Green Goddess dressing with it, I hadn't even tried it before I had it at PF and now it's my absolute favorite. It's little things like not sticking to generic dressing that set this place apart, not to mention the gluten-free & vegan options so you don't have to rule out pizza for dinner if you're hanging out with friends who have different dietary restrictions.

I've tried almost every pizza on the menu at this point, and I highly recommend them all. Just can't go wrong with any of them, but my personal favorite is the Big Kahuna.

So, even though this is the best option for pizza in Westchase, I have to go with four stars because the non-pizza items really just aren't that great apart from the salad, especially the wings. I love wings and have tried them a couple of times to be fair, and they were a bit dry and not at all flavorful.

Delivery time is also a little long even when ordering during what shouldn't be a busy time. I much prefer going in and sitting down, the service is always quick and friendly, never had a bad experience.

I have never ever reviewed a grocery store before, but I love this one soooo much, I just had to! 
Oh how I love their meat, just take a walk by the fresh meat counter, everything, and I mean everything, looks amazing! So much meat and fish of every shape, size and color.  All the "regular" stuff, like New Yorks, swordfish, jumbo shrimp, and kabobs, are great but they also have spectacular specialty items, such as Kobe beef filets and veal.
Obviously, everything else is just as wonderful like the fresh fruit and vegetable but I esp like their cheese and dessert counters. Everything I have tried at the dessert counter had been amazing, like chocolate mousse cups and chocolate and vanilla mousse layered cake ( I like mousse). The even have real foie gras and duck pate, which I also love, please don't hate me.
BUT and this is a big BUTT everything is ridiculously expensive. We just paid $9 for spaghetti sauce! It's the best damn spaghetti sauce in a jar you've ever tasted, but $9? Good Golly!
So here is my advice. For a special meal consisting of a fine piece of meat and some foie gras, A. J. is your man, but for Tuesday night tacos, head over to Basha's.
Boy would my wallet by in trouble if they had one in Los Angeles!

My Bogie loves it here! We've been bringing him for about 1.5 years and so far, so good. Dr. Madura and her staff are always friendly and happy to see Bo.  He's a Boggle-a Boston Terrier and Beagle mix and man, is he loud!!  They all know when Bogie is visiting because he howls and "talks" to them.  We crate him when we have to go out of town and he gets all of his medicine and vaccinations here.  They're affordable and provide excellent care!

Let's get into Dirty South Sammich Co. and how I feel about their food. Three words: tasty as hell. I visited Dirty South today inside of the Pythian Market food hall. It was my third time visiting Pythian as a whole, but I had never actually eaten a meal there. Upon arriving, the Nashville Hot Chicken was already on my radar. And let me tell you, the sandwich definitely lived up to my expectations. 

The Nashville Hot Chicken consists of spicy fried chicken breast and pickles all on a sesame bun. I was afraid the sauce would be too spicy, but it was just the right amount of hot! I love pickles, so they were a nice touch. On the side I got one of the Dirty Flurrys! I'm a huge fan of the All-American beauty that is the McDonald's Oreo McFlurry, so I was up for a new twist on it. Not only did it have Oreo mixed inside of the ice cream, but there were chocolate cookie chunks on top! Loveeee. They also have Butterfinger and M&M Dirty Flurry options, which I'll also have to try.

Overall, I'm a big fan on this place. I received my food quick and hot and I can't wait to try some of the other sandwiches and tots!

Let's me start by saying, I love ice cream.   Love, love, love ice cream. 

So it's after 10pm and I'm in town just for a few hours. I had a great dinner now I need dessert. So YELP has a few suggestions but this one was nearby.

It's a local hangout which gets pretty crowded. It's late but this little place is packed. I'm talking at least 30 people hanging out.  

I tried a couple of samples before deciding on the Cream Cheese and Mexican hot chocolate ice cream in my sundae with butterfinger and was ready!!  The cashier warned me to the Mexican Hot had Cayenne pepper in it and I said "I hope so"!! 

Best sundae ever!! It was creamy, the scoops were big and I tried, really I did but I couldn't finish all of it. So I owe it to myself to go back again for more ice cream from this little gem.

Another juice bar in my hood??  I'm in heaven!

Love Juice Bar!  Everything I've had from here (smoothies and juices) has been fantastic.  They have great variety on the menu, too, which is nice.  I also like that you can order different sizes.  Prices are reasonable for the quality and size.

Love this place! I've been here so many times and haven't written a review yet. So here we go! They definitely have amazing juices, smoothies and açaí bowls! Those 3 are my meals on weekends haha. I usually stick to my personal favorite the banana butter smoothie and the sobro açaí bowl. And love their immunity shots for when I'm under the weather. Today I tried the BC bowl and it was great!!

I eat at Newk's pretty regularly during the work week.  I LOVE the Newk's Q sandwich, and I usually get that along with soup.  It's a step up from other sandwich chains.

That said, this place gets super busy both on weekdays and with weekend post-church crowds.  There isn't good line/crowd control at the front, and parking fills up fast too.  I'd love to see them staff up for rush timing with more personnel at the register, and staff to keep up with turning over dirty tables.  You often have to wait for a table while you wait for your food.

4-star food, would have a higher rating if they could keep tables clean and turning over, and maybe even expand to have more seating or organized registers/line direction.  For now, 3-stars A-OK.

Rusty's is my visit once a year and promise never to return Restaurant.  It never fails!  

I used to love Rusty's.  Living near Grant & Silverbell, I would visit at least 2/3 times a week for drinks and bar food.  I would get prompt service by a good looking waitress and be happy.

I go this past Saturday and end up walking out after being ignored for 11 minutes. 

I have a $10 Groupon, so I try again this past Monday.  Food was so, so.  I give my unhappy waitress the Groupon and she upset stating that I have to spend a minimum of $20.  This is not a term of the Groupon Certificate.  

Long story short, I end up purchasing an additional meal to go, just to use my Groupon.  Maybe I will give Rusty's another shot in 2012?

The place and the vibe are on point for a nice upscale dinner. 
Warning: if you cannot eat spicy food, stay very far away from their shrimp cocktail. But I loved it despite the spice.

Overall I feel that Philadelphia Weekly is far superior to City Paper when it comes to our weekly papers. I love both, I know plenty of people who have been involved with both, and both definitely have their strong points and imperfections. But when it comes down to it, City Paper is something that I tend to flip through, whereas I actually tend to stop and read a lot more things in PW. it really knows how to draw you in.
I also feel that PW does a better job of sponsoring events. They were one of the major backers for this things like Popped Fest and realizePhiladelphia. and you can't go wrong with what they've done with Rittenhouse Square's Concerts in The Park series over the past few years.
City Paper does have the better entertainment section by far though.

I loooooooove Koi!!!! I love the cute seating right of the door. I love the staff and every thing I have eaten here was awesome!! 

I think my favorite thing besides yummy food is when the staff sits down together and eats lunch together. It's nice to see them in community together and see that they love eating their own food! 

I love the electronic sushi menu. Seeing pics of every thing with the description is so nice! 

If you guys had a good happy hour this would be our go to place. We had one back in MN that had select half price appetizers, regular and specialty sushi rolls every night after 9 pm and all day Sunday. We went at least 3 times a week and told/brought all our friends:) We haven't been able to find a place like that here in TN yet. Most places with great sushi don't have happy hour. The places that do have a happy hour have pretty bad sushi.

Palace of Asia has been my favorite place for Indian food since my mother discovered it about six years ago. I live in Phoenix now and the choices for good Indian food are very limited, so whenever I'm back in town I make sure my mom and I go for a dinner. We went on a Wednesday and it turned out to be buffet night, which is perfect since we can get to try out new dishes. 

Chicken Tikka Masala: excellent, one of the best I've had
Lamb Kadhai: very good, tender juicy lamb
Vegetable and Potli Samosas: awesome
Navratan Korma: a new vegetable dish for me. loved it, blown away by it even.
Kashmiri Dum Aloo: potatoes filled with cheese in a cream sauce. You don't even have to ask if  these are amazing. you already know they are.
Mutter Panir: really good
Daal Makhani: black beans and lentils in cream, I recommend if eating from buffet.

Delicious, served hot Garlic Naan.

This tip may make you feel like an old person, but go a little early, like around 5:30-6pm.  The first round of buffet items are brought out around then for dinner, so you know they are fresh and untouched. 

I don't typically get dessert at an Indian restaurant, but since they offer it in the buffet I figured I'd give it a shot. I liked the Gulab Jaman (milk and cheese balls dipped in syrup), but not a must have next time. The rice pudding was ok, a little too runny for my liking.  

Overall, one of my all time favorite Indian restaurants and one of my all time favorite south NJ restaurants.

Props to the community members that make this family friendly event possible. We have so much fun every year "oooooing and awwwwing" at all the houses. I'm in such awe of the families that work so hard and allow their neighborhood to be packed with people throughout December, I can't imagine the logistics it must take for them just coming and going from their homes.

Each year there are awesome classics along with fun new displays. This year we were in love with the Stranger Things tribute and the Star Ward manger. So much fun! 

There are usually food vendors with hot cocoa, hot dogs, and popcorn. Also Port-a-potties sprinkled throughout neighborhood-much appreciated.

Event is free, but if you are able don't forget to take a canned food item or some cash to donate to the Community Food bank at the entrance! Great organization that can never have enough support. 

Pups are welcome on leashes, our pup loves to go and show off her Christmas sweater.

In the old days[1], say back in halcyon '06, Flat Rock was the beer drinker's go-to in Manayunk. I'm not sure if their selection has decreased or if selections around them have increased, but I believe the new reigning champion is the Old Eagle. 

The beer list here is pretty amazing. They have a wide range of interesting beers on tap, and a huge bottle selection. In fact, I was here during Philly Beer Week and sat next to Tom Kehoe, owner of Yards, as he tapped a firkin of Citra Pale Ale. We had an awesome conversation where he helped me calculate the ABV of the first beer I brewed on the back of a napkin![2]

There is also an interesting crowd here for Manayunk. The crowd definitely is on the young side.[3] But they are usually more let's say, restrained, than the usual phalanx of young partygoers who maraude through the neighborhood. Everyone is really chill and there because they love craft beer. So I'd say this is a win over all. 

Brunch is also good. [4] It can take awhile to come out, but the food is usually well prepared and tasty.

So if you have your sherpa and yeti and are ready for a trip up into the hills of Dear 'Ol Manyunk, I recommend Old Eagle. 


[1] Yes, I just used the phrase "in the old days." While this is generally followed with sentiments requesting that these damn kids get off my lawn, I assure you I will refrain from making such a request. 

[2] True story, bro

[3] Same kids who I wish to, but will not ask to, get off my lawn

[4] Yes, I realize that I mention brunch in every review I write

Of the many highlights from our daughter's Santa Barbara Zoo wedding, our experience with Jen Nally stands out. You all know the potential stress of wedding planning whether or not you are a particular perfectionist or laid back... we encountered relatively few roadblocks, but eventually our minds locked onto Jen's florals as the one thing we didn't have to worry about.  It helped that we met and brainstormed with her in person, and saw that she is a genuinely caring person, one who takes delight in the small details of others, generous, cheerful,  observant, and truly excited about plants and flowers.  I guess our tastes agreed, or else maybe she just wasn't judgy or overbearing about imposing her preferences on us. She welcomed photographic examples and we shared a board on Pinterest.  Her proposal was very fair, detailed, and specific, and she was always responsive to our questions.  She gave us her log-in so we could peruse all the wholesale vase and votive options (you might be able to find a better price online, but make sure you are comparing apples to apples).  In one email, I may have sounded a little panicked about all the set-up I'd taken upon myself (this wasn't even a DIY wedding), and she volunteered her crew to lend a hand.
On the day of, our site was beset by unusual winds which caused us to lose some major decorative elements (draping, chandeliers, all candles).  Jen's survived -  her arch was staked with iron rods, but the tall aisle arrangements couldn't stay on their stands and had to be placed on the ground where they blew over, so I would suggest that they be wired to the end chairs if anyone encounters that problem.  Even the low centered, generously filled centerpieces would blow over, but they took a beating and still looked lovely.  Jen repurposed the flowers from the arch on the head table - fabulous!  I hope the photographers captured where she put those aisle pieces - I know they were placed somewhere because at the end of the evening, my completely unsentimental mother-in-law insisted on bringing one back to the hotel because it was too beautiful to leave behind.  
I didn't know how Jen would capture the "Romantic Bohemian Jungle" theme in a succulent color palette, but she did it.  She found a specimen protea for Blakely's bouquet which must have weighed 10lbs. overall... but no worries, a tossing bouquet and loose flowers for misc. tables, hair, flower girls, and cake were included.  I wish I'd been more calm to have enjoyed them all that day, but the centerpieces I still have 9 days later, are still bringing me joy. 
Sure it's great when things are delivered as promised, but I feel that Jen went beyond that with her pleasant attitude.  She was a ray of happiness during the set-up while the wind was making a shambles of my little details, and I heard that at one point she ran in search of the groom for photos. As a wedding planner for the first time in 31 years, I didn't anticipate the importance of the vendors' positive attitudes... this is the kind of person you want involved in your happy occasion.

The story goes...

I was rather excited when I finally got to try this restaurant. 

I liked the decor and the courtyard area when I walked in.

I was so bummed when I found that they didn't have Iman Bayildi on the actual menu. They had it on their website one! Darn it.. I thought..

I was thrilled that there were so many options on the menu and the waiter said he could do half sized dishes if we wanted to try multiple things.

I loved the flat bread, flavorful and delicious! I was impressed with the toppings, very creative.

I enjoyed the salads, refreshing and savory. 

I was underwhelmed with the dips. I'd prefer traditional pita bread for the hummus. 

Overall, I liked it and I'd visit it again if they could update the online menu..

So hubby wanted ice cream so it was decided to give this place a whirl.
I got a traditional hot fudge sundae and hubby got a pineapple sundae. I was thrilled when I saw they put a cherry on top (DQ does not).  We got the large ones and they were pretty big. 
Pros & Cons:

Pros:  CHERRY on top! Just love that.
           Size was good.
           Hot fudge stayed warm for quite a while.

Cons:  Barely any hot fudge
            Very small sprinkle of nuts
            Barely any whipped cream (why is every place afraid to pile on the whipped cream? Good thing we keep a can at home.)
            Very very very slow service.

The ice cream itself is a mystery to me.  It's neither a pro or con, it just kind of dangles in the middle.  It melted very quickly, was very light (seemed very airy) and flavor was..meh. I was not impressed. Just lacked the creaminess of Jeremiah's or even DQ's.

Price was $4.25 plus tax, comparable to DQ. 

I think we may be back to try some of the different flavors they have but I'm still in search of that perfect sundae I remember from my childhood.

Love this place. Delicious coffee and tasty baked goods.

I tried the Lavender Latte and Almond Maple Latte, both were great but the Lavender was better, as the Almond Maple was a bit too sweet.

They had a nice selection of baked good, I got the Chocolate Bread Pudding. They hooked me up and gave me a big slice. Unless everyone is special and get's the hook up. Anyways, this was some great and perfectly soft pudding and made me happy. 

The atmosphere here is cool and I like the indoor and outdoor seating options.

I loved this place from the second I walked through the door. It manages to feel upscale but comfortable and casual at the same time...just like the food. They take something as comfortable as chicken and waffles and make their own version instead... duck and pecan sage waffles...heaven. Then there's the deviled eggs. They take a plain old deviled egg and turn it into pickled truffle deviled eggs which are so incredible that I figured out how to make my own version and serve them whenever I can.

My most recent trip to Supplier was for brunch and I was yet again super impressed. First they make one of the best bloody marys I've ever had. I stuck with the original but they had many versions with Bourbon and tequila! Next I had the dixie biscuit which was great. It was a biscuit, with scrambled egg, pimento cheese, country ham and grits. YUM! My boyfriend had the supper benny which was also fantastic and I don't generally love eggs Benedict. 

To sum up, Supper is a restaurant you can go to get a consistently great meal in Philly. It has an amazing feel, great atmosphere and very good food!

I've not made it a secret that I love deep dish pizza, and specifically, Giordano's. I'm still extremely bitter that Dayton has one and Cincinnati still doesn't, but I guess that doesn't matter much for the Indianapolis review. Their pizza is consistently cheesy and delicious. However, this Indy location needs a bit of work.

I felt kind of bad because my friend isn't a big fan of deep dish but I REALLY wanted Giordano's. I rationalized that she picked dinner the night before and it was my turn. She agreed, but looking back she may have chosen a better lunch option.

We came in to a well air conditioned restaurant, which is absolutely crucial in this heat. I. AM. DYING. Anyway, we took a seat and were aptly greeted by our server. She wasn't exactly unfriendly, but a bit difficult to find. I have a feeling she wasn't a kid person because the two tables next to us had children and I watched the interactions she had with them. It was awkward.

Giordano's has an excellent lunch menu. For under $10, you can receive a personal pizza, pasta, or sandwich with a side and drink. I ordered the sausage deep dish with fries and my friend had the thin crust cheese with fries.

The food took a surprising amount of time to come out. They say to allow 45 minutes for the deep dish to cook. I thought that meant full size pizzas, not the mini ones. I never asked if my pizza was the reason for our extended wait time, but I assumed it was a good bet because my friend's thin crust was ice cold and our fries were limp and bland. Her food could not be enjoyed without a hearty addition of ranch. Luckily my pizza was hot and filling because I left a good portion of my fries on the table.

The saving grace for Giordano's is the ability to buy frozen pizzas and take them home in their insulated bags. I took a sausage and a spinach pizza home to Cincinnati safely and enjoyed them in the comfort of my house. 

I've never hesitated visiting a Giordano's, but I'd probably think twice about coming to this location. It's smack dab in the middle of multiple A+ lunch offerings, so if you really want the deep dish, maybe eat elsewhere and get some of their frozen pizza to go.

For some odd reason, I don't find myself at Chatham Tap as much as I should. 

They have a TON of TVs, so if you're looking for some sport to watch, I'm sure they'll have it there. 

Reasons I love this place: 
1- The outside patio in the warmer months. it's along the Cultural Trail, so you get to watch passersby and enjoy the sunshine/weather. 
2- The large amount of beers. They've got tons - try something new! 
3- The staff are always diverse and very friendly. I haven't had any issues. 
4- The food is pretty good. I can't say, personally, it's anything more than normal bar food for vegetarians, but it's still pretty good and hits the spot when you're looking for something greasy!

What an overall enjoyable experience. The kind of parade experience where, if you pick the right spot, you get a full view of everything without battling the masses. It's in the Marigny, which is definitely my favorite place to watch a parade. 

So, no surprise here that you're going to see the likes of Star Wars, Star Trek, and other science fiction characters that MAY, I ain't gonna lie, have gone over my head. But if you're a fan of such things, you will adore it. There are throws, sure, not of the quality and quantity of the big parades, and some of them are adult-oriented (I got some pills, lol), other things like roses and toys. The party in the Marigny surrounding this parade is also not to be missed. You can tell the folks in this parade are diehards and put a lot of time into their costumes and floats. Nothing like certain other krewes where some masked members just want to be dicks and throw bags of beads at people's heads. Here we've got nice, creative people just coming together to celebrate their nerdly love for sci fi (I'm a nerd too, I don't judge) in a parade is a wonderful thing to witness.

Pro Tip: Catch it on St. Claude for better viewing, or if you prefer to be amongst the partying crowd around Franklin, that's a great option, too.

They had a surprising selection of cute clothes (yoga wear) and lingerie in all sizes and price points. If you're looking for bachelorette party gifts then come here. The store was clean and had a variety of fun items, candles, oils, and adult toys.  You will not leave there without someone (or several) asking if you need help or if you're still good.  You don't need to wear sunglasses and hide to come here. The store was clean, bright, & had a wide range of customers. Want to spice up your love life, stop in and take a look!

Lobster Haven Shanty and Market needs to rename themselves Lobster HEAVEN because this place is phenomenal for seafood lovers! This place looks and feels like a little Maine lobster shack -- not too fancy on the outside, but incredibly delicious food on the inside.

Lobster Haven is located in a non-descript little strip mall along W. Hillsborough Avenue in Oldsmar. You'll find the restaurant / seafood market in between the shopping center with the Super Target (Montague Street) and the shopping center with the Lowes, Publix, and Cracker Barrel (Race Track Road). It's best to use your GPS the first time you visit as you can easily sail by without spotting the sign.

I remember this store from years ago when they were in a small standalone building directly across the street from the Oldsmar Flea Market. They've now moved south just a bit, and set up shop at this new location.

Lobster Haven is both a seafood market as well as a seafood restaurant, and it is a great place to find fresh shellfish and seafood in the NW corner of Hillsborough County. You'll find live Maine lobsters, shrimp, clams, mussels, oysters, crawfish, and crab (Dungeness, Snow, King, and Stone). Sometimes they also have blue crabs and garlic crabs, but you should call ahead to double check. You'll also find fresh and frozen seafood ready to toss on the grill. The lobster is flown in LIVE from Maine, and you can walk over to the tanks to see the happy little crustaceans scrambling around for your viewing pleasure.

Now in addition to that, Lobster Haven is an outstanding little seafood restaurant with Lobster and Clam Chowda (New England style, of course!), crab cakes, smoked fish spread, shrimp cocktail, shrimp baskets, peel 'n eat shrimp, Ahi tuna, scallops, salmon, fish tacos.........and then we have the lobster...... *insert choirs of singing angels here*

You'll find lobster rolls made with huge chunks of lobster meat in a top-split bun, lobster (or crab) wraps, Lazy Man Lobster (hand picked lobster meat spread out on top of crackers), and then you've got your choice of 4 different styles of Lobster Haven Shanty Buckets o' Lobster with ever-increasing amounts of shellfish to go along with your freshly-steamed lobster, ear of corn, seasoned red potatoes, and a fluffy Parker House roll.

Now by freshly-steamed lobster, I mean that the guy came out of the kitchen, picked the lobster out of the tank, walked it back into the kitchen, and a bit later out came my Bucket of Steamed Shellfish.

I had the Silver Bucket which was a steamed 1 1/2 pound Maine lobster, Middle neck clams, sautéed Black Mussels, Steamed Shrimp and Crawfish along with the corn, potatoes, and a roll. I forced myself to start the meal with a cup of their amazing lobster chowder which had big chunks of potatoes and lobster in a thick & creamy New England style stock.

You can buy everything live and take it home to cook it, or you can kick back with a nice cold beer and let them do the work for you. Make it a point to go visit these folks soon!!!

Anthro is definitely one of my all time favorite stores EVER! Their entire collection of home decor, accessories, candles and clothes is so thoughtfully curated with a certain bohemian-esque, naturally chic, trendy, yet classic aesthetic. 

This location also carries bridal! And oh my goodness it is all so gorgeous! I adored my wedding dress but dang, I wish they had their BHLDN label available back then! Every dress is super romantic and feminine. They also have bridal lingere, swimsuits, veils, shoes and headbands. I always find myself drifting to this section when I'm shopping here. They politely ask me if I need help and I get embarrassed as I'm an old wifey at this point and quickly walk away with flushed cheeks. Brides, run here!

I truly cherish every piece I purchase here. All so unique and definitely more special pieces versus run of the mill department store items that everyone will have. You just feel a little extra special wearing something form Anthro. I still have the 1st dress I ever purchased here and that was for the first wedding I attended with my husband, then BF 10 years ago! I'm definitely not one to hold onto clothes that long, but I still love it as much as the day I bought it. 

Anthro has also been know to collaborate with designers from all over the world! They partnered up with one of my favorites Mara Hoffman. You never what's around the corner....

Their housewares are possibly my favorite! Ordinary items absolutely beautifully designed. Kitchen Goods, planters, candles, linen napkins, throw pillows, comforters. It's all so lovely! Anything from here makes a truly lovely gift. In fact, I hit Anthro up every holiday season! 

Prices can be a bit much but really, quality is key. 

Customer service is top notch. You will be greeted the second you walk through the door. They will start fitting rooms for you so you don't have to carry your goods around. They communicate via walkie and will contact someone on another floor to help you find what you're looking for. They also offer personal shopping! 

As a former visual merchandiser for years I can certainly appreciate not only the ever changing amazing window displays, but the carefully merchandised products, as well as the seasonal displays! They are on top of everything! I mean I most recently visited on a Sunday then two days later and everything was fresh and re-merchandised. 

This building alone is absolutely STUNNING! For those who remember way back to the 90's this was the flagship location of Urban Outfitters, who is a sister to Anthro. I used to sneak down here in middle school and blow my entire allowance on one awesome item! From the entrance to the decorated elevator, to the spiral staircase, to the faux fireplaces, hanging mobile and stained glass Tiffany-esque rotunda! Wow! That space alone is worthy of a visit. Being situated across from beautiful Rittenhouse Square Park isn't too shabby either! If you're from out of town and have never been to this gorgeous location, I highly recommend it!

Anthro, along with Free People, Urban Outfitters, BHLDN, and Terrain are all owned by the same company which goes by URBN. Their headquarters are right here in Philly! I absolutely LOVE this! In the last few years they moved offices from Columbus Blvd to a beautiful space in the Naval Yard. Their company is very laid back, allowing their employees to even bring along pups to work! So cool! I can certainly get behind a company like that!

*If they don't have something you're looking for in stock they will ship it to your house free of charge. 

*Sign up for their emails. They run great sales around the holidays and their catalogs make for great coffee table browsing material.

I am a huge fan of CVS. There is rarely a time when I can walk out without spending $50. I used to live in Margate, NJ across the street from the CVS there and in the summer there is no way the line isn't 10 deep. But I was content to wait everytime because they always had at least 2 or 3 registers open with all associates helping someone. 

Last week I went into this CVS for the first time only to buy paper towels and toilet paper (The good/expensive kinds were on sale). I was very unhappy to see that there was a line around 12 people deep and instead of just ringing people up and also having the self check out available, the store associate was handling technical problems in the self check out lines. 

First, there was only one worker available and there were so many issues with the self checkout system that if the regular register was open, it would have taken about 1/3 of the time to get everyone checked out! 

I was very unhappy with this system and already have my own issues about self checkout taking away important jobs in the community. I obviously will be going back to CVS, I love their rewards program and all my favorite hygiene products are in one place, but I will protest self checkouts forever! Or until we develop jobs to replace those lost by technology!

If you're looking for classy prints of old and new Nashville, along with iconic storied pictures of cities and landmarks across the country, then stop in at this little shop off West End for some truly remarkable books, postcards and images. 

I wound up buying a bunch of coffee table books, postcards, and magnets depicting classic Nashville locales (Loveless Cafe, Vanderbilt, etc.) and they still remain my favorite mementos of my two years in NashVegas. You won't regret it!

I absolutely love this place! The ice cream is fresh and with the options they have everyone can find something they enjoy. When my family heard I was stopping here everyone had a request. I haven't tried the donut sandwiches but the mention of a brownie sundae is mouth watering, the milkshakes are delicious, and my son was delighted with his candy cane ice cream. 
Happy holidays!

Stuck between a 2 and a 3 on this one, but I am going to go ahead and give it a 2 based on the fact that it was one of the strangest dining experiences I've had. My hubby (Adam) and I were in town for the day visiting our friends. We were doing a pub crawl with them starting off at the bar next door, so we all decided to come here. I was very impressed when we walked in. The restaurant was so big, and I thought it was very unique looking. The food has to be awesome, right? My friend and I ordered the cotton candy limeade, and it was delish! The food prices were overly reasonable. I was in love (besides for the weird waiter)! I couldn't wait for the food. Right off the bat though.. our server was pretty arrogant. I think maybe he got his training at DIck's Last Resort next door lol. Adam and I ordered their Sicilian cheese bread with pepperonis as an appetizer and decided to split the spaghetti and meatsauce as our meal (which comes with a salad). The cheese bread came out with no pepperonis... we ate it anyway and it was okay. Nothing special. I told the waiter about the pepperonis when he asked how everything was, and he joked that he ate them. Anyway, the salads weren't great. We had asked our waiter what their most popular dressing is, and he said the Pesto one. It tasted like watered down Caesar. At this point, I still had high hopes for the spaghetti. How could a spaghetti factory screw up spaghetti?! I don't even  know, but they did. There was only a small amount of sauce (which was super bland), and a tiny amount of meat. Luckily, I had saved some of the marinara sauce from the pepperoni-less cheese bread and poured it over the spaghetti which made it better. After we finished our meals, Adam asked for the checks since we had the pub crawl to go to. The waiter said he would go get them. I told Adam that our meal was suppose to come with ice-cream, so when the guy came back with our checks we asked him for the ice-cream. He was shocked and surprised that we wanted ice-cream... Now in his defense, we did ask for the checks. However, it was a really odd reaction and I doubt (even if we didn't ask for checks) that we would have been given the ice-cream if we didn't ask for it.

I love working in this building. Very innovative, as it should be with Comcast being a technology company. The Christmas show is a must see. Grab a latte or hot chocolate in the Starbucks in the lobby and it's a perfect outing during the holidays.

Love trying new places when visiting family out of town. Simple menu with a decent variety, quick service - food came out shortly after ordering, small quant little restaurant - server was very attentive and friendly. All of the food was delicious; came out hot and ready, all at the same time. Sunday football playing along with some great throwback tunes.

I did not go to the actual location but they were at the farmers market locally.  I applaud the cause that they support.

I love the pumpkin gingerbread that I purchased.  It was moist and the price was wonderful.  I am the only one in my family that has a dairy aversion so the rest of my family was not down with any of the items.  But all day long I will purchase dairy free items.  I am normally hestitate bc gluten and dairy free can tend to be a odd texture or the taste may be off.

Please continue coming to Brownsburgs farmers market and I will continue to buy.

Primanti Bros always delivers the best food. The service is great. We had a party of 8 coworkers and it was no problem to split the checks. The staff from the moment you walk in is there for you. We will be back. Gotta love that 50% off alcohol on Friday nights!!

A friend suggested we stop by for Happy Hour to give it a once over before we make reservations for dinner.  I love the decor when you walk-in - it had an "old-world touch with a sense of luxury.  The wrap around bar is nice and offers plenty of seating.  I heard about the lamb meatballs and asked the bartender about them - she highly recommended - so we had that along with winter squash crostini and lamb sausage.  The lamb meatballs were flavorful the sausage was seasoned perfectly and the crostini with the goat cheese was yummy.  Our drinks were an:  Affair to Forget; Sideways Car and later some Malbec wine - all were delicious!!   

The service was friendly and prompt.  We felt Harp and Crown passed the preliminary test - will definitely pop back in to have dinner and maybe reserve a bowling lane downstairs.

I love this cracker barrel.  Some of these reviews suprise me as I've been here so many times and not had any of these experiences.  Maybe I'm just lucky.  As for slow service, the only reason it would be slow is if it's busy.  And, btw, this is a CB in case to missed the first mention; they are generally always busy and for good reason.

If some of these reviews saying this place has slow service..  I would venture to say you should probably be at a McDonalds drive thru to be in and out.  Honestly.  Now there are some unacceptable instances I'm certain now and again, but with a little common sense, one can distinguish if something's not right or if it simply is because the capacity reached in the restaurant. 

Anyways. Visit for yourself, don't take my word for it and if you find something not up to par, give them a chance to fix it.  These guys and gals aim to please and will within their best resources.

One of my fave chinese take out restaurants to go to! CTO is different to me than normal Chinese Take-Out. I feel like their ingredients are more fresh. I love their sesame chicken, and chicken with mushrooms. If you get a combo meal, I love the cucumber salad with sesame seeds that they include with your dish. The prices are average. I don't think they are more or less expensive than anywhere else. BUt their taste is better than the rest

Situated in the neighborhood of West Tampa, otherwise known as Little Havana, West Tampa Sandwich shop is such a well known institution in the Tampa Cuban community that politicians from both major parties have used it for photo ops trying to sway the Latin vote. On their website you'll see pictures of Florida Governor Scott as well as President Obama. Inside the very casual restaurant you will see pictures of local politicians, celebrities, sports heroes, and hundreds of photos of patrons from over the many years the restaurant has been open.

The interior is not large and the parking outside just adequate for the number of seats inside. The décor is befitting a sandwich shop but with a homey feeling that makes you feel like you're in a place of importance to the Cuban community.

The food is very good and extremely reasonable. The main thing that drew me in was that they claim to have the best Cuban coffee in Tampa. Now I have not been to every Cuban or Latin restaurant in Tampa, although I've been to several, but I will say this is the best café Cubano I have had anywhere.

Being a lover of empanadas I had to try West Tampa's, ordering their Empanada de Picadillo. It came to the table blazingly hot, right from the fryer and was delicious, chalk full of savory picadillo stuffing. I have been disappointed in the past with Cuban style empanadas, preferring either Puerto Rican or Columbian style, but this was really good.

Along with empanada I ordered the cuban sandwich and was disappointed when it showed up with very little roast pork and mostly sliced ham. I thought it tasted very good for what it was but I guess when you have been eating them for your entire life and live in the heart of Tampa's Latin community it missed the mark. Still one of the better that I have tried though.

Overall I thought the coffee lived up to the hype and was really wonderful and the food in general very good. I will definitely be back. Best of all the prices are very reasonable. With all the food I ordered, including a potato ball, the bill was only $12.

BEWARE SMALL PORTIONS!!!

We decided to visit the place as I got a taste of the Beef soup and beef pancake wrap and both were delicious. First, the seating was quick, even though the restaurant was fairly full. It was Me, wife and 5 kids. We tried a variety of items as Kids love to try new items. Wife and I have visited Taiwan many times And we love the street food there. We had : onion pancake, oyster omelette, beef wrapped pancake, crispy pork roll, sweet sausage fried rice, house chow fun, salt pepper pork, braised beef noodle soup, sweet orange pork ribs, basil century egg and Taiwanese style Clams. Total Bill was $120.00 before tip. The food was really good. The Orange Ribs were as sweet as candy. All 5 kids commented too sweet. The Century eggs were very salty, but good flavor. We would eat every dish, other than the orange ribs again. 

So why the 2 Star? Portion size. I was amazed at how little was given for the price. $13 for tiny ribs that barely gave each member of our family 2 tidbits. Thats about $3 for the length of my finger. The oyster omelet had 4 oysters in it. That's like $2 per oyster. We had to cut them in half. Not one dish was over 1/2 full. The clams were delicious, but again not even 1/3 of the bowl full. We left after spending $120 and kids were still hungry.  

So if portion is not an issue, eat here. Over priced, small portions, but delicious.

I really love this place and have been there during the day, at night, and for Burlesque Bingo. The cocktails are super scrumptious (Love Potion #9 is my fave) and watching a big burly boyfriend drink one? Even better.

The food is good, but not spectacular.The atmosphere makes up for it though. Also, if you're not going with kids, I highly recommend the Burlesque Bingo.

First time in this location. A former resident of Metairie their Lakeview location was just more convenient. I went for the 4 mini scoop boat instead of the usual single scoop.
