Plenty of ice cream, can be shared. Cool location, family friendly, nice staff. Dimmer; there is usually always a line. Bright side; it usually moves pretty swiftly. Today it moved a little slow but, there were only 2 working. I'll definitely stop in again. Love my ice cream and  Creole Creamery is where it's at!

Yes, everyone raves about this place. My turn to do a mini review. I love the oysters here! Charbroiled or raw they're both good either way. I think the only reason why I would go here are for the oysters. The staff is always nice and the atmosphere is very elegant and nice. I have been to the one in Metairie. 

Other than that, the seafood dishes here are okay and for the price they are, you can definitely get other seafood dishes around nola for better prices or that taste better. Craving oysters? just come here!

My husband and I finally decided to try out Thai 202 after passing by it frequently and seeing the yummy-looking dishes in the window that caught my eye. We went tonight on a Friday night and were relieved that there wasn't a long wait for the food or for a table. I ordered beef pad thai and my husband got the red curry rice dish. I like that Thai 202 is a cafe-style restaurant and after ordering at the front counter, we got our own cups for water, our own utensils, napkins, etc before sitting down. 
 
It's a great place to people-watch and our food arrived within 10 minutes in fancy boat plates. My pad thai was delicious and tangy, although the sauce was a little too "sweet and sour" for me; I'm used to a more authentic taste. The beef, though, was really tough and chewy...I was sad that I was unable to find a single piece of beef that was tender. Still, I enjoyed the noodles a lot. My husband's red curry was spicy with lots of fresh red peppers, green beans, and chicken. My tongue was still burning 5 minutes later after drinking a whole glass of water and eating my pad thai in an effort to diffuse the spiciness on my tastebuds. If you like spice, you will love the red curry. It went well with the white rice that came with it and we had enough sauce left over to bring home afterwards (we plan to eat it with more rice tomorrow!). 

Fast, friendly service and a good place to get my Thai food cravings satisfied! Next time I probably won't order a dish with beef in it though...

I loved the vibes in here, very aesthetic. However, the food was just basic. Nothing special. It was overhyped. I will say the pastry items are delicious and I liked the bar menu. There was an hour wait in the middle of the day on a Saturday (hyped up) but we were fortunate enough to grab a seat at the bar so the wait wasn't that long. We decided to come here because my bf wanted breakfast and they served breakfast until 4ish.

Great breakfast spot! Love a good BLT! They ask if you want pork or beef too! I'm more of a smoothie girl! Let me tell ya Huge smoothies! So satisfying. They do add sugar to the smoothies however so I ask for it without added sugar!

Bistro Romano is one of my favorite Italian restaurants in the city. Fairly priced food and wine. What more do you need? 

Their seafood salad is loaded with seafood and the crab dip is a little bit more creamy than I would like it but the crab is delicious. 
The caesar salad here is made next to your table, for caesar salad lovers this is a must!

I personally think this is one of the best spaghetti in the city, way better than Little Nonna's or other places "known" for their spaghetti. I love their venison mafalde as well. I wish there was more "sauce" but the amount of meat they give you is plentiful and the pasta here is always cooked al dente, as it should be.

The tiramisu here is one of my favorites. The combination of the chocolate and the fluffy creaminess is sooo delicious. Perfect ending to a perfect meal.

Definitely worth it for the restaurant week deal, a date night or dinner with a big group of friends but definitely make a reservation!

I was just here this past weekend by chance.  I finished eating dinner at Fountain Square and went walking.  Happened across New Day and walked in.  I quickly recognized why I had heard of this before and it is because of the Johnny Chapman Cider which I don't really care for.

That being said, this place was great.  It is smaller, with enough room for about 10 at the stand up bar, and another 12 or so spread across the couches.  The place is very modern and sheik and has a limited menu in terms of food.  Snacks are a better description.  The real reason to come here is the 3 ciders and 3 meads they have on tap.  Personally, I love ciders but these ciders aren't for me.  They are all far to dry like wine rather than beer or cider.

The meads on the other hand.   I'm in love.  They taste like a Lambic, but have 8% ABV!!  So imagine the fruity delicious flavor of a lambic but with 4 times the alcohol. :)

Cant decide? They offer a flight of all 6 options.  They can also mix them together into "cocktails" with the incorporation of bitters and aromatics.

I would come back here again.  It was a good experience for me.

Big fan of the Jordan Y! I love being a member here. Always top notch service from the staff and plenty of group exercise classes to participate in. 

I became a member in the Winter so I am looking forward to all the outdoor activities during the spring.

I think I have a mild obsession with La Colombe. Anytime I find that they are where I am visiting, I have to go there almost every day and then buy a bunch of cold brew to come home with me.

I first discovered them in SoHo in NYC and loved their delicious coffee in a no-nonsense style. They don't do almond or soy here because they believe in the integrity of the original latte, cappuccino or what have you. I like this.

In my almost week long excursion out in Philliy, I was able to visit all of their three locations. I even met one of the co-owners and boasted that I had visited all the locations at the time (they had a few in NYC, all the ones in Philly, and one in Chicago ...) only to find out that they had just opened a location in ... Seoul. Yes. Korea. 

Wot?

Well ... at least I can finally say I have been to ALL the La Colombes in North America! The co-owner is also a huge skater and owns his own skating company so I got an awesome skateboard deck out of it. Love this place!

It's been a while since I've tried somewhere new, so with a friend moving to Chicago, this was the perfect occasion.  We decided on Compere Lapin, Nina Lacompe's new restaurant.  Chef Lacompte is a recent runner up of Top Chef.  Her background and influence is mostly Caribbean, so I was excited to try what I thought would be some interesting flavors.  

I wasn't disappointed.

Atmosphere: A-
I loved the atmosphere.  Rich browns, interesting lighting, exposed brick.  Had a prohibition era type feel to it.  I did find it to get pretty loud at times.  They should probably invest in some cushioning underneath the tables.

Service: B+
This is a tough one to rate.  This is a new restaurant, and they're trying really hard to make you feel welcome, and give good service.  The problem?  They're trying just a little too hard.  3 different people came to our table 4 separate times to see how we were doing.  This is in addition to the standard times where our waiter inquired when dropping things off or picking things up from our table.  It was just too much, and felt overbearing.  It seemed to occur each time we got deep into conversation.  If they could just simmah down some with this, I could give an A on service.  Our server Chris was really nice, and gave a great suggestion for an appetizer to share.

Drinks:  A
There is a great selection of craft cocktails if that's your jam.  The prices range from $10-$14.  I don't remember the name of the drink my friend ordered, but I tried it, and it was very tasty!  I was in the mood for some summer bubbly, so I ordered a cava rose.  It was very good.

Food:  A-
The food was really good.  You're started off with 2 small homemade biscuits with honey, chive, and bacon butter.  ZOMG!  Sooo yummy!  After our waiter saw how much we loved (and devoured them), he promptly brought us more!  At the suggestion of our waiter, we started off sharing the smoked tuna tartare. It was fresh and delicious, and a perfect amount for sharing.  We decided to share two entrees.  We ordered the crawfish pasta and the curried goat with gnocchi.  The crawfish pasta was good, but it wasn't great.  I really prefer a cream type sauce with my pasta.  It had a good amount of spice, was flavorful, and it was cooked right, it just wasn't something I'd order again.  My friend really liked it.  Now the curried goat was fantastic.  I'm a sucker for curry, and this was no exception.  Tender goat in a flavorful gravy with homemade gnocchi and topped with tomatoes and cilantro.  I was slopping that up with mah biscuit.  For dessert, the kitchen sent out a surprise complimentary dessert of horchatta panna cotta with berry sorbet over a graham cracker crust and all topped with an assortment of melon balls.  It was light and flavorful, and the perfect end to a biscuit, pasta, and gnocchi meal.

Value:  B+
This place isn't cheap, but I didn't expect it to be either.  I'm ok with higher prices if you're putting out quality food, which they are.  My only complaint was that the entree portion sizes were a tad on the small size.  Had I not had the biscuits, and shared an appetizer, I'm not sure the entree would've been sufficient, and I find it safe to say that it wouldn't have been sufficient for a man.

I would absolutely recommend Compere Lapin for it's lovely atmosphere, and tasty food...especially if you're into curry.  That goat...

So, I'm biased because I am a student at improv shop, but love this place! 

From the perspective of an audience member, the shows are diverse, engaging, and always funny. The performers are genuine, talented, and relatable. I am always surprised how delicious the food is, ranging from fried foods to salads, and they have a full bar. The server that oversees the floor during a show is also extremely attentive, which is nice. 

From a student perspective, I have had three teachers so far for four classes (level 0-3) all of which have had different styles, but all been very engaged, know what they are doing, and are really great at translating their knowledge in language easily understood by students new to improv. As someone who was completely new to improv, I have thoroughly enjoyed my experience. 

Am officially an IS fan girl.

I absolutely love this place. Everyone was friendly and made sure I was relax and well taken care of. Holly did a great job with my pedicure and manicure, especially the massage part. They have a great selection of polishes and was willing to let me test out any colors before coming to a final decision. Most salons don't like offering that because it takes up more of their time but at Blanc they make sure everything is about you and nothing is rush. There is also complimentary mimosas with the service! Can't wait to come back and see these ladies again. Thanks for an amazing experience!

I like this place - I don't love it - but I think that I would say the same about almost any restaurant associated with a hotel.  The atmosphere and service is great, but the food is a bit overpriced for what you get.  It caters to a hotel / expense account crowd - which makes sense being that it is a hotel restaurant.  When someone else is picking up the tab you don't mind spending $50 on breakfast which is what mine ended up costing me - - with that said though - it was very very tasty!

We had a fine experience here with our (then) 3 year old - but it was about a year ago so maybe since then it has gone downhill?  We had burgers and chicken sandwiches and my daughter's kiddie meal came in a paper car.  She loved it.

We had a nice lunch here and would go back.

I am pretty excited to update my review for Edley's.

I went back. I got something different. Brisket Sandwich with 2 sides...Mac & Cheese and Green Beans.

Verdict: UPgrade!

Apparently, this place is like going to a Seafood restaurant and ordering spaghetti. You should order what they are known for. Lesson learned. They are known for their brisket, and brisket is what I got! LOVED it! The right amount of spice and tenderness. I got the mac & cheese which I LOOOOOVED, and then the green beans, which were pretty delicious too!

My companion ordered the brisket PLATE, and we both agreed that the sandwich looked like it had more brisket on there (just an FYI).

I would seriously go back JUST for the mac&cheese!

Absolutely love the chicken here! I've been here multiple times and it's never let me down. It's a great combination of a fast food restaurant mixed with a casual dining experience. You can also place online orders and pick up at the counter! I usually get the jumbo chicken tenders with their fries, but everything on their menu is phenomenal! I recommend trying their different sauces as they are all amazing.

I have found a new restaurant to have a love affair with. I've been following them closely on Facebook waiting for them to open.....

Upon walking in you are greeted immediately by the super friendly host. You can see the kitchen so no secrets are kept. I appreciate that in a restaurant. My party ordered the quack mac, blue duck sandwich, pork roll burger and both kinds of fries. We are still licking our fingers and wishing we ordered double of everything. 

If I had to complain about one thing it would be that the mac and cheese could have had a little bit more salt but I was very pleased. I can not wait to go back for brunch.

I apologize for the lack of pictures but I ate the food before thinking of taking a picture

I came to Drybar to get my hair done prior to my engagement picture session and was super excited with the outcome. My hair stylist was extremely nice and made sure to understand exactly what look I was going for. My picture time got changed so I came in hoping they had a walk in appointment. I was able to immediately get helped and was in and out within about 45 minutes and they did not seemed rush at all. My stylist kept offering to touch up any pieces if they weren't perfect. Nothing needed touched up though. Also, I loved being offered a mimosa as I checked in - nothing beats that! I went with the mai tai and loved the look. I also like a lot of the hair products they use- they don't make your hair feel greasy or like there is too much product in your hair. And the products allow you to easily get away without washing your hair for the next day or so without anyone noticing. I enjoyed my experience and will be back!

We stayed here again!!! We got a bigger room than last time and it was really nice, lots of space and a fridge :). I wish they had a pool here but other than that you probably wouldn't have to leave the hotel for anything. I love the Red Bar in the lobby area. All the staff are super nice, from the Valet to the housekeeping crew! I like the fact that I saw the same faces in the short amount of time that I was there and they said hello and had small talk, and this is w/ housekeeping and the bellman...not the lady who answer's the phone Mrs. Wills....that's just her job.

AMAZING. Best bowls in the city, no doubt. And for an amazing price too. Great location in the Gulch with indoor and outdoor seating. Inside has limited seating, but I'd say enough for like two groups. I got the Power Bowl but vegan version. The woman who prepared it was vegan also, so she knew exactly what to do which was comforting. It was filling and for a great price! The staff was super nice too. Love this place and will return soon!

Went for brunch on a Saturday, we ate at the chef's table (actually a bar) overlooking the cold prep and dessert station.  It was great getting a view of the workers and guessing as to what they were making.  The food was very unusual--Israeli meets southern.  We started with the whipped feta with honey and herb dip with grilled pita.  I ordered the bbq lamb topped biscuits and hubby ordered breakfast chorizo sausage burrito.  The feta was to die for and the entrees were both good.  Service was impeccable.  The only reason I dropped a star was because the lamb bbq could've been fresher and the outdoor patio area, although a lovely space, seemed unkempt.  They could do so much more with this area by adding fresh plantings and organizing it a bit by having nicer furniture, it seemed a blend that didn't match the interior.  Cleaning up the dead plants in the window boxes, doing some landscaping and picking up the miscellaneous items on the deck area.  Don't let the front facade or the location fool you, the food was very good and the atmosphere was hip and trendy.

***I LOVE this theater!!!***
It is a fantastic experience, EVERY time I go. It is on the other side of town for me, but I am more than willing to drive out there. It is completely worth the drive. The snack bar offers multiple options, including White Castle burgers.
Another great thing about this theater is that the location surrounded by other great stores in the plaza. 
Great way to get your movie, food and shopping done all in one trip!

I love just about everything at Melrose, except the fact that it's not in my hood, and that it gets entirely way too packed.  Even with that, I still don't mind driving the short distance every so often. 

Melrose happens to make one of my favorites except with a twist.  Take for example the beloved Bushwacker.  At Melrose it's called a Tallywacker.  Minus the 151 and a bit more vodka, it's a lot richer and thicker than the Brewhouse version.

I don't have anything negative to say about the food.  They use local beef for their burgers, the waffle fries are killer, they make a great veggie burger, and the tortilla soup is one of my wife's favorites.

2 for 1 on Thursday and a fairly decent Sunday special.  Not bad my friends, not bad at all.

I loved this place when I went here for Valentine's Day with my bf. Surprisingly, there was not a lot of people here that day so it was easy to walk around. Parking is no problem in this city it seems, there's a public parking structure very close by the courthouse.

The interior is just architecturally beautiful. I counted no less than four couples getting their engagement pictures done in the building. The view from the tower was absolutely gorgeous! It was a breezy and sunny day, perfect for seeing a FREE 360-degree view of Santa Barbara. 


It was a nice experience that I've recommended to other friends who might be coming here. I'll definitely take others here if I'm in the area.

I'm not a reel big fish lover, but Landry's has a lot of tasty options for people like me.  It's close enough to old Union Station to possibly be considered part of the decaying tourist trap, but it's separate enough to be considered the stand-alone classy joint that it is.  Once inside, I rather forgot how poor and vacant the external surroundings were, giving the restaurant a strange transportive property.  As I said, I'm not a seafood connoisseur, but I did enjoy my dinner, and therefore I can recommend Landry's.

Love this subway.  Always clean and tidy inside.staff are friendly and build your sandwich how you want it. Not skimpy on toppings and they take their time without rushing or trying to just get you through the line.

By far my favorite coffee shop. I live in Tampa, every time I head to St Pete I always make a stop here. I love the location downtown. There is always plenty of parking in the street. It's also surrounded by a lot of fun little shops to walk to. I always get a chill/hipster vibe when I walk in. One of my favorite features is the garage door. When I go here I tell them to surprise me with my coffee. I've never had anything bad. I'm in love with the salted caramel ice coffee

Everything is always great! I have been here many many times and for some reason always forgot to leave a review. 
The place is tiny. BYOB. You pretty much always need a reservations as its usually packed. Not for lunch. Pretty good chance of getting a table for lunch. 
The food is delish! Initially hubs wasn't thrilled with going vegetarian, but I assured him he wouldn't miss meat. He didn't. The flavor combination is terrific. They use a variety of veggies, mushrooms, grains and lots of yummy cheeses. 
Shoe string fries are always a go as well as all of the desserts are usually extremely yummy. They change their menu all the time to add more exciting dishes on. 
I love this place and will always come back to it.

The Pros.

The restaurant decor & overall eye appeal was
beautiful.  Table settings with flowers in a vase, glass water decanters & mason jars to drink out of.  The view from the 2nd floor looking down on both the kitchen & the busy street corner was great for former cook slash tourist enjoying that beautiful spring day.  

I was easy amused by the menu for the colas, as 
Baileys offers a large variety of locally made beverages.  We ordered the Million Dollar Orange made with real cane sugar from just across the river in Illinois. We also tried a cold one from Fitz's root beer bottled in St. Louis (my favorite this meal) & and a cold long time Classic Coke a in a bottle from Mexico.

The food was fun, and tasted as good as it looked.  
They have a wide variety of unique toppings paired with different ingredients making for some great burger combinations.  The toppings range from guacamole to Camembert cheese. They offer pretzel & gluten free buns.  A few things that peeked my taste bud's intrest were Fontina cheese, the pablano sour cream, the tomato jam and a few other ingredients.   

I like the option to build your own burger or substitute pork, chicken, bison, lamb or a veggie burger instead of beef on your burger.  I was kinda surprised they didn't have a turkey burger option though. House made ketchup, nice touch

Service was great. Our server was very helpful & I love it when a server is knowledgeable of the menu.  Last but not least.... the house made pickles were addictive. Zesty pickles with a little bit of heat, definitely one of a kind.  My taste buds will hold that memory tight for years 

The cons

The burgers were a little small for 8-10 dollars.  Which is fine, I enjoyed every bite. We were so full and hopped up on all the sugar from the pop we didn't have any room to explore the shake menu.

We really enjoyed our lunch at Baileys and we all agreed that if we lived in town this would not have been our only visit.  We were so into the burger battle my son & I decided to have our own. I got the Carolina with pulled pork, coleslaw and BBQ sauce.  He got the ABC Burger with roasted (A)pples, (B)acon & (C)amembert cheese.  So be sure to check out my photos & vote for your favorite.

Strip mall pancake house on a busy Sunday morning. They were all friendly and the food was basic breakfast fair. Could work in a few changes to coordinate not seating a family with baby and highchair squished next to an over sized group, creating a bottleneck for servers to squeeze through. Though they were flexible and accommodating to accept our request to change booths, and remained friendly and professional. Thank you to our server for that (I wish I could remember her name.) FOOD: Zac had the Mexican skillet which he said was pretty good, just noted the guacamole was heavy on garlic. Baby had oatmeal with bananas and raisins, which was a bit bland, so we requested a bit of cinnamon to sprinkle on top and she loved it. I had the veggie omelet with hashbrowns and pancakes on the side. I'd definitely recommend this dish.

This place is awesome. Been traveling to Philly for work and needed a place more healthy. Type healthy into yelp and viola-- brought me to the fabulous udon noodle salad. Very filling at an average price point. Not too bad!

A perfect mix of the flavors with a perfect amount of udon noodles and lettuce and all the other stuff they put in each bite. I was pretty impressed how mixed it was. Loved the asian flavors. Plus the tofu "chik'n" is awesome. Like another yelper said, it doesn't make me miss chicken... (For this meal.)

Also got a groothie-- another popular item I saw on yelp and had to try. Pretty good and another filling item for my dinner.

I wish their website had nutritional information, though. Definitely will be back to try other stuff.

If you love the casino life, you will probably love the Peppermill. I am not a fan by any stretch, so for me, everything looks gaudy and over-designed and looks like it would've been luxurious in the 80s, but not in 2016. Or like the designer is Donald Trump's interior designer. I'm in the Tuscany Tower. When the furniture is lush, the walls (not wallpaper, not paint, but texturized walls) AND fixtures, AND bedding, AND lamps, AND everything in eyesight does not need to be lush, too. Too too much, and not at all contemporary. I get that the theme is Italy. I've been to Italy. It doesn't look like this.

The casino furniture also looks like it hasn't been updated since the 80s. That said, nothing is in disrepair. Everything is functional. When I got to my room, I was actually about to call down to the front desk to see if I was in the right room, because I have two TVs (one in the bathroom), two sinks in the bathroom, two shower heads in the shower, and a jacuzzi tub for two. Apparently, all rooms are similar. Some others on this trip with me noted that they have a jacuzzi SPA that could accommodate four in the MIDDLE of their room. This is very 80s, Peppermill! No one thinks that's cool anymore. Well, no one outside of the casino life and under 50, anyway.

I was surprised that the rooms didn't come with refrigerator or microwave. It's a resort, so I understand that they make their money on incidentals. So they have a mini fridge and snack bar in each room to keep you from bringing in your own stuff. Further, as a resort, all of the restaurants are grossly overpriced. Again, you're paying for the convenience of having everything right here. And it seems a lot of the food is the same regardless of where you're eating, especially the desserts.

Once my eyes recovered from bleeding and my wallet stopped screaming, I can say that the Peppermill is very accommodating. The fitness center is more than adequate, complete with numerous treadmills, elliptical trainers, free weights, weight machines, a studio for calisthenics, a steam room... and they give free bottled water.

All of the staff is super nice and accommodating from front desk to housekeeping to the many restaurants. They understand service.

If you want to get married, they even have two wedding chapels here. Gotta love Nevada.

I know it's not a 5 star restaurant, but you can't go wrong with Dot's Diner. It's cheap, it's filling, and it's comfort food. Plus, there's hardly any wait! (Funny story: as my husband and I arrived at Dot's Diner were IMMEDIATELY seated, I get a pop-up notification from Yelp telling me to check out the Ruby Slipper, current wait time: 45 minutes!!!! hahahaha, heck no! I'll take immediate seating & classic, cheap breakfast fare over a 45 minute wait for more expensive, smaller portions, and fewer options). 

I got the Big Dot because I couldn't make up my mind on what to eat, like usual. It's two eggs, 2 strips of bacon, 2 sausage patties, 2 pancakes, hash browns, grits, and toast. My hubby got the western omelet and added corned beef to his side of hashbrowns because he was torn between the omelet and the corned beef hash. The portions were huge, and have of me is ashamed to admit we scarfed down the whole thing and promptly napped for 2 hours after (the other half of me is SUPER proud). 

My only complaint was that one of my eggs was still raw (a good portion was clear and runny, but our waitress apologized profusely and took it back to toss it on the grill for another minute. Usually, I might be upset, but considering the fact that our food came out less than 10 minutes after we ordered AND they were packed, I knew it was just a quick oversight, and it was super easy to cook it for a few more seconds, no harm no foul.

My absolute favorite part though is that they NEVER let your coffee cup get empty. As a person whose blood type is actually 95% coffee, I greatly appreciate this fact. That, and the waitresses always call you "sugar" and "honey" and I just love that Southern charm, its warm and endearing and I wish it was still around more down here!

They have amazing wings here! They're pretty big in size and always delicious. I also love the chips they serve with a ranch sauce on the side. Those are the bomb! Once I stopped eating chicken though, I sadly, had no reason to return. I'm just not a huge fan of their salads. I recall thinking they were bland and "nothing special". I'd say Eats American Grill is a great place to go for a low- key dinner or place to watch sports. The waitresses are nice here as well! It's a small restaurant but I've never had to wait to sit and the parking lot is also small, but I've never had a problem finding a spot. enjoy! xo

Nom nom nom! I love this place and it's great that it's right around the corner from my apartment. I've come here for brunch many a time and can't really say that they disappoint. The only downside is the small space that they have. I know they have a backyard patio which isn't a bad addition to their space but it would be a lot nicer to have other spaces to sit. I've heard a big hub bub about their sweet potato fries but I must say that I was very underwhelmed...the fries were soggy and seemed like they were a day old. I will say that their sweet potato hash was really good and the sandwich I've gotten which has maple bacon and avocados were also very appetizing. Coffee is good but what kind of coffee isn't good besides the overly burnt ones I suppose! Overall, it's a good brunch place if you don't mind waiting and get any of their egg dishes or sweet potato hash. Maybe I'll give the sweet potato fries another time but for the time being, it was a bit disappointing.

This is a fun spot to grab a beer in the Funk Zone. The atmosphere is chill and there is a good beer selection. It can be crowded inside sometimes but the outdoor patio is nice. Although they don't brew their own beer, they have good beers on tap, canned beers to bring home, and a nice selection of wines. The prices are pretty reasonable. I haven't tried the food yet but maybe next time I'm in the area. I love that the bar is dog friendly!

I have been to a lot of hockey games in my life and hockey is by far my favorite sport. With no professional Indianapolis team to speak of, I had a big puck shaped hole in my heart for a while. I tried going to and Indiana Ice game, but the atmosphere was lacking and it felt like I was watching a high school game. 

When the Fuel showed up this year, there was hope for all Hoosier hockey fans, and the Fuel have delivered with spades. The fan base is small, but strong and vocal. The games are energetic enough to be very enjoyable and the minor leaguers aren't above dropping the gloves. The ticket prices are very reasonable and $15 tickets still give you an amazing view of the ice (and pyrotechnics).

I highly recommend trying the Fuel out for anyone who loves hockey or anyone who hasn't seen the light.

I can't believe I am just now getting around to this review. One of the best italian restaurants I have ever had the pleasure of visiting. Its my favorite special occasion restaurant. Birthdays, parents in town, surviving the work week, you know, milestones. 

Excellent wine list. Something for everything pallet. I highly recommend following the chef's recommendations that are on the menu and appear next to each entrée. The staff is very knowledgable and able to give great recommendations based on your taste and order. 

Their pasta is out of this world. I love the ravioli pensare. Rich and creamy seafood ravioli that comes with generous helpings of shrimp and scallops. I've also had their veal piccata. Perfectly cooked. 

My #1 restaurant in Dunedin.

I'll preface this review with: yes, I realize I was the idiot who went to Mazzaros on a Saturday. But I can't make the trek on a weekday. I was excited to venture through the market. They definitely have an impressive array of items to select from. Wine...cheese...meat...so much! I love that I could really accumulate the fixings for an Italian meal there. But to be honest, I didn't make a single purchase that day. It was so packed and crazy in there it wasn't worth it. Awesome items, but not worth the pushing, waiting in line, etc. Hopefully one day I can visit at a less busy time!

This restaurant was by far the best experience I had in my week of staying in New Jersey. Not only was the food exceptional, but so was the service. 

Every item we ordered was delicious. The brisket was a little fatty, but still extremely flavorful. The ribs had the perfect crust on them and the wings were big with a generous seasoning of garlic parm on them. My guest really enjoyed her sandwich and the candied yams. She also ordered mad and cheese which was very tasty! We were given 3 different bottles of their BBQ sauce and they were all very good, my favorite was the Kansas City. 

The service was so great. Our waitress was very nice and kept checking on us. Additionally, someone who I think was the owner came over and greeted us, as well as clearing away some of our plates on his way out. Even upon walking in, many customers who looked like regulars greeted us, and one held the door for us on the way out. 

As we were about to leave, our waitress told us that every night the entire bar takes a shot at 1911, and poured us both a shot of complimentary Bacardi. Everyone in the restaurant cheersed and drank the shot, it was so nice!

Prices were also very reasonable for the quality and amount of food. Such a great experience here, would love to come back.

M.L Rose was mediocre at best. I love pubs and pub food and I was disappointed. The good thing about checking in on yelp is you get 6 free wings which were good. I got the sweet and sticky which did not disappoint. My burger, however, did. I asked for it to be cooked medium with chips. I had asked our server if when they say chips if they're british chips similiar to fries (think fish and chips) and he said yes. When it came out, I was given fried potato chips. I politely asked for the waffle fries and apologized and they were nice about swapping them out. We didn't start into our burger until the fries were brought out and then I noticed that my burger was cooked well-done and was partially burned. At that point, I didn't want to call the server back over since I had already sent back my fries and there was a possibility of some irate line cook wanting to spit on my food. So I sucked it up and vowed not to eat there again...unless I want wings with my beer.

Good points : they have craft beers, a happy hour and trivia night

There's often a line but I don't mind the wait.  There's an army of teens working inside so the order do come out fairly fast once you placed it.  

Their regular ice cream includes strawberry, vanilla and chocolate.  You can also order from a few dozen of specialty flavors, like pina colada, blueberries, espresso, etc.  They also have twirls which is like Dairy Queen's Blizzard.  They have several cones to choose from.

I love their ice cream, it's very creamy and smooth.  I usually like to pay 50 cents more for the specialty flavor, there are so many to pick from I always have a hard time deciding.  However, I don't know if it's the lack of consistency with the staff about how much syrup to add.  One time my espresso is really flavorful, another time I can hardly tell the pina coloda in mine.

Love their pizza - hands down one of the best. Usually, I get the margherita or the four cheese. Once, I tried their special with prosciuto and salami which was heavenly. 
Yes, there's a wait time usually here but I've managed to get seated within 15 min the most. Now, if you present here around 6 pm on a Friday night or around lunch time on the weekend, be prepared to wait way  longer than that. It's obvious that people around the neighborhood take advantage. Also, the space is not that large so it gets crowded easily.

I'm the kind of person that craves rice on the reg and being away from home, I always miss the semblance of a home cooked meal. So naturally this place called to me. I was really excited by the interior decor. It's nothing flashy but has a tropical feel and reminded me of a lot of the Latin diners in Houston. The food is pretty good. We ordered the ropa vieja with the rice and beans as well as a beef pastelito (empanada), ceviche de camaron (shrimp) and flan. 

The ropa vieja was super! The juice/sauce was delicious and drenched the white rice so nicely. LOVED that they had the el Yucateca sauce at the table! In my opinion one of the best bottled spicy salsas out there so you BEST know I drenched my meal in it. Put some on the pastelito as well and did not disappoint. Also loved their mango water btw! Order some aguas frescas to feel refreshed and get some sugar in there. 

The ceviche was kind of disappointing, not going to lie. It felt over seasoned with salt. It didn't look the most aesthetically pleasing either. Please come here for the more meaty and rice options! The flan I was also not as thrilled by. It had a bit of an odd packaged flavor to it but you know I still ate the whole thing. 

Come have a nice cheap and filling meal. Will feel very hearty!

STOP!   Think twice and don't believe the hype... If you say you are great you better be, if you screw up - own it.  SAVE YOUR $$$

The crux of the issue with Vetri was that they ran out of the good stuff and because we were the late seating, got the vegetarian selection. FAIL! 

It was a weird experience, and it is hard not to give them the benefit of the doubt when the reviews are so solid, but I need to speak the truth. First the reservation was for the wrong day and this might have been a simple mistake. We were told it would be 45 minutes and of course it became 85. They did compensate a bit and put out an excellent cured meat selection and vegetables with reduced balsamic. This was a nice beginning and the high point. 

Here is my 6 course chef tasting (FYI I said don't hold back, I eat anything) 
1... Tomato salad - it was tasty, lightly dressed with a nice mix of vegetables (I don't think this was even on the menu) 
2... Sweet Onion Crepe with White Truffle - this was excellent and the truffle around it was a great mix 
3... Almond Tortellini with Truffle Sauce - fresh pasta, amazingly unique 
4.... Heirloom Tomato Risotto - another vegetable dish that was just not that interesting and certainly not worth the calories.  Most of the plates went back. I think they saw this as a sign. 

AT THIS POINT I WAS NERVOUS 4 out 6 tastings done and not a single protein. And the final dish was... 

5... Dry Aged Ribeye - it was fine, but definitely the least exotic and boring entree. And in a city with some of the best steakhouses in the world, I would have considered this for an entree. 

At this point we saw some serious scurrying going on in the kitchen and they brought out 2 dishes to share. I'm assuming this was what they had left. 
... Baby Goat with freshly stone milled polenta - This was excellent.  I never thought I'd like Goat, now I love those cute little animals.
... Bass - it was OK (not sure where this was on the menu) 

DINNER DONE - FAIL 
On the menu was lobster, whole fish, octopus, sweetbreads, quail, duck... Talk about the ultimate bait and switch, we were served none of it. 

6... Desserts was another sorry story of "We ran out of chocolate."  What?  On a price fixe?  Am I allowed to say I ran out of money?  They were nice enough to give us a tasting, but there were no stand outs. 

Another disappointment was that the entire table did the Grand Wine Tasting, so we hoped this would push the food over the top. The wines were excellent- tons of refills, the problem was they were selected for a bad boring tasting. 

Service was the high point and our waitress was as good as we have had. My suggestion for them is if you see a dinner going south, stop it. Be intuitive enough to intervene and flexible enough to make your customers happy, this is what the best restaurants do. They should have explained the problem, not charged us a premium for a boring and lazy menu. At a top Italian restaurant our same meal would have cost a quarter of the check without wine. And there would have been more food to eat and we would have chosen better. 

I feel bad saying, but this was the worst chef tasting I have ever had and the cost for a mainly vegetarian meal was crazy. They ran out of food... I ran out of stars, suck it up, don't rest on your reviews and own it. 

TIP: Consider not going on a Saturday night, as Chef Vetri is not working. 
TIP 2: Pick exactly what you want from the menu 

I welcome anyone from Vetri to respond to this review and explain what happened and why I had the world's most expensive almost vegetarian meal.

Darn it, I am so conflicted with my review of this establishment. Weeks before my vacation, I had found this place on Yelp and was looking forward to visiting, but after what happened, I think this place may have been my downfall.

I know that sounds super dramatic, but just hear me out. I visited District Donuts on Saturday (05/27/17) with my family. We each got a donut and one slider. I got a classic cheeseburger slider and a chocolate glazed donut. My mom and my sister also got cheeseburger sliders, but different donuts. I really enjoyed my slider in that moment, it tasted nice, but I will admit, it was quite greasy. The donut was also pretty good but could be considered a bit rich. 

Anyway, long story short, later that afternoon, I got, very, very sick. I believe that District Donuts was the culprit. I didn't want to believe it, but after reading some other reviews about the chefs not wearing gloves when handling the meat, I am not convinced this is where I got my food poisoning. I had to stay in bed all of Sunday because of it. I literally don't know what else could have made me this sick since this was my only meal that day. (I skipped Breakfast)

Saw this on the food network on Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives and searched this place out to try the citrus kale salad that was featured on the show. I drove a friend up to Vandy for an appointment and decided to have an early lunch here. Finding the place was a little bit difficult because it is BEHIND the ace hardware store in the same parking lot. There wasn't a sign indicating it was there. Parked in front at about 11am. 

Location looked like it used to be a car garage. Windows were tagged with the name of the business. I thought it was kind of cool. Went in and the place definitely was much larger on the inside. The decor is eclectic and urban. Had a chill atmosphere kinda like just a place to hang out and eat good food. I had to ask where the menu was and it's high up on the ceiling on chalk boards above the door.  Also told him that it was hard to find and it would be useful to have a bigger sign. One of the guys said that they were having one done and should be up soon. I mentioned that they should have one of the area's graffiti artists to make a sign for them to fit in with the decor. He kinda chuckled but i think he was just humoring me. The kitchen was in the open and everyone seemed to be busy. There was a variety of cold salads that all looked good and healthy. All the ingredients are organic and fresh. They were cooking on an free standing electric grill but they recently moved and it just fits in somehow. It reminded me of a large island cabana roadside food cafe. And EVERYONE knows that those things have the BEST food!! Anyways....

The menu items had some crazy names but i think it tied in to the atmosphere well. They had a lot of items to choose from and they all looked good. I chose a turkey, bacon wrap with hummus, avocado and of course a plate of the kale salad! My friend chose the ruban sandwich and we sat down at one of the tables. I looked around a bit while we waited due to the only ones in there at the time. They have lounge couches and an area for a open mike poetry or local band. The garage doors looked like they would open up during the summer months and be kinda like a great place to just chill and have a beer. There wasn't a theme, it was just random and trippy. I loved it. They just picked furniture that they liked. I am a bit of a eclectic myself and i was comfortable. The place was clean!! I don't know why ppl gave such bad reviews. 

The food was AMAZING. They are not skimpy on the portions either. Most organic places give you a tiny plate that looks too pretty to eat. This place is no joke. It's like an urban free birds ( texas ppl you know what I'm talking about!!) If you're OCD about themes and matching things. And focus on the decor more than the food then you should probably not go there. I could only eat half the wrap and it was fresh!! The humus in it was amazing and the turkey tasted like they had prepared the bird. The bacon was crisp and yummy. The avocado was fresh and the pickle on the side was just crazy good. I could eat a jar of those things. My friend could only eat half of his reuben too. But he said that it was really good as well. One of the best one's he's had. 
The kale salad was A.M.A.Z.I.N.G!!! I have a love/hate relationship with kale. It's really good for you but i hate the taste of it. The salad had fruit and nuts in it, beans and a citrus dressing!! OMG!! I could of ate a bucket of that stuff. 
Half way through eating, people started flooding through the door about 12pm. It was a very popular place for lunch and you had a huge variety of people there. Just random people with no theme looking for a great place to eat!! I will def be back to this place when I'm around that area. It's pretty close to the highway too. I left full but not stuffed, light and not heavy. Great place with amazing food! If you want to think outside of the box, take off your shoes and chill for a bit and experience amazing organic food, i encourage you to go here.  I will def. be back! :) Great place!!

I love going places where I can order anything off the menu and not worry about it not being vegan. The line was very long and for a good reason but they worked fast. I ordered several things because I was so excited. Everything tasted so good! I'm sad this is not a national chain, more of places like this please!

A must-visit during this fall season when you can't make it apple picking but still want all the benefits of that cozy autumn feeling.
As mentioned in other reviews, the ciders are not sweet (which I LOVE- no hangovers!), but still have an abundance of flavor. I liked the bee sting the most with its ginger flavor, but really wanna try the peppercorn one our waitress told us about in her going-over-the-menu spiel (which was MUCH appreciated, having never been here before).
Can't wait to go back again when I'm in the neighborhood!
Also- it's BYOF (food), and there's outdoor seating. Double yay!

Loved the look of place and bar area looked inviting fir sure.  But dined at table with family instead.  The sauce flavor of my cashew chicken and the brown rice were good but the chicken was so tough I could not chew it without fear of choking.

During a recent trip to Louisiana, my son and I visited this Fleming's location.  We shared the fixed price menu of Filet with Lobster Tail.  It was served with a grilled scallop small appetizer as well as a salad.  The price was $50 and it was definitely enough for my son and me to share.  The bread was fresh and accompanied by a delicious butter as well as crab spread.  This location does offer Happy Hour, but only for patrons that sit in the bar.  If I return to this city, I'd love to visit this Fleming's location again.  Great job, Fleming's!

Last night my husband took me to Golden Corral for dinner. I was really looking forward to it. For so long the food was terrible, but about a year ago or so the food improved so much that we loved to eat there. It was delicious for quite awhile. Now I don't know what has happened, but the food quality has once again gone way down. Many fried things are burnt to a crisp. The 5 types of wings were not good at all. They were over cooked and dry. The sauces were not even flavorful. Once again, what they offer is not worth the price.// This morning we came for the breakfast buffet and I have to give it 5 stars!! The breakfast buffet has everything you could ask for.  Biscuits and gravy, toast and chip beef gravy, corn beef hash, scrambled eggs, all types of Dixon's to put in your scrambled eggs, a lady that makes omelettes to order, taters, taters with cheese, Mexican food, fried chicken, bacon, sausage links and patties, fresh fruit, milk-White and chocolate, fruit juices, salads, desserts, banana nut bread, and more! WHEW!

Worth the long wait.

My boyfriend and I were in Nashville for NYE weekend and decided to stop here and skip the cold line at Biscuit Love. Instead we could give our name and number and come back! (We strolled to 2 old hippies store not too far away in the Gulch)

We both ordered fried chicken biscuits and they were phenomenal! Of course filling, but the service was so warm and friendly we felt no rush to get out of there!

For dimsum outside of Center City's Chinatown...AWESOME!

This is closer to my house then driving to center city, and I truly can appreciate that. It seats a decent amount of people (~50) and although I've only gone on weekends at lunch time, the place is pretty packed all the time. The patrons are mainly chinese, and you'll hear the chinese chatter around you all the time mixed with some english. The servers pushing the dim sum cart speak limited english but there is always the art of pointing or calling over the owner/manager who speaks english well. 

This is the type of establishment that only gives you tea, and water upon request. Service is fast and efficient, and the food served is hot and fresh. The dimsum they have is an OK selection, I've been to ones that have worse and better, but for what they do serve, I believe the quality is pretty good, esp since this strip of asian businesses is located in a unusual place in northeast philly. 

The parking is always kinda rough, but I've never had to look for more than 10 mins before something popped up. Other than that, the standard noodle dishes are traditional and not fakey american. I love dry (no gravy) chicken chow fun. They do a good job here on the noodles in general, probably have tried 5 different varieties and never been disappointed.

Def somewhere to check out if you live nearby and dont like going to the city for some authentic chinese food/dim sum. It's cured some of my homecooked cravings from my childhood while living away from home, so I will continue to be a patron.

I found this place by using Yelp. It was not what I expected. 
The décor is unique.  See my numerous pictures.

The coffee is pretty good. Nothing to write home about, but the CHAI IS AWESOME! I love the mugs they give you when you drink your coffee inside the shop.  I really like the people that work here. They are super nice and very helpful.  They seem to keep the place neat and clean. I have never seen anything just sitting out on the tables.  

The deserts in the case are ok. I have never had anything bad, but they didn't taste super fresh either. 

The patrons are a diverse group. It's as if someone  took a random cross section of New Orleans people and plopped them in a coffee shop together.  

It tends to get a little stuffy in the middle room, but maybe that is just me. I enjoy coming here. It is an experience every time.

Really good food and great Iced Coffee - pus decent service (but it was really hot in there this last time we went for lunch.

The Chicken over broken rice (or banh) is great and the Chinese broccoli  in garlic sauce was crispy and tender and cooked to perfection.

And you can get flaming rum drinks, too - though we never do.

Love Vietnam for a quick comforting meal.

When it comes to my breakfast, I HATE CHAINS.  Well I'm lying, I do love me some Cracker Barrel but I really love dive diners for my breakfast.  Skyway Jacks serves up hearty portions at cheap prices and the menu is huge.  I can get my eggs, bacon, corn muffin, strong coffee AND a side of pancakes here on the cheap.  I'm not ashamed!  I want it all when it comes to my breakfast!

Downside, the place is a bit "sticky" and on weekends there is typically a 5-10 minute wait.

I have been coming to this place for years and I still love it! The Melody Inn is a great bar with great live music. The drinks are reasonably priced and the selection is good. I have seen a lot of cool band here, many of them local. The crowd here is the nicest crowd you will find in any bar - no meat market jerks looking to start fights! The location of this bar is pretty rough, but I have never had any problems inside of the bar. I would just recommend parking close to the building and locking up your car!!! For the price, there is no better way to spend a free night than watching some music and having some drinks at the Melody Inn!

Penang is a Malaysian place in Chinatown, and part of a chain.

The decor was unusual, there were metal fixtures in the ceiling serving a purely ornamental function. The restaurant was divided into two sections, a ground floor and slightly elevated platform. I had a window seat with a lovely view (of the street - this is Philadelphia, after all).

Service (Ha) was attentive, they came by to check to see if we had ordered and filled our water glasses repeatedly. The wait staff was ever-present, delivered food quickly, didn't mind taking pictures, and even walked over when I gave a thumbs-up sign (which was surprising).

The penang poh piah (steamed Malaysian spring roll stuffed with jicama, fried tofu, eggs and bean sprouts) was light and sweet. The Mee Siam (stir-fried rice noodles with tofu, shrimp and bean sporuts in a tangy sweet (they say "spicy") Thai chili sauce, sprinkled with ground peanuts and sliced hard boiled eggs on the side) was fine, too. Not terribly expensive, and credit cards are accepted now (minimum purchase of $12).

Noise level was acceptable, though I had to strain somewhat to hear my fellow diner (she's soft-spoken, so that didn't help). Worth a visit if you've never been.

UPDATE: February 22, 2008 - went here with a large, raucous party - food was delicious - management and service was patient with our group, considering how drunkenly rowdy many of our group was... also, the interior has changed since the last time I was here, and renovations are still happening.

This pub is a great, love that we have it in the north dale area, especially since this part of town is fairly boring. This pub has two bars and there is great diversity in customers young and older people  I loved it. I'll deff be coming back! I just have always loved a pub vibe and glad we have one so close to home. Jalapeño poppers were ok so I'll deff have to try some other things next time !

Russell's is another place I go to semi regularly yet have not managed to review.

I have been here on dates, with friends, and solo... The full spectrum 

Except for twice I have always sat at the bar (makes me feel more a part of the action and I love bartenders). I will note that at Russell's sitting at the bar does lead to slower service. 

This place also gets busy. 

In the mornings they have an excellent pastry collection (they also sell this throughout the day too). I can recommend their snicker doodle cookies. Their chocolate flourless torte (typically offered with strawberry slices or blackberries on top - you can specify which you want if they have the selection). And the best of the best... Their pumpkin cheesecake.

That cheesecake is better than the cheesecake factory's pumpkin cheesecake and way less than the $10 or so Cheesecake Factory charges. I think a slice is around (or under) $5. It has this whipped cream on it that is firmer than cheesecake factory's, but not nearly as hard (and inedible) as Hartford's. Take note Hartford Coffee there is a whipped cream garnish that can withstand a display case that tastes good and is not ridiculously hard.

The cheesecake is also incredibly smooth and creamy.


Anyway. Enough dessert talk.

They also have a lunch menu that you can now only get during lunch. Sandwiches, wraps, and such.

Dinner menu is only served at dinner time.


This was a recent change.

I have had the grilled cheese from the lunch menu and a modified Kitchen Sink salad from their dinner menu.

I have also had the Moscato on their menu (with a dog named Moscato that should not be surprising). And it is great.


The staff is really friendly.... In particular this younger guy they have on staff who I would peg to be 22 and this other guy who tends to pour my wine.

They also have decent wine pours here. Varying depending on who pours  and how bad they surmise your day was.... 

Great little neighborhood spot that is worth a trip even if it's not your neighborhood

So I went to The Dive Bar with a friend after already having had a lions share of wine and Makers.  When I first walked into The Dive it was like I was back home where i grew up in No-No-town.  The atmosphere is pure dive (love it).  The people hanging out there are all real people with no false pretenses.  The Dive Bar makes no apologies for what it is....... a drinking hole and for that they get 4 stars.  I've only been there one time (so I'll reserve any stars) but I hope it's not my last (hint! hint!).  I'd love to go back and sample some more of their awesome selection of beers.  Of course the owner/bartender, Johnny, kindly dressed in a pretty nighty to amuse all the patrons.  He was a little flat chested and all the tattoo's were a little distracting, but otherwise he was a sexy damn bartender (lol) with a great attitude.  I'd go back anytime and I'm sure I'd be just as welcomed.  Thanks Susan!

Stayed here for one night on the last night of our two week roadtrip. 

Hotel is in a train station dating from the 1890s and is on the list of historic hotels of America. 

Everywhere was spotless and check in was flawless.

The bed was v comfortable and decent shower. 

Loved the grand hall which was a great spot to enjoy a drink or two but what really nailed it for me and earned them five stars was the ceiling light show they have hourly between 5pm and 11pm. We caught a couple of the shows and no two were the same. 

Shame we didn't get to spend longer here.

I love this place! It has such a great vibe and being on the water, the views are gorgeous :)

The food is always good!

This time had the smoked Wings, the mahi tacos, and the Mac and cheese with chicken. The wings were crispy (not breaded, yay!) and popping with flavor! The mahi was a little dry and needed better seasoning. The Mac and cheese was super creamy and delicious!

We always try to hit up this place whenever we're house sitting for my boss. It's a nice, homey place, with great service and yummy food.

We usually start off with the fire feta, which is great. I love feta and, with a little heat in there, it goes very well with pita bread.

I usually get the soutzoukaki, which is one of the best I've had. The lunch portion is a good size too.

OK, I really don't care for the whole Clayton "scene" or whatever, but I loved Oceano.  I thought the food and service was excellent, so I've got no complaints.  I'm basing my review solely on the fact that really good, fresh seafood is hard to come by in St. Louis, and at my first visit to Oceano, it rocked.  I didn't come here looking for a "trendy scene" or anything - I just came for good seafood.

My friend and I hit up lunch here on a Saturday, which wasn't very busy.  We both ordered a glass of wine, and the server brought the bottle over for us to taste before pouring us an entire glass - smart!  Maybe it's just me, but I've never been to a restaurant before where they did that.  Highly appreciated, and once again, smart.  We started with the crabcake, which was awesome!  The lemongrass-chili aioli that it sat on worked perfectly with the crabcake.

I had the lemon-crab risotto, which was phenomenal!  Seriously, I've been having dreams about it since.  The lemon flavor was really delicate, and the risotto was so creamy.  It was awesome!  My friend had the grouper sandwich, which was surprisingly good  - much better than you'd expect a group sandwich to be.  All the flavors and textures there worked really well.

We had no complaints with the service, which was always there when we needed it, but never bothersome with checking on us too often.  The entire staff was friendly and helpful.

Overall, an awesome experience that will hopefully be the first of many to come!

We showed up 45 min before close which isn't bad, but I usually don't like doing. The server was still really friendly and didn't really rush us. The fried okra and fried pickles were great. I love okra, and this was top notch. I hate pickles, but I ate a dozen little fried slices dipped in ranch. I got the jambalaya which was pretty good. It has like a spring vegetable mix in it which was weird, but the smoked sausage was delicious. The cornbread was the highlight of the meal, it was on point. Super moist and sweet. The drinks took a while but it's more of a restaurant than a bar. I'd like to go back on a slower night.

I do love BBQ!

What shocked me the most is the location. Love the fact its a roadside BBQ.

THE CHICKEN WAS SO FRICKEN GOOD!!!! The smoke on it was outstanding, the sauce that accompanied it for dipping had an amazing flavor. 

The only problem I found is with the location. The reason this is a problem is that I live in Brandon and this is such a far drive!!!!! I wish that Amazon would initiate their drone delivery program, so I could have them drop me a chicken dinner off.

Keep up the great BBQ!!!!

Walking into this restaurant you have a mixed sense of grand dining or hole in the wall dining. The place is very large with magnificent architecture that just doesn't blend well with the 70's themed wooden chairs and tables. Aesthetics aside, I looked forward to some good eats based on others' reviews. The kids and I quickly looked over the menu to find an agreeable appetizer. The menu had a good selection of apps, salads, sandwiches, pizza and wings. We went with the fried pickles.  They came in an order of 6 fried spears with a spicy ranchish dip that I didn't care for.  The regular ranch worked better. Kids loved their sweet tea. For dinner my daughter ordered the caprese sandwich, my son ordered the Del Mar pizza and a calzone, I ordered the turkey sandwich. The caprese sandwich looked yummy and my daughter enjoyed it, only stating that it could have used more balsamic glaze. My son did not like the Del Mar pizza. The cheese was clumpy, looked under cooked and the taste was off. He added salt and pepper; still flavorless. He said the calzone was okay, nothing great. That suprised me since the owners also own Northeast Pizza; one of the best pizza places I've been to. My turkey sandwich, recommended by our waitress sounded incredible. Turkey on a crossant with melted guyriere and fresh strawberries. Tons of good turkey! But sparse on strawberries and cheese. It also needed some type of dressing possibly balsamic glaze. Overall it was okay. I just felt like everything needed some extra umpf.

Breakfast on Sunday is the BEST way to start the day. This place was PACKED and I thought we got there early! There is only street parking from what I saw. The menu is simple and most items are re-invented versions of something classic. I love their interpretations! I will be back!

Delicious ice cream and friendly staff! Excellent nondairy options.

I have a dairy sensitivity and lactose intolerance, but love ice cream. Jeni's satisfies my sweet tooth without hurting my belly.

I had the dairy-free Texas Sheet Cake, which features decadent chocolate cake crumbles, bittersweet fudge, and palate-gripping fair trade cocoa. 

There is plenty outdoor seating, too!

I almost hate myself for giving what may be very expensive, fancy "mozzarella sticks" 5 stars, but guys, these live up to the hype.

They were so, so good.

I'm a cheese lover (born in Wisconsin, actually), and the [mild white cheddar] cheese here is quality.  Has a rich, clean taste.  The breading is perfect--not too greasy and in good ratio to cheese.

I mean.  It's perfection, really.  Gluttonous, American perfection.
I washed them down with a beer at the Made In America festival this past weekend, where I luckily caught them without a line!

I'd say they're worth getting at least once.  They are pricey, so I'll probably only get them when I REALLY yearn for them (and why was I charged a $1 for the sauce? -.- )

PS:  Sauce is tasty, but I actually enjoy these plain....something I wouldn't do for the average mozzarella stick.

Delish! Ordered Soho Tempura and Aspara Maki and three rolls (1 specialty roll and 2 regular rolls: green menace, spicy crunchy tuna, love roll). Got the happy hour deal on drinks. This place sets the bar for good sushi.

I go here often ever since it opened up on this side of town.

I love asian food, and I love how Saigon makes asian food. I started my lunch with fried dumplings. They seemed fresh and the sauce they were served with added to the experience. I followed the fried dumplings with combo rice and pho special. Combo rice is fried rice with chicken, shrimp, and chunks of some kind of sausage. Delicious. Pho special is one of my favorite Vietnamese foods and I order it pretty regularly so my expectations are pretty high. Saigon did not disappoint.

The food is good, and the prices are competitive. The only weird thing about Saigon is that it is closed on Tuesday.

As far as custard goes, the concrete here is soooooo good. The malts are also delicious. The burgers are great but the fries steal the show. I love shoe string fries and the seasoning they have is an added bonus.

My favorite planet fitness that's worth the extra 20 mins of driving. It's right outside of NE Philadelphia. This location is filled of friendly staff. It's very clean and you don't have people who hog machines at this location. I go in, get my workout done and leave. They have a lot of machines to choose from, and I especially love the circuit machines. You can work out for 39-45 mins and work out your entire body! This location beats any of the locations in Philadelphia.
Love the fact that I pay only 20 dollars a month and I get to bring a guest with me every time to the gym. I also save on drinks and can buy them for half off compared to the other members who pay 10 dollars a month. I also can utilize the tanning beds and massage chairs as much as I want to. Overall I'm glad I joined planet fitness and I am happy with my results and weight loss since joining.

Im a sucker for the small town America feel. I like locally owned and operated establishments and don't mind paying a bit extra even. And that is why I LOVE this dry cleaner. 

They have been around since I was a kid. I remember my mom picking up her clothes here and it was the same family. Now I live in the valley too and also take my clothes in. 

The owner always recognizes me. She remembers things such as recent vacations and makes it a point to ask. Not only that, but she even recognizes my roommate after just a few visits and remembers to send each others' clothes home with the other! 

They do have a policy that it's cash only for anything under $10. The one time I dropped off one pair of pants and didn't have cash, she just added it to the next bill. I don't know anywhere else where you can get these levels of service. My day is always a little brighter when I visit! Who can say that about their own dry cleaner?

I've now been twice here to dinner and can say that Earnest is a stylish restaurant to celebrate an occasion or have a nicer meal or maybe just have drinks and an appetizer at their bar in the back of the restaurant. I love the space more than anything because it just has a great ambiance. Service has always been good and I have had good dining experiences. The first dinner I had was fabulous. It was a vegan chickpea curry and the flavors were spot on, paired with a Brussels sprouts dish that was delicious. Since they will rotate their menu items a bit I didn't see the curry on the menu the next time I returned. Second time we got a smoked tuna dip as an appetizer which we both enjoyed. For our entrees my boyfriend got the Korean fried chicken and I got the grilled halibut. He said the chicken was pretty good although he loves spicy so he wanted more of a kick. I thought my entree was tasty paired with the green chimmichuri sauce on top but I wasn't sold on the tomato farro that was underneath the fish. The dishes were all visually appealing but the second visit didn't wow as much. Overall I think this is a nice place and I'd love to come back for a cocktail sometime as well. Highlights for me are service and ambiance.

I am a loyal customer of a coffee shop near Three Brothers Coffee and I was convinced that I needn't go anywhere else. However, TBC  makes me want to be a new regular patron! I saw all the awesome reviews and I thought (somewhat guiltily) that I should try it out. The bottom line is that the ambiance, food/drinks and staff are all on point here. If feel obliged to give your business to the same regular place I urge you to try something new here!  

Three Brothers Coffee have the same owners as the next door Cumberland Transit, specializing in outdoor apparel/gear. I like supporting places that fuel my love of the outdoors so TBC melds well with that. Looking around the cafe, it is nicely decorated and has a hip/modern vibe with the artwork that is displayed. 

I ordered a Golden Axe ($5.25) which is one of their seasonal drinks. I asked the barista if it was better hot or cold and she said she liked it both ways so I got it hot. The Golden Axe is a Vietnamese inspired iced americano, brewed with a coconut-ginger syrup and topped with a coconut sweet cream. It is only slightly sweet but has an usual depth of flavors. Really unique and great drink! 

They have a case with freshly baked goods and when I saw they had goodies from Dozen Bakery I knew I had to get something. I am more of a savory breakfast eater so I got the ham and cheese croissant ($4.50). This was a big croissant and I tried to eat it as slowly as possible to enjoy it but it still disappeared. 

A couple of minor weaker areas of this cafe. Prices were too high for my liking. I didn't like spending $9.75 on breakfast when I felt like it was a dollar more expensive for each item than it should be. Parking can be tough if the rear lot is full. There are a few metered spots outside the front as well. 

Overall, a quality cafe with many boasting rights. I can imagine this being a treat once in a while for me as I did enjoy it.

I love the interior design of this place, especially their painted artwork and neon lights. DOSC is definitely a trendy place for a good photo op. 

Note: DOSC does not have syrups for fancy lattes like London Fogs, I'm not sure if it was for that day or always? 

Millet Porridge with Mango and Fresh Berries: this was delicious and it tasted like a guilt free dessert.

Fries: these wedges tasted like breakfast hash browns or almost like the Tim Hortons wedges but cooked better. I wish the portion is this was a little bit bigger though.

Steak and Eggs: it was ok, I forgot to take a photo

Tostada was tasty because I love that hint of citrus taste

Poached Egg and Salad: this egg was magically poached because when i poked into it, it disappeared into the sauce. The combination of the bread soaking into the egg sauce was pretty good; I highly suggest letting it soak before eating. I thought there was more to it tho :( with more than one lettuce leaf lol 

I feel like the portions are smaller and there are not a lot of carbs as good fillers. Since they are new, I think there I room for improvement. I'm interest to try and see how the other items on the menu tastes like. I heard the dinner is great.

I love this place and I love this location because the staff is always really friendly. I really enjoy all the different hot sauces they have at the counter to try. Just be careful because some of those sauces are extremely hot. I order a lot an Uber eats for pick up and it seems like the food is always ready before Uber tells me. I also like the location on Tampa Road in Oldsmar but the atmosphere in the Westchase one feels better.  I was gonna take a picture of my burrito dish but unfortunately I ate it all.

Ok, so the location leaves much to be desired. However, don't let that deter you from checking out this spot that busts out some seriously amazing food! We have been there 4 times in a very short period of time because lemme tell ya, we're hooked!

If I had to die or pick one thing on their menu to call my favorite, I would be a goner. I will say, though, that their tortilla chips are unmatched in freshness, texture, and deliciousness. Unmatched! Because of that, I can't help but continue ordering the Xtreme Nachos. Now, I've had their basic chorizo, chicken, pork, and steak tacos with just cilantro and lime so I could sample the meats and decide on the champ amongst them. All were exceptionally delicious. However. The steak edges over the others, and for that reason, I can tell you in earnest that the steak Xtreme Nachos are a must try!  I cannot stop ordering them and it's quickly developing into a problem for me :)

The place is gaining popularity, no doubt because their flavor combinations are just really on point. With that comes my only observation for potential improvement. The space is obviously very small, and because of that, I recommend calling ahead to pick up your food rather than trying to eat it there. Fine, no problem. Everyone loves a fantastic hole in the wall even if just for take out. But the last time we went to pick up, it was hella busy. It took forever to get through on the phone to place my order, the food took a long time to be ready, and when we got there, there was no place to park. Still, issues we as consumers can figure out how to deal with. However, and here's the crux, the execution that night wasn't the same as other nights. I could tell that the food was prepared and plated in a hurry and the proportions were not as balanced as in previous visits. 

Xtreme Tacos is my current favorite spot for Tex-Mex, and no doubt the same is true for others. My sincere hope is that they are able to keep up with their growing popularity and maintain consistency in their portions, presentation, and flavors so everyone can continue to focus on just how fantastic this little taco spot is! Because it IS truly fantastic and they do some great work in that kitchen! Keep it up, Xtreme Tacos. We love what you're doing in there!

We had a wonderful dinner here with exceptional service. We came on a Monday night when they have half off bottles of wine which is an awesome deal! They also have happy hour from 4-7 in the bar area so upon walking in at 6:30 we found the bar quite packed. The dining room has paintings of various breeds of dogs on the walls and nice comfy chairs. For food we started with the oysters and mussels - I would highly recommend both! The mussels were in a delicious white wine broth and among the best I've had! For entrees we had the Harvest Salad with shrimp and the trout entree. The portions are sizable and food is all organic and uses foods that are in season. Not sure why the negative reviews except seems they are mostly for happy hour. For a nice dinner out this is a wonderful spot with a comfortable dining room, unique and diverse menu, and friendly service fitting of a special occasion! We also loved that the crowd was a mix of people meeting friends, families, and couples on date night.

I come here for the chicken. 
It's tasty and it's cheap. 
I sometimes get the mojo pork 
I love the rice and black beans. 
 
I've never been inside 
So I can't comment on the decor. 
But the cheap and tasty chicken
Is what I come back for.

I love this store!!!! If you are in need of unique ingredients, cultural gifts/furnishings, or maybe a bottle of wine or two...this is your place. They often run sales and have special emails that will give you additional discounts on everyday products. I always seem to find way more than I'm actually shopping for at this location. I stop in every chance I get!

Meh.
You get what you pay for and they do go crazy with the Kewpie Mayo here - so either avoid rolls with mayo or ask for sauces on the side.

I had seen the place (walked by) and read the other yelp reviews - but for $8 (2 maki - you can get 3 for $12) I figured I'd give it a shot.

Service was icy-cold at first (one lady was kinda mean - she was prepping a table for a large party that was not there yet and clearly did not want to stop to help another table) but then my "real" server showed up and was very sweet. Vibe is kinda icy too - with colored LEDlights that change color and rock-hard banquettes that are straight up & down and not that comfortable to sit at.  Water was brought instantly (YAY!) and green tea (which I had to ask for) was free.

I ordered a yellowtail scallion roll (had decent yellowtail but hardly any scallion in it) and a roll with salmon and grilled onions (loaded with mayo blobs on top which I scraped off - seriously, at least 3-4 tsp. of mayo.  Eew).  It was also supposed to have masago but there was NOE in there - and when I asked the (sweet) girl about it she said they don;t include masago on the lunch special.

These people are certainly cost consious - as the lettuce & dressing salad indicated (no tomato, no nothin').

I am in absolutely NO HURRY to come back here - yet - oddly enough - I ran into a friend here with another aquaintance and the LOVE it here.

Meh. Meh. Meeeeeeh.

Sorry.

Doma and Vics cost more - but are sooooo much better.

Nope.
My first time trying a cream horn. It was pretty tasty and light. The caramel bacon longjohn was amazing! These donuts are made with love.

Cool place with quirky decor and romantic ambiance! Service was friendly, informative, and quick. This is similar to a tapas restaurants - lots of small plates, which I love because you can try a bunch of different things! Everything we had was delicious, but the highlights were definitely the whipped feta and the fire roasted carrots - simply amazing! One of my favorite things (weirdly enough) was that they brought your bill in an old library book - I loved flipping through and reading people's notes!

I am rating the Hutton Hotel based off of my experiences with them from an event planning perspective.

Sometimes, I wonder if it is normal to spend as much time at a hotel that is based out of your own city because I am ALWAYS at the Hutton. I was just involved in a fundraiser event there last weekend, will be there all this week to host some out-of-town co-workers, and am also co-producing another large-scale event there on Thursday evening. Maybe I should just forgo my home in East Nashville and just live in a suite on the 10th floor?
How very Chateau Marmont of me.
