The premier place for expecting Moms and post pregnancy support!  I went here for their 2 year anniversary day where they had booths, a potluck, and open house.  The gift shop area was full of cloth diapers, innovative baby toys, breastfeeding support items and other local baby goodies.  The center offers support classes ranging from new parenting classes, babywearing, and grief support for miscarriages.  The staff is friendly and helpful and approachable.  My daughter loved the play room and it was nice to see some other Moms in the area.

I brought my residents here for lunch and they loved it , the reason why I brought them here was because they said they never heard of this place before so I load everyone on the bus and off we went to Flap Jack's when we arrived the waiters came outside to help push my residents inside and push everyone to the table that there was a plus for me everything on the menu look every tastey all my residents order from the lunch menu everyone spent about $8 dollars the food came out in a timely manner which everyone enjoyed it turned out to be a really great trip.

I FINALLY got to try this place, after hearing a ton of great stuff, my expectations were pretty darn high.  Guess what?  They totally met them.
First of all, it's totally family run and that gives me the feels.  There's a great vibe to the place.  This is somewhere you want to grab a meal and catch up with your people.
Secondly - the menu is fantastic.  Coconut Cilantro Rice?! I HAD to get the tortilla bowl when I saw coconut cilantro rice, I love all of those things.  But the menu had beef or chicken..well that wasn't going to work.  So I asked if I could sub shrimp, and you know what? They did it! They did it and it was AMAZING.  It was also as big as my head and fed me for multiple meals.  Sabrina (who came out and checked on me!) does an amazing job layering the flavors.  You can taste everything in its own right and it all blended wonderfully.  
The customer service is phenomenal, the food is wonderful, the prices are more than reasonable for the portion.  There is zero reason not to check this place out! 
I'm hoping to get the pleasure of trying the Belizian Lime Tart on my next trip.

My wife and I love this place!  I ordered my favorites Chili Cheese Etoufee and Drunken Chicken.  My wife ordered the Chili Cheese Etoufee and the Spinach & Mushroom Etoufee.  Per usual the food was great, the sauces in the dishes are very good and they lay it over a bed of white rice.  The best part though is the bread!  If you are hungry, get extra bread it is amazing!  Next time I go back I will have to take some pictures, but you will leave satisfied!

Here's the thing about District - you go for designer donuts. I can easily say that their glazed donut is probably one of the most disappointing donuts in New Orleans (which is coming from a girl who has been to 9 donut shops in one morning to taste test every single glazed donut at each). So you aren't going for a Classic - you're going for the fancy-pants, bigger than your face donuts that they roll out each day. And they're good! Especially when you get a flavor that's right up your alley (for me that's the Vietnamese Iced Coffee, YUM).

But what I really love about District is not their donuts - it's their coffee and other food items. Their coffee rocks my world. I get a hot Americano, and you can just immediately tell that it's quality coffee. I appreciate that so much. I've had their iced coffee before too which is great! I've been really wanting to try their Vietnamese Iced Coffee, so hopefully that'll happen soon.

And then you have their sliders, breakfast options, cinnamon rolls, and more. All of it is great. The cheese and egg biscuit is to die for - melty pockets of cheddar cheese, perfectly salty egg, and a soft but crunchy-on-the-outside biscuit. Swoon.

Top all of this off with the fact that the employees there are always so kind. They engage you and are excited for you to be there.

A nostalgia-laced icon,  this branch of Ted Drewes is my favorite. It's located on Route 66 in a very pretty neighborhood and part of the experience is enjoying the ambiance as you stand outside waiting to order.

This is the first place I ever had frozen custard, that luscious concoction that is richer than ice cream and usually prepared soft serve style to lend itself to all sorts of invention.   The richness is due to high butterfat and egg content and minimal air.

Important term:  "concrete" - the frozen custard equivalent of a Dairy Queen Blizzard, you pick your mix-ins and they blend it up into decadent goodness.

One of my favorite items at Ted Drewes is the Christie, which is actually a sundae:  a brownie, frozen custard, hot fudge, and caramel ($5).  Great diet food!

Highly recommended to any frozen confection lover visiting St. Louis!!

The service was excellent and so was the food. I loved the laid back atmosphere and the salad options. The salad was fresh and plenty (and I'm a professional salad eater). I can't see how anyone could go wrong choosing this place.

My friends went there on Saturday night May 22nd since we were waiting to have dinner at Neyow's Creole Cafe next door. They were busy, wasn't too many people inside, we only wanted drinks we waited at the bar for about 10-15mins. The person that took my drink order was Terry. Terry, was Server as well as a bartender too. I had the rum punch, it was already made, not strong, and my friends had a different sweet punch drink. Terry, was so funny, warm gave me two shots, loved his New Orleans accent, and whenever I come back I must go back to try the food, and hopefully fun Terry will still be there.

My first visit, the restaurant is located off Main Street, good location, you'll have to park in the parking garage behind the building it's always hard to find parking on Main. The decor was very nice,  open concept with a bar and great patio section. My best friend arrived before I did and she stated it took a while to be waited on, but we will cough that up to the fact that they looked a little short on staff and every establishment is experiencing the same thing due to the pandemic. Once we did get a server it was pretty nice from there on. The restaurant offered a really great happy hour menu, I ordered the bourbon brown sugar wings, the wingettes were nicely sized and perfectly cooked, a lovely wedge salad with a very tasty lemon drop. My bestie enjoyed their whiskey and wine flights a salad and some really good fries. I definitely will be back and highly recommend this place, of course their busiest day is on a Friday since that is the day I went but I'm going to return earlier in the week. Good vibes, good food and staff, great music, nice patrons.
I loved it. The staff, the cooks, the environment was all cool. The creme brulee French toast was excellent. I think I had a simple burger and fries, and just enjoyed the experience.
High walls and creative setting on the routes. They have plenty of bouldering space as well as a variety of terrain for roped climbing. What's not to love?

I LOVE THIS PLACE!

All staff are very helpful and friendly. This quaint supermarket provides all of the necessities and then some. Most notable are the free drink and foos samples available around the clock. Also, the excellently priced ground beef (80/20), the seasonal Kringle pastry, and the awesome selection of produce.

This is hands down my favorite market.

My best friend raved about the eggs benedict at Green Eggs cafe so when I came to visit her in Philly I knew I was in for a great meal.

I came on a Saturday afternoon around 1pm and there was no wait, I knew what I wanted to order based on my friend's recommendation: chicken and waffles benedict. I ordered them and about 15 minutes later, the party in my tummy was ON. Pictures are up, and they actually do give the plate justice. They were served with home fries and although I love me some potatoes, I hardly touched them because I was so into the benedict.

The eggs were cooked perfectly and melted all over the chicken which had a good crunch and was very tasty. The waffles were warm and gave the entire table an aroma that had them gazing at my plate, and though I offered to share I was secretly hoping no one would take me up on the offer. I left extremely happy and full and ready to walk the entire meal off or I'd have to pop the button of my pants off. I highly recommend this place for brunch, but do be mindful that it is cash only!

Such a fan of this place!!! I'm not a big chocolate fan, however I love Godiva Chocolatier!!! I'm picking up Valentines treats for the kiddos and mom. This place is great for stocking stuffers and any holiday during the year. It comes with a hefty price tag. It sure does make people smile. Staff is friendly.

We love this park! Discovered it when I met a moms group here and there is so much to it. They have areas where you can plan soccer or basketball or so many other sports. 

There are roads where you can basically go for a walk and circle the entire park. There's a section where there are benches and it's covered so there is plenty of shade and restrooms! It gets REALLY windy though so be warned.  The kids playground has a variety of things to play with for the younger and older kids. The downfall is that it is not covered.  The bigger issue I have are the large ant piles (most likely fire ants) which I am deathly allergic to. What if one of the kids walk through it by accident? One of my bigger fears.....

As with St. Elmo's, I was very impressed with Harry and Izzy's. The shrimp cocktail is everything you'd expect at St. Elmo's and quite delicious (if sinus clearing ;) ). We also tried to rare ahi tuna appetizer, and it did not disappoint. The sesame crust was absolutely yummy. 

The wine list was quite extensive and we started with Stag's Leap "Hands of Time", a very bold Cab. The only downside was that they only had 1 bottle of it on hand. We instead ordered a Sangiovese from Midnight Cellars, and that was satisfying as well. 

I tried an 8oz. filet, rare, Oscar style, and it was very good. I could not stop eating it. 

I capped the night off with a "turtlelized" cheesecake with Maker's Mark caramel, pecans, and chocolate sauce. It was positively divine!

Service was good for our table of 15 and everyone left happy. I would love to come here again!

Our household has ordered from here twice now. The first time my wife ordered while I wasn't home and said she absolutely loved it and would like to get it again when I'm around. 
Just last night we had my little sister over who is Vegan and we planned to order from here just for that reason!
So we did sweet and spicy wings, Bah mi hoagie,  flatbread veggie trio, potato wedges, Kimchi tacos. My Bah Mi came with potato wedges so the extra order was too much. I ended up sending my sister home with the extras. I always order too much. 
The food here is excellent though. Very impressive. 
I'm already planning my order for the next time we get together. I want to try the meat ball. It was a real toss up between that and the bah mi this time.

I want to like this place more, I do, but I've had a few experiences here that are less than perfect. 

The first visit, I was full of giddy. Ready to try this new fad of nitrogen ice cream. When I ordered, first thing I noticed was the artificial flavoring pumps. Ok I get it, you can't have a ton of flavors from scratch if customers don't order it. Fine, totally understandable. But my issue wasn't with the flavor on this visit. On my first visit, they were so busy that they had to douse my cream in liquid nitro not once, but twice! The person stationed at the stirring area was helping the cashier, and thus my ice cream began melting, so by the time he saw it, he has to freeze it again. I didn't think anything of it until I tried it. The result was a lack luster artificial flavor with ice crystals worse than ice cream from your local freezer aisle. Ick. I'm not made at the stirring guy for helping his coworker, just disappointed that they didn't realize the texture was off and still willing to charge so much for it.

But nope, that didn't stop me. I went another few times, and while they never had to refreeze my ice cream again, I just couldn't get over how sickeningly sweet the flavors were. None of the ice creams had that yummy, small batch, oval ice cream shop feel to it that I love. Honestly, I'd rather to go Handel's or Brics any day of the week. 

If you love sweet ice creams or just want to try nitrogen ice cream, give it a shot! They're not bad, just not great.

I really love Sakura. Especially love their all you can eat lunch. You can't beat it for the price. All of the apps are good, great selection of sushi rolls and even lots of options for people who don't like sushi. I recommend trying the chicken katsu and the spicy beach roll. This is definitely a great option in the area for sushi.

This place was a really nice surprise.  I was expecting what you might think from food, mall adjacent - but this place is the real deal..... including the long wait.

     Just to add a little context, I have been living in Los Angeles during this whole "Burger Renaissance" (ie; super incredible gormet burgers everywhere for $15 and some of them are astonishing and some of them are horrible) not only that I have been a burger lover for a very long time.
    I had the Cowboy burger and it was really good.  Big but not novelty size, lots of flavor but not gimmicky, good fries and good service.

   As long as you can stand the crowds this place is a winner!  4 and a half stars.

YUM!!!!! We came here for my birthday with a group of friends. I LOVE Spanish tapas and this place was fantastic!!!

We were a group of 5 and got (1) cured meats mixto, (2) cheese mixto, (3) tortilla espanola - very good and traditional, (4) garlic shrimp - just ok, like typical shrimp scampi, but others in the group liked them, (5) Spanish Octopus - I would have gotten 4 orders if I could have, it was AMAZING!!!! (6) lamb meatballs - very good, (7) Revuelto - surprisingly delicious, would highly recommend, (8) lamb chops a la plancha - DELICIOUS!!!

that was plenty of food! the drinks were fun and the atmosphere was lively. I will definitely be back!

Blondie's wins the award for the coziest new place to eat. Seriously, you walk in and it is so inviting, so cozy and comfy! LOVE it. Great booths, chairs, and a super cute area around a fireplace. I would love to curl up with a book, some drinks and some eats in front of it and just hang out. 

Of course my friends, the Gs, are the new foodie place ambassadors, and I got to go with them for lunch today. Service was great. Water was kept filled, we got new drinks when we needed them, and the food came out fast. We sat around finishing drinks and talking at the end and weren't rushed. We got to meet the owner, Kathleen, who made a point to come to talk to us and discuss the menu and more. I always appreciate it when the owner or manager makes an effort to talk to me. It makes a personal connection and shows they care. A big difference! That alone was really impressive. It was nice that she wanted our opinions on menu items.

I loved my drinks - a boozy mocha and a non-boozy chai latte. Yum! 

For food, I got the cheese a saurus, basically a grilled cheese with pesto. It came with chips or fruit. I was disappointed it didn't come on a popover so they brought me one anyway (and didn't even charge me for it!). The sandwich had great flavors, but the bread wasn't toasted (like it was put in an over instead of a toaster). I would've liked that better. The herb popover was yummy! I also got to try the hummus that Tim ordered. It was REALLY good. Lots of feta and a nice tang. I would order this without a doubt next time. With popovers. And just eat that.

There are several vegetarian options between small plates, salads, breakfast items, and sandwiches. They also have veggie soups that aren't on the menu that change, which I'm excited to go back and try.

I really loved everything about it here and will be looking for an excuse to come back ASAP (ahem, Megan A!).

A new favorite! This place easily skyrocketed into my top places to eat in Indy. Everything from decor, service, drinks, and most importantly the food was a pleasure. The salmon and polenta made me feel like i was eating love and warmth, which was a blessing from the cold weather and whatever stress one may be experiencing. Too poetic perhaps but that's the best way i can describe it. Portions were great where i definitely did not leave hungry with the devour menu. Ricky Martinez was the chef and I'm keeping my eye on him. 

They do have a private parking lot with additional parking in the back. They were able to accommodate a party of 10'ish that was celebrating a birthday. Experience is casual dining but i feel like it's a bit more upscale casual. I can't wait to come back!

This store is one of my favorites in the area. I love the layout of the place where you know exactly where to go for your items. They also have a great movie section for kids, blue Ray, and low priced tv seiries. I'll be back to shop for my little one's clothing for the fall. Good store I must say.

My friends and I stopped in here because they wanted absinthe. This place had a nice little crowd but there were tables opened and we managed to nab one. There were two options for absinthe, $12 or $30 and went with the cheaper shot. Three of those and one Turbo Dog ran us up to $40, so we only stuck around for that one drink, but it was worth it. 

We wandered to the patio, which was deserted because of the wind but I could tell it would be a great place to hang out. I love patios/outdoor spots of any kind and this one had this eerie red lighting that was eerily inviting from the inside. 

Service was excellent, too.

Yummyyyyy! 

For the first time ever I had to wait in line and had a chance to actually look at the menu. I've been fortunate that I usually get to order immediately and, because my eyes are bigger than my stomach, I get the first thing that looks amazing, which is everything here! 

I found out that I don't have to get a massive scoop, I can order a kids scoop which is probably a more appropriate serving for an adult. I also learned they serve "nachos" which are waffle cone pieces surrounding a massive scoop of ice cream topped with hot fudge. One of these days I'm going to order the farmhouse - 8 scoops and unlimited toppings!

I recommend the honeycomb, cookies and cream, and I recently tried rough seas (candied nuts with honey swirl and pretzel). I think some flavors are only available for a limited time because I didn't see my beloved cowboy cookie. 

The only thing I can (barely) complain about is that their handmade waffle cones are thin and fragile. They're delicious and sugary but the tips are not tightened so ice cream always inevitably drips out. I recommend the cone by all means, but ask for a bowl to hold it!

Finally I can eat something besides falafel, gyros, or cajun food at the Farmers Market!

I go to FM a lot for lunch because the other options in Metro Center are fast food.  Thus, you get options and, if you have a group, everyone is pleased.  So when I heard that Arnold Myint was going to open up a spot I was excited.  Real food, likely healthy, likely fresh, likely the tastiest thing in the place - what's not to love. 

So I showed up with some coworkers who weren't as adventurous as me and went to another place.  That's the great thing about FM!  Anyway, I perused the sides and decided I really wanted some curried quinoa.  The sides come in little small containers although I think you can order larger (like think large enough to take some home for the family).  I picked out a turkey sandwich and also got a bag of the homemade chips.  Verdict: loved the quinoa, wish I had gotten more.  Sandwich - ok, better than Subway of course, but still it was, in the end, just a turkey sandwich.  Will bust out with a different choice next time!  Chips were yummmy.  I also liked the iPad checkout station where you just sign your name right on the screen - a little oasis of class in the craziness of the Farmers Market.  I also got to see Arnold Myint himself which was cool because I totally rooted for him when he was on Top Chef!

Definitely give this place a try next time you are at FM having lunch.  You will leave pleasantly filled with healthy food and will be the only one not in a food coma at work later that afternoon!

Celebrated an anniversary at one of their outdoor greenhouses and loved the experience! Easy to get a reservation on Tock (just book in advance if you want 6-8pm time slots as they go first). The greenhouses have small heaters and plants, but you'll need to wear a jacket to stay warm - and maybe a small blanket for your legs too. The food and drinks were excellent- definitely get the king of kings hummus, chicken shawarma, chicken Sinnia and lamb meatballs. The service is top notch, they gave us Prosecco and baklava on the house to celebrate the special occasion. Will definitely be back!

If this is your favorite spot, please bend your ears for a moment, or more let's say, skip this review :D

We'd settled on Thai for lunch. We called in our order, and were told it would take up to 20 minutes for our lunches to be ready for pick up. My friend Colleen, opted for healthy Fresh Thai Shrimp Spring Rolls for a waistline friendly starter. I'm in love with any thing ginger, so I got the Ginger Chicken. Colleen and I shared both. Also, we got Supreme Mango with Sweet Sticky Rice & Coconut Cream, one for each of us.

Upon my arrival, I was standing at the host desk for a good five minutes, no one came to help me. Then, the first person I saw, failed to greet me, and when I went to the desk to let the host know I was there to pick up my order, he totally did brushed me off, and was unpleasant!!!!  Have you just looked at someone and automatically felt annoyed? I did, and all what I'm saying is that host/hostess have to mind their p's and q's. 

My lunch came out after SIXTY minutes and I went "Ba Dum Tss!" 
Besides the bad customers service, the food was just okeyish. The fresh spring rolls were too healthy and tasteless, like fresh grass. Totally off-putting!
The Ginger Chicken I ordered, was described in the menu as ( Sautéed with cashews nut, onion, scallion, bell pepper, carrot in chili paste and light garlic sauce.)
The ginger had an overwhelming kick to it, and there was no sign of any spicy chili paste! Also, absolutely NO cashews in there, or scallion. There was no flavor, and no tongue's satisfaction in that dish whatsoever! 

How can anyone mess up a very simple dessert like sticky rice?!! My order of Supreme Mango with Sweet Sticky Rice & Coconut Cream  was a failure. The rice was incredibly sticky, stiff and hard to chew. Enough said!

Obviously I will not be returning, not only because of the below average food, but also because of the poor service and unpleasant staff.

Two Yelps!

You would think from the size of the place it would be good for groups, but in my experience with 9 people on Saturday at 11am it was about a very hungry, tiring wait to get a seat. 

We tried to make reservations, but they do not take them. And I think we were too small to be put in the side meeting room. So hangry we stood, hoping for just the right table to leave.

The manager was nice enough to offer to fill cups of coffee for us while we waited. But I thought it was odd that they just didn't refill the pot for everyone who was waiting. 

Now for the food...They have these 1/2 and 1/2 combos. Which I love! I got a turkey Reuben and salad. I asked for lots of sauerkraut, and they charged $0.50 for it.. Which is no biggie but I'd expect a lot of kraut. Sadly there was not a lot of it.. But it was still a delicious sandwhich.  :) My friend got the sunrise chile rellenos. If I come back with a smaller party, that is what I would get.

I'm not sure what the big attraction is with this place. If you like it LOUD and Lively, then this is the place for you. We walked in and found two seats at the bar, like winning the lottery. I was looking forward to trying this place because friends say they like it. We started with the fish spread. Sorry I just was not impressed. Very typical. The music was so loud that there is no chance of having a conversation with whoever you are with. My boyfriend on the other hand said he did like it and made him feel like he was on an island somewhere. We split the blackened grouper sandwich. It was a nice thick piece and I must say it was very fresh.  I guess this place was just not my cup of tea but I'm sure the tourists love it.  I did feel like it was overpriced for what you were getting and they seemed under staffed.

Bowls or Rolls

Love the variety of toppings. My go to is the masago ( I usually get double), avocado, mushrooms and cilantro. My favorite sauce to have is avocado lime. For the protein I typically get the krab. If you get a big bowl you can get 2 bases. I like the noodles and the brown rice. 

If you are hungry I recommend a side of the miso soup. 

Secret menu. Get the rose in a can and a cup of dole whip and mix it together.

I love me a good beignet, and what better way to enjoy a weekend than munching on some delicious, warm beignets at a park, with jazz music on a beautiful day. 

I'm so glad I was also introduced to this location as this had less of a line than the one at the French Market. It was also an added bonus that it was inside a beautiful park. 

The line on a Saturday morning wasn't awful. We waited about 10 minutes to place our order and was served almost immediately. It's a little bit challenging to find tables here, but you can definitely choose to enjoy the beignet on a park bench or on the grass if you'd like. 

The beignets are best when served warm and are worth it! They're the perfect treat for your weekend!

I love the Nancy Bru beer here.  That said, this place has the most unusual location of any Brewery in the city.  Kind of behind Home Depot in a semi-industrial area.  Walking in the front door is just like any other bookstore, but the fun is around the corner.  This is small batch brewing, smaller tanks and tighter space for the Brewers, but the bar area has plenty of seating for patrons.  Gaming is popular here and encouraged with a nice selection of games on hand.  
They brew a lot of beers here and have them available for growler fill and by the bottle.  They offer a nice food menu, but I usually just come for the beer.  Once I shared a sandwich and it was awesome, so I can only assume everything is first rate.  The staff is great here, they work well together and make it a pleasant experience.

After being recommended to this place by one of my friends, I finally decided to check this place out. We went on a Sunday afternoon after fishing and it was pretty busy. They have a good amount of outside and inside seating. I didn't get to take in the water views but it is located right along water. And being this is a seafood place I had to try the seafood lovers platter which includes shrimp, scallops and grouper which I had fried. The food was much better than I expected and I was not disappointed at all. I will definitely be coming back to enjoy the drinks and views and the pretty good food .

GF and DF Review:

Tonight was my first dining experience at Convivio in Carmel, IN.  This place was jumpin' on a Wednesday night! Got there at 6 pm and by 6:45 it was packed.

The restaurant is relatively new and tucked into a strip mall at about 115th St and Illinois.  With such prices, I did not expect babies and toddlers to be there, but they were.  So, if you want a high-end (cost and quality) dining experience (and don't mind a strip mall in Carmel, then this place is great.  

Okay, about the food.  I had the salmon and shrimp special (w/o the cream sauce) for $27.  My friend had the boar ravioli.  She love hers and I liked my dish quite a bit. 

We were not rushed to leave once we finished our meals.  Very nice! This is true dining.  If you are in a rush, you might want to find another place -- great food is not created in seconds!

Thank you for a lovely morning!  I was in NJ early and decided to stop in for a delicious diner breakfast.  I got a taylor ham, egg, and cheese and a short stack of blueberry pancakes (I simply couldn't decide between sweet or savory, plus leftovers are never a bad thing).  

The egg sandwich was fantastic.  I was nervous when they said they didn't have kaiser rolls so I went with a hamburger roll.  It was an excellent decision.  The roll was excellent - not just an average cheap hamburger roll.  They layered the cheese on the sandwich, which to me is a must for a true egg sandwich.  It was served with home fries, which were sauteed with large slices of peppers and onions.  I'm not the biggest breakfast potatoes fan, but these were great and I appreciated that they didn't clearly just scoop some food from a huge pile of pre-cooked home fries.

The pancakes were great and fluffy.  My one gripe was their use of smuckers pre-packaged syrup.  I realize that if they put syrup in a container, it probably wouldn't be real maple syrup, but I sort of wish I didn't know that they were giving me sub-par syrup.

The server was friendly and very attentive.  The coffee refills were constant, and the coffee was actually good (so many diners fail at coffee).  Bonus points for the server agreeing not to judge my decision to get two breakfasts.

All around, I loved this place and hope to go back soon.  Long live the Jersey diners!

The new Han Dynasty took over the spot where the old Mid-Atlantic restaurant (with the unchanging menu) was. I like the Han Dynasty here a lot more than the one in Olde City even if I give both 4*. Maybe I'm biased, because I love the service here. They've always been very nice, and came over to check in with me and just make some small conversation when they heard I had a peanut allergy (even though they had no peanuts in any of the dishes I ordered; I think it was Han's sister?). I've been to this Han Dynasty more times in a month than the number of times I've been to the other.

Note though, that the different branches have different specialties. I heard the dan dan mian in Olde City is the best, but the one in UC isn't so good (I wouldn't know since it has peanuts). Overall, I think it;s okay food wise, still not spicy enough as with the other branch. But I like the layout and atmosphere a lot more.

Next, if you go during lunch, you can ask for lunch portions, that are smaller than the dinner portions, and half the menu price! So it's a great lunch place too, alone, or in a group of 2 or 3.

Had a great brunch experience at Cooper Vine. This was my first time visiting and our waitress Lindsey was so sweet and helpful. I have to admit they have so many great appetizers choices it was hard to choose.

However, I ordered the CV signature margarita for my cocktail along with the LA Crawfish Beignets per Lindsey's recommendation, and they both were soooo delicious. I was a little skeptical about the beet mixed with the margarita but it was hands down one of the best margaritas I've ever had. So handcrafted. My cousin also ordered the Brussels Sprouts and Cajun Carrots and they were delicious and flavorful. I've never enjoyed having veggies as an app before. For my entree, I ordered the Jumbo Lump Crab Benny and they did not hold back on the jumbo lump crab meat there was more than enough for each bite. My cousin ordered the Gulf Fish Amandine and wow what an entree it was. I had the chance to taste a bite and let's just say I will be ordering it the next time. 

Overall, I loved the entire brunch experience. The atmosphere was perfect. We were able to sit outside amongst all the many plants in their beautiful courtyard and the bathroom was also picture worthy. Great experience, and I can't wait to go back!

Why 2 stars? Because our experience was pretty poor.

   ---   ---   ---

After researching all of the pet resorts in Tampa Bay pretty thoroughly, we felt really good about leaving our dog at Camp Bow Wow while we left town for Thanksgiving. My girlfriend used to drop her old dog off at the Brandon location, and she loved it. Plus, the Tampa location is super convenient on our way to the airport. 

I asked the guy who checked us in, how much time is spent in their kennel, vs how much is spent out playing. He said that they are up at 6am to eat, and 90 minutes after eating, they are out playing all day long until dinner time in the evening. Making sure that our pop receives plenty of exercise, and is not being locked away in a cage all day was very important to us, and the primary reason we went to a "pet resort" over an old fashioned kennel.

One of our other favorite things about Camp Bow Wow, was that they have webcams in all of the play areas, so that you can check in with how your pup is doing all throughout the time that he is there. Well, we certainly did check on him a lot, and it was pretty alarming what we found over the course of his 4 day stay.

We checked out the cameras about 15 times, at all different times of the day. 8a, 10a, 1p, 3p, etc etc. The dogs were out playing twice out of the 15 times we looked. 

So when we picked him up Monday morning, I asked about that, and this is the answer I was given:

"Yeah... we had some new people working and a lot of dogs here, so we got a little behind on the schedule."

"Behind on the schedule" is definitely an interesting way of saying that the dogs were out playing maybe about 10-20% of what we were told. I could understand if instead of them being out at 8am on Thanksgiving morning, things were pushed back an hour or two. Or maybe an incident where a clean up pushed things back 30 minutes. But to tell us our dog will be out playing for 8+ hours a day, and in reality, he might have been out playing for 8 hours combined over 4 days.... that's pretty unacceptable, and I don't think I'm in the minority saying that.

And to make things worse, he acquired kennel cough at Camp Bow Wow, which was also lovely. That was not an inexpensive trip to the vet.

So needless to say, we had two upcoming vacations that involved our pup heading back to Camp Bow Wow, but those were immediately cancelled, as soon as we found alternatives.

If you ever wanna dance, dance, dance while you're covered in sweat(yours and others'), this is the place to be. It can get ridiculously hot because 1. the dance floor is always packed, 2. the DJ usually spins tunes that are purely awesome, and 3. the loud music literally commands your body to move.

The crowd is fairly young or young-looking. Totally love all the cute hipster boys and girls. 

Oh, almost forgot. The upstair bar is open - not sure if it's just open for the summer but it's a chill place to hangz with friends even on a weekend night.

love the laid back vibe and the patio that faces the monon. they have several good things. i like the drunken ravioli, pub ploughmans platter, and beer crock cheese. my kiddos love their chicken finger meals and everything is reasonably priced. wait staff is always great.

Their regular drip coffee and cold brew have won my soul. Smooth from start to finish--I never knew one can be so happy while sipping on a cup of coffee. It's got a hippy vibe, everyone loves it. In fact, one of my good friends shot his engagement pics here. I love this establishment and I'm so glad that they're making more around Tampa. You can buy their ground coffee packs so you can make them at comforts of your home!

You have to go into Half & Half knowing that you are going to have to wait. The food is great & the restaurant is super cute, but you have to wait for it.  Definitely get in line on Yelp- it saves some wait time. 

For as long as my party waited, the service once we sat down was pretty quick! And the food was so, so good. We all loved our drinks- mimosas & bloodies. Two of us ordered their special eggs benedict- a turkey & bacon eggs benedict with avocado hollandaise- and we both absolutely loved it! My husband ordered an omelet and a friend had the chorizo hash, all great! 

I'm torn because we all loved our meals- they use great ingredients & cook everything so well. But waiting 90 minutes isn't my fave thing on a hungover Sunday morning. Would I come back? If a friend was dying to go & my day was wide open.

We were in town visiting family and stopped by for lunch with our toddlers. The atmosphere, staff and food were fantastic!! LOVE this place!!!

For starters our server, Loretta, was top notch! Honestly I eat out a lot and our experiences dining out in Florida haven't been great. But Loretta was so cheerful and friendly as well as really attentive throughout our meal to the end! Often we eat and then have to wait more than 20 minutes to get the check but she was quick and helpful. Plus her recommendations were also good. Her customer service was above and beyond most servers.

All the food was soooo delicious! We really loved the sauce in the mussels which tasted clean and fresh. The butter smash burger my husband got was delicious. My meatballs and pizza were perfectly seasoned and cooked.

Being on vacation this place provided a nice casual atmosphere with a great view, spacious outdoor seating, great food, funny sense of humor, and overall a great experience at this wonderful restaurant. Loretta really made our good experience great! You must check it out for a well-priced meal!!

I completely adore the vibe and interior of DOSC. 

Walking up the stairs and turning in, you're welcomed into the split space of cafe and dining. The light airy side of the cafe, molded from the exposed brick wall down to the velvet upholstered lounge chairs transitions amazingly to the dining sace. The dining area has more of a masculine feel, with dark leather couches playing with bold colored feature walls. The wooden beams with the additional eclectic brass piping features along the ceiling and the bar...Each detail comes together into  mismatched perfection, resulting in such a cool space. 

With my schedule playing i've only had time to make it down for their brunch. Basically got a chance to try everything- giving you guys a pretty good idea on what my take is on this space brunch wise. 

Now, service every single time i've been has been amazing. The servers are always so personable and friendly. They know their menu and aren't scared of  recommendations, which I'm super appreciative especially when trying new eateries. 

Food summary- As much as I love their space and detail to design. I really was expecting more from their dishes. With more misses than hits, presentation being the biggest aspect lacking for me. If not the the aesthetics and the vibe I dont think the I would have been back as much as I have been. 


Carbonated Fruit Cake - ($5) - The weirdest yet most impressive dish if id have to choose, the after taste is straight sizzly carbonation, baked into the pineapple sponge.Taste was okay, wouldn't order again though.

Millet Porridge with Mango Fresh Berries - ($6) - A play at oatmeal with some added fruits to make it boujee. This was surprisingly filling and made me feel super healthy ordering. - But honestly having oatmeal and rolled oats at home.. could you really justify spending 6 dollars on it? Eh. 

Buttermilk Stack Pancakes - ($7) -  The coconut cream is the biggest part of why I loved this dish so much I'd order this again for sure.

Prime Rib Hash - ($14) - The first dish I tried, and the best so far out of all my visits was this dish alone.The meat was super tender and the paired brandy brown sauce, YES. Scoop up a little bit of that mash and you've got yourself a perfect bite. 

Crispy Pulled Chicken - ($13) - So deceiving; I read crispy and automatically was drooling for something satisfying like fried chicken but what was brought out was something close to resembling bird food with a side of extra dry strings of chicken. Nothing else to say but, pass. 

Steak and Eggs - ($15) -  probably my second favorite dish out of the brunch items I've tried. They know how to cook their steaks -lemme give them props to that. Portion was surprisingly big as well. 

Country Sausage - ($3) - 2 Choices and we opted for the chicken cranberry sage combo, taste was unique and yummy. Came with 2 small pieces of sausage. 


DOSC also ended up being our NYE2019 place of choice and I got some cocktails to try.  The French 1914($13) and the Ryes and Shine ($13) -I'm a pretty big cocktail fanatic, especially when they look pretty and these...looked pretty. Taste was waaaaaaaaay too strong. Didn't end up finishing mine and ended up just getting chardonnay after. Food was just like brunch visits. With only one dish standing out and presentation lacking as a whole. 

Hopefully things improve as they keep updating their menu. Will still give them another shot because I'm absolutely smitten with the aesthetics.

We seem to have this trend in St Louis... all the places we go to have lines out the door. So, while we were waiting in line, we got to talking with locals about what they recommended we order. Resoundingly- everyone told us, "anything on the menu!" Yeah... that helped! 
But they were right. Husband ordered the muffuletta (no matter how hungry you are, go with the half order. The full size will literally feed 2.5 adults). I had a vegetarian sandwich with fresh mozzarella and olive salad (to die for); which was devoured quickly. 
We had a lovely chat with one of the employees who rang us up, and really enjoyed our meal. Another win in St Louis.

I love, love, loveeee their soon dubu. I don't get it anywhere else because it just doesn't compare!

If you aren't a big fan of spice, you can get your tofu non-spicy but if you're like me and can't live without the kick in your mouth, you can get your tofu very spicy (or something in between) and trust me, it burns...oh-so-good!

Each soon dubu arrives boiling and with a generous portion of rice. Before the tofu gets to your table, you're served with an array of side dishes which are quite delectable. 

The last time my friend & I ate here, we ordered a side of BBQ Squid along with our tofu. The squid was pretty massive & had to be cut with a pair of scissors the waiter provided- once we cut it into chunks, it was easily devoured!

The staff is always courteous and very friendly, the menu prices are superb and their food is absolutely delicious. I can't say enough good things about this place!

Honestly, I have only had Indian food in South Jersey and have yet to make it to Edison or anywhere with supposedly super authentic Indian food (India, for example ;) ...) so I may be going overboard here with 5 stars, but I will change it if need be in the future.

I've been to Palace of Asia twice, once for dinner and once for the lunch buffet. Needless to say, I had a better, more fulFILLING time at the buffet - $10 for all you can eat AND naan?! Come on.. you can't find that anymore. Maybe $7 for lunch at the Chinese buffet, but what is in that stuff, anyway? 

I tried almost everything there, and I wish I could remember all of the names. I tried paneer for the first time, and although it was a bit too spongey to be cheese for me, I really enjoyed the spices and broth that it was stewing in. Also had saag something or other with chickpeas in it. I love anything with chickpeas and spinach, so this was also very good. I tried the Lamb Rogan Josh - EXCELLENT! With a bit of rice, I ate all of this up! My favorite Indian food, though, is still chicken tikka masala, I feel like I am cheating when I say that, but my boyfriend is Indian and it is his favorite, too, so maybe I am not. At Palace of Asia it is a very thick sauce, but the chicken is cooked well, and when mixed with rice and eaten in the naan, it is delightful. Not too spicy either ;)

I tried the gulab jamun, not a fan. Definitely too sweet for me, and I have a hard time with fried food. Bad enough Indian food is made with so much oil! It's ok every now and then, perhaps I should try more vegetarian options next buffet.

I'd like to say it was an amazing massage but it wasn't. I was specific in what I wanted (not too hard but not a "fluff and buff." I definitely got the later,

It's a beautiful spa in a beautiful hotel. My daughters also got massages and loved theirs. I guess it's just a matter of what you want.

We dropped in at this location after walking by it. We love sushi so we decided to give them a try.

The ambiance makes you feel elegant and romantic. The lighting sets the mood. The noise level was perfect. The background music was set just right. Our conversations were perfectly heard. 

I had the pimp salad which had tuna cucumber and tomatoes in a ponzu sauce. I had a caterpillar roll. The Salas was so good I had 2 of them. Well my family helped me. 

My family had the rainbow roll and some other traditional rolls. 

I had a honeydew me martini. Actually I had 2 of them and they were fabulous. 

I'd love to stop by this location again. It's a great date night place.

I absolutely loved this brewery. 

Traveling: 
It's in such a fun and cool location of Nashville that I hadn't been to before. I like that it's slightly off the grid, but it's also not hard to navigate to from the interstate. It's the perfect pit stop.

The BEER:
The beer is fabulous! Their IPA is my favorite. 
You can build your own six (or four) pack and take as much as you need to go! This was perfect for traveling back up north, because I have a lot of beer drinking friends that wanted to try from this specific brewery. I didn't take the tour, but I'm sure it would have been great, as the staff was so friendly and attentive. 

The FOOD: 
Ah-mazing. I haven't tried everything on their menu, but based on the 3 plates that I sampled, I would confidently say that no matter what you get, it's going to be great. 

Overall, the atmosphere is fun, the beer is top notch, the food is great, the staff is friendly, the bathrooms are CLEAN...

the only thing that left me scratching my head walking out the door was.... why didn't they already have some sweet tea brewed? Ha! I expected to fill up on some good sweet tea in my last southern stop going back up north and was surprised when they pulled out the simple syrup to pour in the unsweet tea. Is it just me? Either way. WORTH IT.

Definitely stop by. You'll LOVE this place.

Love the fact that they make you fresh tortillas as you order.  Fresh tortillas are my weakness.  The queso is tasty and I love their marinated steak.  To me, this is my favorite fast casual Mexican restaurant - more than Qdoba.  I have never had to wait at this location.  In fact, many times my noisy kids and I are the only patrons in the place.  I hope it's because people are still discovering it, and not that they aren't making enough business to stay open.  I would be so sad if they closed.  If you haven't tried it, you definitely should!

I was happy to support a Blacked Owned business. 

Loved the creative names for the menu items. The coffee was perfect. A bit pricey but I guess it's expected since businesses have suffered during this pandemic. 

I had the Anne Shimojima and it was perfect. Not overly sweet or bitter, just rite. I also had the bacon, egg, with greens sandwich and it was good and filling. My co-worker ordered a muffin with butter and was charged $1.50 for butter which caught him off guard but he did say the muffin was fresh and good and loved the coffee. 

I will definitely be returning to try something different.

I've never had a poor experience at iron hill. They have a really great modern atmosphere and a really expansive menu. If you love yourself, you'll get the drunk monk burger. It's oozing with Brie. No seriously I have dreams about it. The staff are all friendly and the service is prompt. I love just going for a drink at the bar too - the bartenders are great. They actually talk to you if time permits which I personally appreciate. Their beer is delicious, they have a great range of IPAs, lagers, ales, etc. I highly recommend iron hill!! Christopher was a great server the last time I was in and one of the managers, Sonia, was also amazing!!

Edit: still love this place but I have to let everyone know that I highly recommend joining their king of the hill club. It's a $15 lifetime membership with a dollar per point system and you get a $20 for every $200 you spend. You get 150 points for signing up. You also get your beer served in larger mugs for the same price, 1/2 price growler fills on certain days, double points days, and access to all sorts of events!!! It's an amazing program!

This was my first time here and I loved it. Can't wait to come back next year! The food was awesome and the vendors were all so nice. All of the wines were amazing and the beers were even better. I don't really get the opportunity to taste so many local beers all together. Such great food, can't really point out anything specific. Just awesome!

Went on a busy Friday night and the line moved with ease. It was our first time but it was pretty easy to figure out what to do. I wish MD had casual dining pizza options like this!

Staff was extremely pleasant, prices were just right, and the options were unique and fresh.

I got the Kennett Square and the herb butter was super good. Boy got the Mexique and it was on point. It was a lot of food for the cost - love that it's BYOB, and their eclectic sodas were a refreshing surprise. I'd go here a lot if I lived in the area!

The best soon-dubu in the city!  This place is tucked away and once you walk in, it's like you've stepped into a Korean home.  Very welcoming, warm and inviting.

It's very vegetarian friendly!  The soft tofu is stewed and put into the dol sot pots which each and every stew feels like it's custom made for you. 

You can select from beef, seafood or mixed meats (seafood & beef), mushroom, and just plain.  They can adjust the spice as needed too.  I always get the extra hot with the hot temperature, can't beat it.  The rice also comes in a dol-sot which is great if you leave it in for a while, it burns the rice into a nice crispy shell.  DROOL.

Just thinking about this place makes my mouth salivate!  

If you're not into tofu, they also offer korean bbq meats (cooked in the back), with other soup/stew items.

Love this place!!!

Warning: this review is a bit of an ode to my love for properly made grits. I may go overboard. 

The location is great. It is in the heart of downtown near the convention center and near the Hertz office where we rented a car for the day. 

Our server was so nice and helpful. As I have mentioned in prior reviews, I have a myriad of food allergies, most of which are at issue in Louisiana cooking: peppers, chilis, potatoes, and tomatoes. As a result, I could not order any hollandaise options off the menu because it is made with hot sauce but she walked me through the menu to show me what I could eat. I got a breakfast combo with eggs, grits and bacon; my husband got the omelette. 

The eggs were OK but the grits.... these are not run of the mill grits that are instant. These are the grits that I had when I first fell in love with them in September 2001, also in Louisiana (Shreveport). Fluffy yet smooth with a slight hint of butter. So delicious I ate my husband's portion. Diet be damned!

Service was very quick and just delightful. My husband left his camera on the table and she chased after us to return it. 

We will go back again later this weekend. I don't care if I should experience more of New Orleans. And I am going to buy a T-shirt. And yes, I am fan girling all over this place.

I almost did not write a review for Vetri. It's the kind of experience that leaves you speechless. From the beginning to the end, every dish was divine and the service's attention to detail was stunning - Vetri represents the pinnacle of Italian cuisine.

We arrived a bit early for our 8:45pm reservation. The dining room was running a bit behind, but the maitre d' made all guests comfortable by promptly greeting people as they walked in, taking coats, and offering glasses of prosecco. Once we were seated, an enormous platter bearing four different types of hor d'oeuvres arrived, and we met our server, Diana, who explained each type to us with a clear passion for the food she described. All were delicious, especially the salumi.

After our first delectable bites, Diana returned to explain the menus and to discuss wine. As others have mentioned, Vetri's menu is full of choices; however, it is best enjoyed by perhaps choosing one or two items you must try, and leaving the rest to the discretion of the chef. I was impressed by how personalized each menu was - we did not all receive the same dishes for each course, which I loved because we got to trade bites! Also impressive: Diana did not take any notes at all during the menu selection and everything came out perfectly. When one member of our party agonized between the dover sole and the quail stuffed with foie gras, Diana and the chef went above and beyond by making sure that everyone at the table got to try both.

Every dish was excellent - our favorites of the evening were the sweet onion crepe with truffle sauce, the kale ricotta gnocchi and the ravioli stuffed with aromatic almond risotto, the dover sole accompanied by capers and a light tomato sauce, the wonderfully al dente mezze rigatoni with duck ragu, and the almost overwhelmingly decadent quail with foie gras. The desserts were excellent as well - I especially enjoyed the fluffy and creamy cannoli cake and the tangy lemon tart. At the end of the dinner, I was left in awe of how each dish was so spectacular individually, and yet the whole meal had a lovely flow and cohesiveness to it.

Diana was also extremely helpful when it came to the wine list - she was able to describe the particulars of each wine and really made every single one she talked about sound appealing. One member of our party opted to do the wine pairing while the rest of us shared a bottle. However, Diana felt that our choice would be too heavy for our first course, so she gave us a pour of a white wine that had been aged in stainless steel. I've never been to a restaurant before where the server, recognizing that the choice of wine might detract from a dish, opts to bring out a different wine for that course. The attention to detail was just incredible. Other standouts (as relayed to me by our wine pairing member) included a red wine aged in cement and another red wine that was a mix of "playful grapes" from central Italy. 

This review is now much too long, and yet I still feel like I have not conveyed how incredible this meal was. At $155/person (plus wine), Vetri is one of the more expensive dining options in Philadelphia, but they certainly make it special. To enjoy such an intimate, personalized menu of such high caliber, and to encounter probably one of the best servers in the city all in one dinner was truly a once-in-a-lifetime experience.

Wow.  Not sure if it's too soon to say, but Angela sure is somethin' else.  I think my search for my go-to psychic has ended.

I went in somewhat doubtful and unsure of the process (Can someone really just, have visions?  No other physical media iex: cards, shells, etc.??).  But, her method of intuiting metaphorical visions and then interpreting them to you is actually a refreshing change from the tarot card readers I've been used to--I found our session to be quite detailed and clear, thus leaving me much more satisfied.  She's honest, accurate, and blunt, but keeps with a relaxed energy that makes you very comfortable.  Honestly, I'd love to hang out with this woman--she's just down to earth and funny, like an old friend.

She was so on-point with wording my life situation that I cried (very unlike me).  You just don't realize how misunderstood or lost you've felt about something until someone perfectly crystallizes it.  
I'd say the reading was probably 85-90% accurate regarding the present/past, and I can update if her predictions do come to pass.  I was amazed at how she continuously filled in the details through her visions that I had forgotten to mention.  She will take the words out of your mouth.

A small example from my session was me asking why I hesitate and struggle to improve my skills, and Angela received a vision of a specific loved one (with accurate description) covering my throat chakra, thus interpreted as them quieting my voice and holding me back.  I realized she was right.

  I could then ask how to remedy the situation [if it wasn't immediately shown by the guides], or Angela would send a theoretical scenario and relay to you what the outcome would be.  She not only interprets your current situation, but offers guidance for moving forward.
  Other visions were more detailed, some more or less metaphorical, some literal future visions, but that's the basic jist of how the session moves.  It's very interesting.

You can ask her virtually anything: career, love, family, health....Hell, I even asked if I should get a pet dog with our extra time.

If you are hesitant due to her pricing, I'll tell you I was, too, prior to seeing her.  However, the hour experience was so helpful that I've deemed the money completely worth it.   You can also record the sessions, and I highly recommend you do for future reference.
(*She also offers 20% off for your first time!)

Unbelievable.   I'm grateful to have found her, and look forward to seeing her again in the future.

UPDATE: A couple of Angela's predictions have, indeed, come true.  Go see this woman.

Ahhh I long for spring evenings, long summer nights and beak fall evenings so I can have an excuse to enjoy Bacchanal! 

I can't even tell you the countless wonderful days and nights I've spent here with friends! On cold nights I've sat upstairs which has a bar and feels like a beautiful lodge with the tall ceilings!

And on those warm nights I've sat around the mismatched tables listening to live music, relaxing with friends while trying a new white wine, cheese, and small plate. I really can't think of a better way to spend an evening besides relaxing by candlelight and various white lights with friends and loved ones around. If you know me well you know that I can be very territorial and if I like a place I will NEVER take a date there bc I consider it mine! And bacchanal is that kind of place! Hehe it feels like a little piece of heaven right here in NOLA. 

The people that work here really know their libations and will pair your tastes for the perfect cheese, tasting plate etc. I have brought various kind of friends and even the one that went to culinary school at Johnson and Wales and used to work at Emeril's was impressed with their wine selection. In fact we selected a wine that he said he couldn't find anywhere else in NOLA. Score one for bacchanal! He was also impressed by their small plates and the homemade concoctions in the bar upstairs!

So if you want to relax somewhere and be amongst friends then come over to Bacchanal. You won't regret it! As other reviews have said this is like being in a friend's backyard. It's eclectic, homey, and endearing like the Bywater always is!

Happy carpe noctum!

I've been wanting to try this place since it opened and finally got a chance on my 5th wedding anniversary! While I take my baby son out to many restaurants, this isn't the kind of place I wanted to spend a bunch of money at and have to worry about him. So we came child-free. We made a reservation, which was a good idea. It was packed! We were seated upstairs, and as some others mention, it was LOUD. It didn't help that one party seated near us was quite obnoxious - to the tune of everyone turning around and staring. While it wasn't a romantic ambiance, it was still an enjoyable meal.

We started with the roasted cauliflower and the fries with ketchup and aioli. Both were delicious. The cauliflower came with golden raisins and gremolata. The fries were thin, salty, and had delicious dipping sauces. We cleaned our plates and washed them down with beer (him) and pineapple agua fresca (me). They have a huge list of wine and spirits here, and even a sommelier. I'm abstaining from alcohol currently but my husband enjoyed his pour. We continued our meal with the burger (him) and ratatouille (me). He enjoyed the burger with more fries, though said it was a little unimaginative. I LOVED the ratatouille. It had penne pasta, eggplant, zucchini and summer squash in a red pepper tomato sauce and lots of cheese. It came with a huge nest of arugula on time, which I removed (yuck, my least favorite green). I wanted to lick my plate. The flavors were intense. I'm not even a huge fan of eggplant unless it's very well prepared, like here. We finished with desserts, the pumpkin tart with maple ice cream and the oat financier cake with caramel apples and creme fraiche. Both were again, amazing. The oat cake was so flavorful and moist, perfectly complimented by the apples and creme. My husband almost didn't want us to order two to share because he was so full, but he couldn't stop eating them either. For two drinks, two apps, two entrees and two desserts, the bill was about $75 before tip. Not bad at all for this quality of meal. 

Service was on point all night. They have a lot of staff and seem to take somewhat of a team approach. I saw many people delivering food and helping out other than servers. We rarely had empty water glasses or dirty dishes on our table for more than a minute. 

Overall, a great experience and I will be back. They start serving brunch soon and I plan on trying it. Hopefully the crowds that we saw also enjoyed it and it stays around. Great addition to Maplewood!

4.5 rounded up. Super charming and chill place. Easy to make a reservation online and we were the only ones there when we arrived. Soft Italian music playing, and the door was open so we could hear the rain and the cars go by, adding to the ambiance. The proprietor (host plus waiter and maybe owner)? was quiet and kind. BYOB is inherently fun and cost-effective and there was no corkage fee. The bread that comes out at the beginning is SO GOOD. Warm focaccia-like bread, and a lot of it. Comes with great olive oil with balsamic already drizzled in it. (Pro for me, con for hubs, but he still really enjoyed the bread.) The entrees came out pretty quickly. He got his usual chicken parm and I tried the Capellini Johny Rocco, which was an olive oil/tomato/spinach/garlic pasta. Both dishes were a solid 4 out of 5. Not the BEST pasta I've ever had (it was maybe a tiny bit buttery, which isn't my fave), but it was really warm and comforting and indulgently olive oil-y. Next time I would try the clam linguini with red sauce. The red sauce linguini that came with the chicken parm was good and had a unique orange tint, like a vodka sauce though it didn't taste as such. Towards the end of our meal a party of loud guys came in, and it's a small place so we could hear their entire conversation, so that was a tad less charming, but I don't fault the place for that. Baby loved the pasta and the vibes as well. Also, the portions were large and we had leftovers to bring home. This is a really nice small business and if we lived in Philly, we'd come regularly.

Why 5 stars? Because this is definitely a place I want to visit regularly.

   ---   ---   ---

Ever since missing the Yelp event hosted here, I have had it on my list to check this place out. My first experience was very brief as I found out he did not receive his shipments in due to the threat of a hurricane, so he was out of all fresh food from the deli. Of course, this was totally understandable, but I do wish there was some kind of posting on social media about that because I even checked their Facebook page ahead of time to confirm that they were open.

But I waited a couple of weeks and returned. There were a few sandwich options but I was told that the menu would be changing in a few days, so I'm not sure what's currently available as I type this out. I opted for a Cuban sandwich and browsed the products while I waited.

This Cuban was just a bit different than any other that I've had. I think the main difference is that it was only moderately pressed, which left some softness to the bread and did not completely melt the cheese to act as an adhesive to hold everything together. While I was a bit thrown off by that at first, I came to realize how much I enjoyed the sandwich as I continued to eat it. 

I also was able to buy a few local brews here. I love Pumpkin Beer and picked up some cans from Brew Bus, Big Top and Tampa Bay Brewing Company. They pretty much have every single canned beer made in the Tampa Bay area here, so you any beer lovers will be all set with this selection.

For all the delicious snacks in here, I do wish that there were some chips available. That was the only thing missing with my sandwich, but the sandwich itself was a home run.

On my next visit, I ordered a pizza with prosciutto and mozzarella, which was enjoyable, but I liked the Cuban Sandwich even more. There are a couple other sandwiches on the menu that I would like to try on future visits.

We love this place. Our rule of thumb when ordering the deep dish is to get as few ingredients as possible. Typically if you get o e of the specialty pizzas all the I ingredients fall off, and we get a sloppy pizza. Of course, our order is t complete without the cheesy breadsticks which are the highlight of our meal. Love the draft list and service plus pizza is excellent,

Best described as "mozzarella sticks... but better", fried cheese curds by Cow and the Curd put the frozen bar-food variety to shame.  The guys who run this are always hustling - they're EVERYWHERE, at every major food truck event in PA or NJ, and they've always got the longest line, which is completely understandable.  Everybody loves some fried, cheesy goodness, and Cow and the Curd is doing it better than anyone else right now. $8 for an order is a little steep, but it's not stopping me.  Skip the dipping sauces, they're good enough without, and split them with a friend; there's plenty in a single order to share!

Since that first visit, this place became a regular favorite for me. Everything is amazingly fresh and I've grown to love the decor and size. The staff remember your name and make you feel welcomed and that plus the shrimp and grit cake keep me coming back!

I loved this experience! I came here with my Dad who is pretty old fashioned and wouldn't wear the bib. He also refused to put on the plastic gloves. The server picked up on his resistance and quickly brought him a plate and cutlery without us even asking. I loved how attentive they are here. 

The food is fantastic. We had the snow crab legs and the lotus root which were all brought to us hot and steaming in a plastic bag. You eat with your hands on the brown paper covered table. It's a kids dream. You do get really messy. That's part of the fun. We did get the mild spice, which was a bit more spicy than I was expecting so be aware of that. 

The scissors they provide are super easy to use and can get into everything. Way way way better than Red Lobster ever was.

We had my birthday dinner here and had been excited to try this new hot spot out for a while. We were seated upstairs in a nice spacious dining area. The atmosphere is upscale casual and a bit romantic. It's pretty low key and quiet with a lot of couples and business associates dining out. It's definitely not a place to catch the game or have a wild night out. Our waiter was very knowledgable and friendly. I was very pregnant at the time, so he informed me that they had alcohol free wine - score!!! I love wine and I haven't been anywhere that served alcoholic free wine. It was sweet but oh so delicious. We had the corn bread starter and hummus, both were delicious. For dinner I had the pork chops. I never would order them, but the waiter said they were a favorite, so I went for it.  I am so glad I took his advice because they were phenomenal! The sauce was surprisingly different, more of a cream based sauce and it was fantastic. My fellow diners had the steak, which was delicious, but everyone who tried my dish said it was the best. Someone else had the spaghetti pasta which was good, but not over the top special in my book. Dessert was outstanding with flavors of cashew pudding topped with bourbon whipped cream. The chefs here are really creative, mixing up traditional items with a twist that makes them both memorable and delicious. Two thumbs up for Reeds!

Looking for a workout like nothing you've done before? To push yourself to limits you didn't know you could achieve? That's CrossFit! It's Olympic lifting, it's gymnastics, it's crazy stuff that I had never done before and now I'm hooked. It's not a gym in the traditional meaning, it's coach led classes. 

This place is great. I shopped around and went to many of the other St. Louis CrossFit boxes and fell in love with the staff, the support, and the people here. The location is brand spanking new, it's super clean and organized, and the people are so helpful and supportive. It's like I found a family of people who push each other to do their best. Cheesy, but totally true. 

There are free intro classes on Tuesdays and Thursdays at 7:30pm or call and see if they can do a free private session (that's what they did for me). It's not cheap, but it's worth every penny.

This place is a hidden gem.  It is located in a strip mall, but this restaurant is anything but a strip mall restaurant.   My husband took me here for my birthday and I was blown away with the whole experience.  It's a very modern, romantic atmosphere.  The food is excellent.  I was shocked by the Fois gras-amazing.  I had the prix fixe menu and I loved ordering 3 courses.  The short ribs were great, but I want to try something new next time.  The desserts were awesome.  I usually take caramel, but there was a caramel tart that was to die for.  Can't wait to go back!!!!

I love bringing my dog here. Everyone is so friendly and I it's nice to have the many options of treatments they offer. I brought my previous dog here who had Cancer so he could receive the Chinese Herbs to keep him healthy. Now I bring our new German Shepherd and the care continues to be so sweet and patient with my nervous dog when we are here. Dr. Shaw is wonderful and I've recommended a lot of friends and people who ask for a place to take their fury family members.

I recently visited B&M for a fourth time and ordered my usual B&M Burger and Truffles fries. This time, I ordered the cheese board appetizer and an extra order of truffle fries -- because, why not? My original review was four stars out of five, but I have to be fair... this place is five out of five.

There is a bit of exclusivity that this place seems to give off. They have hours between 4:30 to 10 (or 11?), and they don't accept reservations -- they accept "call-ahead seating." Once you arrive at the designated time, you'll have to wait somewhere between 15-30 minutes for your actual table, but the servers are very attentive while you wait. I found the servers to be very knowledgeable about both the food and the wine selection. 

Word-of-mouth has certainly given this place quite the attention and for good reason. B&M has one of the most delicious burgers I've ever come across. And while I commented earlier on the size of the burger, I have to say that the size is probably "just right." Their truffle fries rival that of Ciro's, and my mouth waters just thinking about how deliciously crisp, salty, and flavorful that they are. 

If you haven't yet explored B&M in DTSP, you're missing out. This is especially the case if you're a "foodie." Don't come here expecting your standard, American restaurant fare, though. And also don't come here expecting to get "filled up" at this restaurant, unless you order several plates. The point of this restaurant is to introduce you to the idea of "craft food." Food snobs will swear by this place, but general food lovers - like myself - will thoroughly enjoy the overall experience.

Beer-top notch
Brew Pub- love it inside and out 
Food-Meh. I think they're trying to get you drunker. Small portions and a good brews

Good Dog is a great go-to in my neighborhood.  Whenever a friend comes to town and we don't wanna go OUT-OUT on a Friday night, this bar is always there with good food and drinks and just up the block.  Great burger - who doesn't love blue cheese oozing out of the center of a delicious beef burger?!  Mixture of sweet and regular fries is a nice touch, too.  Their food is consistently good for "pub fare".  They also have salads with goat cheese and shrimp...so you can eat healthy as you down your Sly Fox beer!  

The downer here is that it's tough to get a table at times, and it's a mix of drinkers and diners...so if you're looking for a place to have conversation, it's small in there and can get quite loud if you're next to loud boozer-types.  At the same time, it's a bar!  The music is fun and upbeat.  I highly recommend Good Dog as your go-to when the next blizzard rolls into town (hopefully not until next winter).

Apparently people like to play Quizzo here, so if you come on that night, you might have to vacate early for Quizzo ressies.  Nerd alert! :)

When we walked in, we were greeted by a friendly hostess and served by a really nice waitress. The atmosphere is relaxing and great to have a family dinner.

In comparison to other restaurants, I love that they have a healthier selection of options to choose from. We ended up trying their happy hour specials along with a few meals since we were a big group. 

From the happy hour specials we ordered the hummus trio, steamed mussels in white wine sauce, the sautéed mushrooms, and the fresh mozzarella and tomato. All were very delicious. 

You can never go wrong when you order a pita and if you like garlic, their roasted garlic and mushroom pizza is also very good.

I was pleasantly surprised when I went in today for my new licence and photo.

First, surprised with myself that I didn't wait until the end of the month (yay, me!), and that may have lead to the short lines that I experienced. Actually, the no line. I was able to walk in, right up to the three smiling, friendly ladies who were available to help.

I found the staff to be extremely pleasant, fast, and easy going. They knew what they were doing and it was the fastest registry experience I've ever had!

I may not love the new photo (I was given the opportunity for a retake but meh, I don't really think a licence photo is supposed to look amazing) but I enjoyed the experience, as much as you can!

I love the atmosphere here! It's a cute restaurant with unique menu items. We sat outside on a nice but slightly chilly day. The overhead heaters saved the day! They were subtle and kept us comfortable the whole evening. The beer list was not extensive, but had a good variety. For our meal, I had the cast iron octopus. It is served salad style on dandelion greens. The greens had a strong flavor, but it was balanced by the glaze. The octopus was terrific. The pickled mussels were a unique touch to the dish. My boyfriend had the P&K cheeseburger and he thoroughly loved it. I picked at his french fries that came with the burger, and the fries were delicious. He asked for bacon on the burger, but it arrived baconless. The server was very apologetic and explained that there were some recent changes in the kitchen and specifications of dishes aren't being communicated to the kitchen staff.

Authentic French bakery, a French owner & Baker, managed by an authentic stylish French lady with a French accent! It feels like France in there :) I love this place! 
The space is an awesome transformation from the last cafe. All white, with a long white bar. Bold glass chandeliers, and lots of French charm.
The cases are filled with Nutella-whipped cream chouquettes, a Bouche de Noel, croissants, chausson au pommes (my fave) and pain Au chocolates. It's the real deal, authentic French pastries right here!!! The owner makes them all! 
I will be back very soon!

BEST BRISKET I'VE HAD IN INDIANA in a while.  This place is a bit inconspicuous as we almost passed it by our first time.  It was about 11.45 on a Saturday and they hadn't turned their "OPEN" sign on yet and the parking lot was empty.  We decided to give it a shot.. and ended up there again the next weekend!

I couldn't decide between the pork or brisket, but finally settled on the brisket as my wife got a pork quesadilla.  The brisket was cooked very well.. it didn't fall apart and it had a good smoke ring and taste.  I would have loved to have a couple burnt ends, but I can manage without.  I had some mac n cheese, which was good, but nothing amazing (I'd take more meat and no sides any of the week)

Atmosphere is cool with a race car in the back half of the restaurant.  They also do a buffet sometimes.. not sure what its all about, but its there if you need it.

I believe this may be the original Outback Steakhouse. I think that Outback is to blame for my Steak Addiction. I got hooked before I was old enough to drive. Now, more than 15 years later, I still love that juicy steak like it was the first time I tasted it. Instinctively, I always go with Victoria's Filet, a Loaded Baked Potato, and a Caesar Salad. I usually get a Fosters, Australian for beer, to wash it down. And when I am feeling extra greedy, I will start off with a Bloomin' Onion. But if you do that be careful, those Bloomin' Onions have been known to ruin an appetite or two.

I have been to this location a few times. The staff have always been professional and friendly. I have never had any problems. The food is usually speedy. I have dined at the bar and in a booth, service is good at both. The only complaint that I have is the parking lot. It is not large enough for the crowd. Luckily, it probably keeps the wait times inside to a minimum. 

If you love steaks and you are stuck up about them, then Outback's chain steakhouse menu may not make you super thrilled. But if you love steak and can put up with the chain vibe, then you should really like Outback. It is my favorite chain steakhouse. That being the case, I love coming to this location because this is where it all started! This place is like the Ancient Greece of Outbacks!

Love this shop! They have a great selection of gifts and jewelry. It's a good place to look if you are searching for some Hoosier memorabilia. Their monument "Christmas" tree stationary and other Christmas gifts this year were adorable!

This was my first time eating at this establishment and I loved the CAT bagel sandwich. The tempeh was yummy but was not crunchy. I'd love to return to try other options. They do serve eggs and chicken for people who prefer those options. They have coffee, teas, and hot chocolate as  a few of their drink options.

I love trying fresh seafood on piers, wharfs and seaside markets. Most of the time, it is a disappointing experience but this place is not. The food is legitimately fresh and prepared well. The gorgeous view is just a cherry on top of nature's beautiful sundae. I have been here before but ordered the "wrong" thing (cioppino). That wasn't very good when I had it a couple of years ago here.
