We came for a late lunch/early dinner on a Monday. Even at 4pm,  there was a wait! We waited about 25 minutes and got a table outdoor. While it wasn't ideal that we sat right in the sun with no shelter other than our sunscreen and sunglasses, the view was worth it. 

We got the local crab special which was a steamed 3-lb. crab served with a salad and soup for $26. I thought this was quite the steal because the crab was huge, delicious and meaty. The garden salad was fresh as simple as it was. The lobster bisque we got was pretty good. (The other options were Caesar salad and clam chowder). They topped off the crab with a couple of onion rings and cups of cocktail sauce and drawn butter. Yum!

We also got the fried platter of shrimp, oysters, calamari and scallops for $12.95. It came with cole slaw, onion rings, tartar sauce and cocktail sauce. As greasy of a meal as this made, it was one of the better fried platters I've had anywhere. The seafood was just really fresh including the sometimes-feared fried oyster. :)

The ice in our iced teas melted away in the sun. Our waitress was so cool and brought us lots of extra ice and an extra iced tea in case we needed it (we did because it was hot out!). She was just friendly and good at her job - five stars for her!

By the time we left at about 6, there were so many people waiting. Make sure you sign up for a seat on the clipboard right when you get there. The restaurant is the last one at the very end of the pier. Parking on the pier is free for 90 minutes but it looks like a drive that will upset tires. I parked in the large lot south of the pier and walked 15 minutes up and onto the pier. It was free on a Monday late afternoon.

We love the food here! We don't make it over this way often but when we do we love to stop in for a bite. The restaurant comes off as fancy, so we eat in the lounge and order our food from there, especially since we usually only eat the appetizers. The spinach dip is absolutely divine! We also get the chicken tenders tossed in buffalo and they are amazing. My husband also likes the calamari a lot, but I wouldn't know since I don't eat seafood. If you stay at the hotel or are in town, it's definitely worth eating at - even if just for appetizers.

Love the food truck! Absolutely delicious fried cheese curds. Nice portions but I do not agree with the up charge for a dipping sauce.  The curds themselves aren't cheap at $8 for the basket.  At least one sauce should be included.  

Really friendly people on the truck though.  And no matter how long the line it moves super fast!

A great ol' train station, the kind they wouldn't build like this if they built a new one today.  It's a gorgeous building, with soaring columns and its solumn War Memorial statue on the 29th Street side of the main concourse.  The location is extremely convenient to downtown Phlly.  It could use a few more diverse and interesting food vendors.  A nice gateway via train to the City of Brotherly Love.  Unfortunately, if you're here, you're more than likely travelling on Amtrak, so the experience is almost undoubtedly about to go downhill.

My girlfriend, cousin and I came here for restaurant week because the menu sounded promising. I mean who doesn't love downtown southern food right? 

We arrived right around 8pm and the restaurant was completely empty inside. It was a typical bar look inside with wooden booths and dim lights. We chose to sit outside since our was a nice night. We sat for about 20 minutes before somebody came to take our drink order. This should have been the indication of how slow service would be smh

For appetizers I ordered the shrimp and anchovy toast which the toast was burnt but the shrimp had a decent flavor. My friend ordered the country pate which was bland and not enough bread for the pate. My cousin ordered the biscuits and gravy which was the only good tasting thing. 

For our entrees, I ordered the shrimp gumbo which was decent in flavor but needed more spices. My friend ordered the country fried chicken which was crispy but flavorless. My cousin ordered the braised beef short ribs which were very salty. We were far from impressed. 

For dessert I took the recommendation of the server and ordered the whiskey brownie a la mode. The brownie was stale and so hard. I could have gotten a better brownie premade from the grocery store. 

So the slow service with the mediocre food will cause us not to come back to this place. It's sad considering the food description had so much potential.

Wow, Mr. B's is awesome! Although at first we were put in a crappy table next to the kitchen, which we moved from before we ate, we ended up in a great table, albeit with a not so friendly waitress. Seriously, this chick looked like she hadn't smiled in about 10 years. 

Regardless, everyone loved everything that they ordered, from the eggplant sticks and salads, to the steak. lamb chops, and mahi mahi. And speaking of my dish- it was a mind-blowing, drool-worthy pasta, which tasted like it had liquid smoke in it. It was such an amazing blend of smokey vegetables and perfectly al dente pasta that I could eat it every single day. 

To finish we had the bread pudding and profiteroles, which both rocked my socks off. If we had our original waiter, this would have been a 5-star review.

This is a great inexpensive hotel.  When we arrived Friday afternoon they were just starting a wine and cheese hour!  What a treat!  We were quite excited.  They also have complimentary breakfast every morning....another bonus.  The rooms were good sized and the bed was comfortable.  The staff was friendly and accommodating.  There is a pool and a hot tub, all looked very clean and inviting.  There are lots of tables/umbrellas/chairs,etc all around the pool.  The rooms came with two complimentary waters which we were more than happy to take advantage of.  They even give you chocolates on your pillow!  Oh, and free internet too!  

The rooms were very clean and I love when the sink and mirrors aren't in the bathroom so that you can get ready when the actual bathroom is being used.  One tip......the website will give you a AAA rate even for a weekend reservation but if you call the hotel directly they will tell you you cant get the AAA rate.  We booked it online with the AAA rate no problem and of course the hotel honored it.  It is REALLY reasonably priced.  Right across the street from the ocean and some of the rooms have an ocean view. Walking distance to State Street.  This place is a real find!

What a great place for Indy train lovers.  It's even sweeter as a Christmas holiday outing.  We took our 5yr old grandson and he loved it.  He loves trains and drags out ours & builds it on our large table every visit.  He was just the right age because he knows that they're not toys to touch.  He stood and watched them for the longest time, especially his favorite with the waterfall.  They are still adding and I'm hopeful it will continue to expand with many more.  It's worth an hour or two of your time and you can pick up a bite of lunch while you're there.  Make sure and not miss it next year!

Pretty good.  Had the guacamole and chips  for appetizer which were tasty.  My entree was the shrimp enchiladas with a very creamy chipotle sauce.  They were decent, but the sauce a bit rich for my taste.  The serving size was very big, 3 enchiladas, so I brought one home.  I liked the refried beans, but didn't love the rice.  The desserts were not good at all.  Their flan was all wrong.  How can you mess up flan?
I've been several times over the years and the food is always pretty good.  I have yet to find good Mexican in or around the Philly area.  I'll keep trying, b/c eventually someone is going to get it right.

I took my parents here while they were visiting Tucson last month and they were shocked about how similar the cuisine is to Indian food. I've had it before and had a feeling they would enjoy it and of course they did. I love their shiro and all of our dishes were very flavorful and some also had a nice spice to them. We were also checked on several times throughout our meal. I like that they give you small portions of dishes you did not order as "sides" in addition to your entrees when they bring you your platter. I was glad I got to try almost all of the dishes on the menu since we got a few extra tastes. The injera was a little soggy compared to other times I have had it, but I wonder if it was a one time thing or just a different style.

When I made my 1st RETURN to New Orleans in OVER 20 years I searched and inquired from friends the best places to see, eat and drink... Lüke (like a few other places) had popped up in many searches and recommended by many fellow yelpers).... 

On our flight from Florida I locked in a reservation for a rather late night dinner (enough time to travel to our hotel, unpack and grab a pre-dinner drink... On the flight I also checked out the menu and pictures online and was impressed but was not expecting find more than one article rating Lüke as serving one of the best burgers in Louisiana... 

10 pm reservation on a weeknight and they were packed but our table was ready for us upon arrival.  The place is bright with impressive wood features like the eat-at bar and table partitions... the floors are should be for walking but they were drawing my eyes down to see the tile and wood inlay floors. The lighting fixtures and tin-ceiling tiles added to the charm. I also loved the way they displayed their seafood selection in a cold section at the bar.

I was very much in the mood to eat traditional New Orleans dishes like Shrimp 'N Grits or Étouffée, but I kept thinking of that burger so I went for it.... 

The Lüke Burger was legit.... bacon (glazed I believe), caramelized onions, tomatoes and emmenthaler cheese (I never heard of it either)... very pleased with my decision !

I also managed to steal a bite or two of their Shrimp 'N Grits (En Cocotte) which was absolutely spectacular !

Also enjoyed a Sazerac before dinner... they did New Orleans righteous with the city's signature drink

Yes, I know they are all about the same. All clean. Help is professional,courteous & professional.
This one was very quick. The car in front ordered like 10 things & I knew I would be in the drive through lane forever. Thankfully not true, within 5 minutes I was up to get my drive through order, & be on my way.
All courteous, professional staff that I dealt with. Appeared manager was working drive thru  on Thanksgiving. Good for him!
Got a great shake, love their Happy Hour. 
What's a girl to do? A good shake is hard to find.... at Steak & Shake, always great.

Great experience each time I'm here. Service is always good, and the food even better. Super fresh seafood. I personally love the uni and crab. I've had both their box and rock crab. The box crab is tastier but more expensive. The crab is served with onion rings. I just wish they served my crab with the tomalley. The uni is served on top of scallops and slices of lime. It might just be me, but I think the uni tasted sweeter in the winter. Regardless, still good now - certainly better than uni you get on a tray in a market due to freshness. My recommendation is to get local seafood. Why get seafood that has been shipped hundreds of miles when you can get something fresh from local waters? Support local fishermen maybe. It's also better for the environment. They have tables inside and outside. There is usually a wait if you come at peak times or with a large party. Consider adding your name to the list and going for a short walk around the pier as you wait,  or go during off peak times. Parking on the wharf is free for the first 90 minutes. There is also street parking near the wharf if you're up for a walk and if you can find an open spot.

It's a great place to enjoy the night.
I had spaghetti something drink, pork belly and mac and cheese. drink was very good and it had lots of taste and flavor in it. pork belly very juicy and tender. delicious. I loved it. mac and cheese is not my favorite, but  his one was one of the bests that I've ever had.
Joyful live jazz music made everything even more enjoyable. 

Although I was sitting at the door and it was cold outside, and their restaurant is small and packed, and ...., but It's great and joyful experience. and they deserve 5 starts.

This is a great restaurant right off exit 31 on I24 for locals or the weary traveler who is tired of fast food. We like to eat here on most Sunday's after church. We are always seated quickly and are served fresh chips and salsa. The salsa has a good kick to it but it's not too spicy. I like to get the chicken chimichanga. My kids love the rice and beans. The servers aren't particularly chatty...I guess they just like to get right down to business. I'm not mad at that because sometimes I don't care for gimmicks put on by servers. I just want food! 
The whole restaurant is very spacious and even on their busier nights you don't feel like you're right on top of each other. 
This is definitely a regular spot for us!

4.5

After seeing a review of the day being featured for Nectar Urban, I knew I had to check this place out. I got a Chicken Tinga taco and a Yazoo Dos Perros Decker taco.

The chicken tinga one had chipotle & onion braised chicken, avocado spread, a house crema, and jalapeños (which I had to take off bc they were too spicy. But, hey, I still got the cool aesthetic colors with it so that's all that matters right?). The Yazoo one had Yazoo braised brisket, pepper jack cheese, pico de gallo, horseradish crema. Both were AMAZING but I really liked the Yazoo one better. As you may know in my previous reviews, I'm a brisket kind of guy so I naturally loved it better.

We also got an order of the avocado fries, served with a morita ketchup, which was absolutely delicious. A definite must with your meal.

Came here for an early dinner on a Sunday evening, not too many tables were taken, but given the time I went I can't give a great indication of how busy they get at peak times. 

Having never tried mullet I knew that would be the move given how well known they are for it. My server gave helpful instructions on how to go about eating around the bones, as my carnivore habits probably would have led to me swallowing a few bones without it. 

The mullet tasted super fresh and I loved getting a variety of textures and levels of fattiness between the different sections of the fish. I didn't find it too difficult to navigate around the bones, but if it's your first time eating around smaller bones like this I can understand how that would detract from your experience. 

The German potato salad that comes on the side was also super delicious. It had a nice light mustard flavor and just the right amount of creaminess. 

The dish came with two homemade horseradishes, they both tasted good but felt out of place with the fish and potato salad. Perhaps the combination isn't for me bur I could definitely see it going well on a sandwich. 

Overall I would highly recommend this spot if you're visiting the area and looking for some seafood you likely won't be able to find back home!

Pretty good food and if you eat a lot you can get your money's worth.

I'm usually not a huge eater.  Two rolls for me is normally more than enough.  So when I come here, I have to expect to eat more than I'm comfortable with to get my money's worth.  However, for my husband, who is a huge eater, this is a good deal.  Therefore, this is a place we'll come to when we are both super hungry, but otherwise I won't be able to eat enough to make it worth it.

At 7 p.m. on a Friday it was completely packed.  We got the last table!  By the time we left at about 8 p.m. there were tables open again.

Service is fast, which is great!  At the Saki in Tampa, it took forever to get more food.  Here, it came pretty quickly.

My husband started with the salad with ginger dressing.  He said next time he'd skip it.  There wasn't enough dressing.  I got the Crazy Roll and the White Dragon Roll.  I liked the Crazy Roll best.  Their rolls are on the small side, which is good since you'll want to try a bunch.  Both were pretty good, but I noticed the rolls tend to lack the sauce that usually take it to the next level at normal sushi places.  I also got the salt and pepper calamari.  It was perfectly seasoned.  I loved it, but since I had to eat the whole thing by myself, I found it a little greasy by the end.  I finished with the green tea ice cream.  It lacked a strong green tea flavor, but it wasn't bad.  My husband tried chicken, shrimp, and steak hibachi.  I found the meat dry, but he liked it.  The fried rice, wasn't bad, but you could see the bits where they missed mixing in the soy sauce.  

I enjoyed how you could get 8 pieces of sashimi.  I got salmon sashimi and it was good. 

This place can be very hard to find.  Luckily, I saw it off of US Hwy19 so I had a general idea of where it was.  My gps took us in the general area, but then left us to figure it out.  It sits off of US Hwy19.  As long as you know that, you should be able to find it.

This Publix is by far my favorite publix!!! Not only is the staff nice and helpful, but they also do a exceptional job in the deli. There subs are wonderfully made and all there deli items are delicious and wonderful, especially their buffalo chicken dip, There meat and seafood section is also fantastic; I love that I never have to question the freshness of their seafood, meat, and poultry, unlike some grocery stores I've been too. Publix is more expensive than some other grocery stores like Winn Dixie and the now defunct Sweet Bays, but It's certainly not as expensive as Whole Foods and Fresh Market. Of course I have to say Whole Foods has a superior produce section and Fresh Market has a better Meat section and that's why their prices are higher than Publix. Having said that I would still go to Publix because it is closer to my house and I really enjoy their deli section. Also their cakes are fantastic. I'm proud to say I love their Teddy Bear cakes because they can make them for any special occasion. So if your heading to Honeymoon Island or just live in the area, stop at this Publix.

Awesome. Loved every part of this place, from the fast and friendly service to the delicious food. Highly recommend their WK Philly. The seitan looks exactly like actual steak, and the flavor is so yummy. Fries are cooked to order, fresh and crispy. Try their spicy ketchup, you won't regret it!

Sometimes I forget how much I love Dewey's. I gotta say, even though this place specializes in pizza, their salads are almost better. I started with the peppercorn ranch salad and it is to die for. How could it not be, with all my favorite stuff - bacon, parmesan cheese, ranch dressing? All the ingredients are so high quality. You can tell. I also like that it comes pre-mixed, so you don't have to sit there and spew salad all over the table trying to mix it yourself.

I love that you can order any of their salads as a side salad and you can order any of their specialty pizzas half and half. This time I tried half Edgar Allan Poe (olive oil, mozzarella-fontina blend, mushrooms, roasted garlic, kalamata olives and goat cheese, tomatoes and parsley) and half of their seasonal pizza, The Cuban, (mustard base, mozzarella, pulled pork, pickles, Canadian bacon, mojo sauce, swiss cheese). Both were great and I liked having two vastly different varieties side-by-side.

I'm embarrassed to say, my favorite from Dewey's is still the plain-old pepperoni. Apparently I have the palette of an 8-year old.

Just wanted to do a quick review of yet another place I've been wanting to try. First off, for some reason, I thought this place sold like custard and cream pies. But they don't. So after I calmed down and wiped my tears, I checked out what they do specialize in. And what they do specialize in, is a small assortment of soft serve type Ice Cream in about 4 or 5 delicious flavors like the Ube and Thai Tea that we tried (I'm now a fan of Thai Tea. They also have pretty witty names for their flavors too) served in a plastic sundae takeout thingy. It's served over your choice of chocolate or vanilla cake cubes  and you can choose your choice of sauce like strawberry or condensed milk etc. You can also add a couple pocky stix to your sundae for a small charge. We chose the green tea stix I believe it was. 
  All in all, I give the taste a 4.01584. I really thought I'd easily like the Ube better but that Matcha Tea surprised me. Wasn't sure about the vanilla cake, but when I got to it, it was soft and moist and tasted good under that  ice cream. I mean, cake and ice cream, can't go wrong. For our sauce, we chose the condensed milk. I love condensed milk on my shave ice back home and theirs was very light and not overpowering. The negative I have, was that the price seemed a little high to me. About $6 - $7 each from what I remember but, aside from that, we enjoyed it.
  Just wanted to say a big Mahalo to the owner, sorry I forgot your name. Great customer service from when we walked in until we left.

                 Cream shaboogie bop!

Yes!!!!! Another awesome brewery in Nola! And, delicious beer! 

I tried: Holy Roller IPA, nice and subtly hoppy, good color and cooooooooold as ice. I love that they serve their beers in mason jars. 

Charming Wit: Nice alternative to all the super hoppy stuff most breweries are doing these days. Almost floral, very fragrant. Easy to drink!

Charming Shandy: Man! This is going to be delicious in the summer. A bit overly citrus-y for my taste, but refreshing and one will be nice when it's HOT outside. 

What I didn't try: Grapefruit IPA, because they were out. 

Organic Lemonade, because it's non-alcoholic and I'll leave that to the kiddos. 

The large and almost barren warehouse space provides seating on picnic tables. There's a "kid area" with a chalk board and games/crafts. In door bathrooms, which is always a nice convenience. 

They take credit cards via square (you can have an open tab). They also sell growlers and merch, like t-shirts. 

There's plenty of parking on the side street. 

The one MAJOR complaint I have is that there's a large fan and it's ridiculously loud. I mean, you cannot have a conversation loud. I bet the cool air will be nice this summer though!!

After touring thrice, seeing what would become our new home twice, and a pocket or five of those warm, deliciously baked complimentary cookies in the lobby, we were pretty sure Beacon 430 was going to be where we'd be hanging our beads for at least the next 12 months! Cheryl was our guide & light-bearer through the paperwork & approval process; without her, we'd've surely been up the metaphorical creek! Jay, who I believe is the property manager, has also been nothing short of marvelous. Just this week while exiting the parking garage we were greeted by Jay & his crew handing out orange juice & Chick-fil-A biscuits! What a way to start the day! I mean, who has time for breakfast? That's going above & beyond! Period.

We adore our new home overlooking the pool. We've two large balconies, and the kitchen island is such a breath of fresh air! So much space! Huge rooms, huge closets, huge shower!

Now, let's address the elephant in the room... Or, upstairs I should say. Yes, the walls/floors are thin & I'm moderately certain a pachyderm lives above us, but it's apartment living & I'm not sure it could get much better than this, particularly in awesome DTSP. We meticulously combed & critiqued everywhere in downtown, but the deals, perks, and set-up offered by Beacon 430 couldn't be beat! Love it.

This museum is 95% authentic and is a must see when you are in St Louis MO. The docents are knowledgeable and kind. My sister in law and I took the guided tour on Sunday. It was raining on and off all day. I love the way you have to ring the bell to be let in. You start in the foyer, move to the parlor, move to the indoor room that was outdoor at one time and then into the kitchen. Our tour was interrupted three times by the bell. There has to be a better way for Campbell House Museum to handle this. We added 20 minutes or so to the tour with interruptions as well as questions that had already been asked if the partie(s) had started at the beginning. I truly enjoyed the tour and am so glad that Campbell House is available for the public to enjoy.

We tried this place out based upon the Yelp reviews - thank you Yelpers!  CASH ONLY!

I really enjoyed my breakfast, I went out on a limb and ordered a NOLA take on huevos rancheros and was not disappointed.  My companion ordered typical eggs, meat and grits.  He didn't love his - but I think because he didn't try something new.  

The diner and the staff are all about personality. Clearly it's a locals kind-of place.  The only odd thing, was the incredibly loud argument the line cook was having with a dishwasher about how hard his job was and how nobody could do it better than him.  Hmm, everyone in the restaurant could hear the argument, and frankly some folks were a little scared at the decibels.  A little off-putting to some, interesting albeit to me.

The fiancé and I selected Tayst as our 2 year anniversary celebration spot for dinner. Since we lived in Hillsboro Village, we have dreamed of the day where we could walk through those doors off of 21st and have a wonderfully romantic and divine culinary experience. Perhaps the anticipation and our expectations were too high. I'll break it down for you:

The Pro's:
1) The service. From the reservation to the to-go box, Tayst has fantastic employees. We had a reservation made in advance then had to change it to 20 minutes before we arrived and Sarah, the hostess was completely accommodating (not to mention pleasant). Our server John was polite, friendly, and enthusiastic about our meal and it showed by his attention to our table. 

2) The decor. Tayst is a very nice restaurant and is decorated appropriately. A cream colored curtain hung elegantly on the wall, capable of separating the dining area into two distinct spaces. Further the dining area was comforting and warm with the brown hues. 

3) The wine. I loved the wine selection and the overall organization of the wine menu. It was hard to settle my decision on just one wine. The prices ranged from $7-15 a glass. 

4) The menu options. Variety and inventiveness of flavors were much appreciated. The pumpkin bisque was practically sinful ($6) and the pork cake ($9) was also delightful. 

5) The philosophy. Self renewing and focus on local food producers.

The Cons.   
1) The price. I realized that we were in for a beating in terms of price but reflecting on the experience I don't think it was entirely worth what we paid. We could have easily had a steak and roasted chicken dinner somewhere else for at least 25% cheaper for just as much atmosphere and flavor. 

2) The wait. Upon ordering, it felt as if it was an extended period of time before our entrées arrived.

HotBox pizza is a decent pizza joint and you can usually get your food pretty quickly and it's pretty inexpensive. Depending on who you talk to or where you went to college HotBox is either the bees knees or they hate it. All my purdue friends are all about HotBox pizza, and my IU friends (or husband) cant stand HotBox. I dont discriminate my pizza, either you good pizza or you suck, this is one of the better pizza joints if you want something pretty fast. I usually go for the 10" Porky the Pig which has pepperoni, bacon, sausage and ham on it, all meat all the way. I usually get a side of breadsticks as well and a coke to go because I love collecting those cups. That's the main reason I go, I love the cups, they are so useful for so many different things. I have always wanted to try the seasonal pizza before, maybe in the new year.

There's nothing like a strong margarita to close out a long week, and La Rev definitely delivers in this regard.  The drinks are good and reasonably priced.  Their guac is super good too and I love trying out their huge variety of sauces with the extra tortilla chips!  The tacos are good, but don't really strike me as the best value for the price.

The service here is hit or miss.  I've had some really great servers and I've had a couple who were just not super nice people. I don't need a Peppy Pollyanna to bring me my drinks, but I also don't want to feel like I'm in trouble when I order food.

If it weren't for the tiki bar, I might give La Rev three stars, but that outdoor patio is everything.  When summer comes around, it's the perfect atmosphere for relaxing with the coworkers for happy hour or grabbing a late night taco!

We were in Florida on vacation, up early before the kids for some alone time and chai. We walked past three other shops to come here, attracted by the local and organic, non-gmo offerings.

The service was rude, we weren't even greeted just asked what we wanted. Two traditional chais seems pretty standard to me. The gentleman making things was very nice. 

No sleeves, okay fine I'll be eco friendly and not complain about the chai being really hot through the cup. Except it wasn't even worth drinking. I'm a Starbucks lover, but I'm also a lover of small cafes because nothing compares.

So disappointed.

The most amazing meal I think I had in New Orleans. The service and the food was amazing! We went for my sisters bachelorette party and they had a great table for the 7 of us. Our server (I cannot remember his name) was so amazing and So accommodating of our food allergies. I had the shrimp with grits, which our server recommended. It was so good and full of flavor! I am still thinking of it. Everyone loved their dish and raved about the food and the service. Great fries for an appetizer as well. We will be back the next time we are in New Orleans!

Tucked away in a fairly discrete strip mall, this place probably mainly does take out orders but does have a few tables where you can stop in if you want a flavorful and healthy('ish...i mean it's vegetarian right?) meal. As stated, there is no meat in this establishment, but that doesn't stop them from having some delicious Indian food anyways. Came here and got a lunch special of the Paneer Tikka Masala(which comes with a veggie samosa and your choice of naan or rice), along with the Mushroom Bhaji with rice. Everything tasted great and for lunch the paneer lover's platter(which was the aforementioned tikka masala, samosa, and naan or rice) was a great deal at $10.

Some issues still stand; Apparently rice doesn't come with their meals normally and with the random sides here and there it can get a pricier than you'd expect. But that aside, the food is delicious and the portions we have had were plenty filling. For a wide selection of vegetarian options, I think I'll be back.

I love to support local shops and since I live near Broad Ripple this was the ideal choice to get my first tattoo. Before getting my tattoo I pierced my nose about a month before that here. I was a walk in and the piercing experience was seamless with the staff being extremely welcoming and supportive. When I came in a month or so later to get my tattoo I knew I was going to get a great customer experience. I truly did, the tattoo came out exactly how I wanted to and love it. Can't wait to go back to get my second tattoo.

Came here for dinner during main line's restaurant week! I made sure to make reservations on a Friday night incase they were packed and when we arrived it was pretty crowded with only a couple empty tables. Glad we still made reservations. We byob to this cute clean establishment and the staff were very accommodating. I ordered off the restaurant week menu - 20 bucks for an appetizer, entree, bread, and desert.  Got the veggie curry as my entree.  Wow what a deal! My boyfriend ordered this lamb dish and he was impressed with everything. We agreed this is def one of the better Indian restaurants we have been to in the area. What made me love this place even more is that after we left I realized I left my phone on the table. When we got to the car we drove around to the front where one of the staff was waiting for us to come back around with my phone! They were so kind! Def will be back!

Love coming to the Eagle to grab just drinks or dinner and drinks. We typically sit at the second inside bar because it's not as packed. When available we go outside on the patio. Food is fantastic! Typically order the chicken and split it or get the chicken sandwich. Their Mac n cheese and spoon bread is great! Sometimes our service could be a little quicker but we understand they are usually busy and doing the best they can.

After trying out a disappointing cupcakery in Orlando, I was happy to find this little shop in the strip mall near where I was eating lunch.  The cup cakes were fresh and lovely in her display case, each one marked with a Heart, noted a filled one. All cup cakes were $1.50 save for the canolli cup cake and that was $1.75 because it was real canolli filling and a bit more expensive to make. 

The shop smells wonderful upon entering. It is a bit no frills but over all, that's fine. It's the product that you're looking for. The cup cakes are small, but GOOD. Moist cake, good icing, not too sweet but very tasty. The husbeast had the blueberry filled one, and he said it was amazing, I opted for the Salted Caramel cupcake and it was DELICIOUS. 

I will come back when I'm by this way again. This is the kind of place that needs to be heard about. They're a little off the beaten path, but well worth the journey.

After sitting at the bar for almost 10 minutes with no one even acknowledging us (even though the bar was empty), we decided to try sitting down at a table. The hostess kindly sat us in the atrium and we ended up with a really nice server (sorry can't remember her name)!

It was also kind of odd that there was no beer list or menu. 

Let me preface by saying that I'm not an oyster lover, but the charbroiled oysters were pretty great. The buttery sauce was also delicious to dip with bread. We also had the seared tuna salad which was pretty good too. Honestly, if I were to go back, I'd just order a dozen or two charbroiled oysters for the entree.

I love meat and dairy...but Sprig & Vine can make a pretty delicious meal without either.

We started with a bowl of the soup special: Sweet White Potato - nice flavor with Brazilian nuts and oil adding some nice flavor.  The Cauliflower Banh Mi is spicy, but really delicious - I am rethinking my long-term dislike of cauliflower.  The Oyster Mushroom Po' Boy is very subtle in flavor with some slightly pickled cucumbers - also a good choice.

I love Ooh La La Nail Spa, and I won't get my nails done anywhere else! The staff is so kind, and they always do a wonderful job! Pao is the best! She remembers every person's name that walks into the salon. She is the definition of excellent customer service, and she always does a fabulous job on my nails! They make you feel pampered and relaxed here! This salon is very popular, so I suggest calling and making an appointment!

Franklin Field is full of history. I saw the 2012 Ivy League championship here, and I loved how well maintained this old stadium is. I'm not sure how much longer this stadium will be around, but you should definitely check it out. 

Franklin Field was at one time the world's largest stadium, and it also used to be the home of the Philadelphia Eagles. Vince Lombardi's only career playoff loss occurred on this field, as well as an incident that helped make Eagle fans infamous. Yup! This is where Eagle's fans booed and pelted Santa with snowballs.

Even though this stadium doesn't have the modern amenities that Lincoln Financial Field or Citizen's Bank Park has, it's still a great place to see a little piece of Philadelphia frozen in time.

So I've been to Goten and Tokyo Japanese Steak House.  TJSH takes the cake!  The bang for your buck is much better, most likely because it's not situated in a hotel.  I went on a Friday night with a friend and we were able to quickly grab a seat at one of the grills.  (It wasn't very crowded).  The chef was fun and the food just as it should be.  I love hibachi shrimp. LOVE.  They had the usual sauces except for a spicy mustard.  Even so everything tasted great.  They also had a live piano player in the lounge.  He stole my heart when he played the peanuts theme song.  Next time I am in the mood for hibachi this is definitely where I will be.

Love this place! Someone once told me to try the lavender honey flavor and I have chosen it ever since. It's so refreshing and the perfect amount of mild sweetness that I never regret getting this flavor. You HAVE to try it at least once! 

The line in this place is always so long every time I go but it's definitely well worth it and the staff are really efficient in keeping it moving. I've never not had a spot to sit down in yet but just beware that you have to be pretty quick to pick one up because the tables are gone almost instantly. The walls are filled with customer art and it's really cool to see. 

It's honestly one of my favorite ice cream places and I love coming here! Just be careful about parking in the CVS parking lot across the street because cops have camped out there a few times and they did stop us from parking there and walking across the street once. Also a big thing to note is that they are cash only!!! Come prepared and do not wait in line all that time to realize you don't have cash on you until you're at the front!

I LOVE THE WAFFLE HOUSE.

The staff is soo friendly, always calling you "sugar" or "honey".  I had the cheesy eggs which were amazing and the buttery grits.  Oh yum!  We shared the classic waffle which is always made from scratch and so warm and fresh.  Simple food prepared with love and care.  

A must for any road trip!!

So we were in Philadelphia with the baby and craving some steak.  Since one of us had to stay with the baby in the hotel room, we decided to see if they would do steak to go...and they were so accommodating and packed up everything perfectly.  So a big plus there!  As some places do not do "to go."

So this review is strictly for the food, as we did not dine in.  However, the bar area in which I waited for our food was lovely and the bartenders were so attentive and helpful.

For appetizer, we ordered the Shrimp Cocktail, Onion Soup Au Gratin, Escargot, and Steak Tartare.  The Shrimp Cocktail was fresh and huge, four to an order!  Loved the fresh grated horseradish...made all the difference!  Onion Soup Au Gratin was just so-so, it was a bit on the salty side so we actually ended up pouring it over the steak as seasoning.  The Escargot and Steak Tartare were just perfect...both were perfectly seasoned and prepared well.  The escargot was piping hot but no rubbery and the Steak Tartare was rich and balanced.

For entree, we shared the 18 oz Delmonico.  It was a HUGE piece of meat!  While it was done perfectly, however the meat itself was pretty standard, nothing to write home about.  Don't get me wrong, it was a still a beautiful piece of meat, but we had just come from a fabulous steak house the night before so the bar was set a bit high.  

In all, the appetizers get 4.5 stars, the steak gets 3 stars.  But the fact that they were willing to pack up a meal for me to go boosted them to total of 4 stars!!!

We ended up here for dinner one night and we were seated right away. The waitress was very friendly and direct about the dishes. There were a lot of variety of options, we went with the mac and cheese added blackened chicken as well as a portobello rigatoni and added blackened chicken. They both came out with a side piece of warm bread and were very delicious. The mushrooms in the rigatoni seemed like they could have been sautéed a bit more and also diced up rather than the large slices as well as a bit more saucier as well. The chicken came out very good.
 
Our waitress was very nice and courteous, with great recommendations. The atmosphere was very calm and welcoming. There was low volume music in the background, comfy seating, and they also have high bar table seating for groups etc.
 
We sent some friends here and they absolutely loved it. We will definitely come back to try the rest.

We first heard of this restaurant when they had a booth at the UCSB Alumni event earlier this year. Their food was far and away the best of all the vendors. My son and his roommate loved the sliders.
Today I came down to take him shopping and we happened to be in the La Cumbre Mall and remember this restaurant was here. We came in for lunch and were not disappointed!
The ambiance is fun and comfortable, the service was outstanding and the food was even better then we remembered.
It may just look like a "burger" joint but the food was fresh and you could taste the quality of the ingredients.
My son wants to bring his roommates back and next time I come down, I am definitely trying one of the fun cocktails on the menu!

We dropped in today for a quick brunch before going to Philadelphia Woodworks in Manayunk. We were very happy with the extremely speedy service and fast food delivery. The warm atmosphere was inviting, although the table layout made for an interesting experience when trying to take off the coat or make the way back from the bathroom. 

This is an ideal location for some brunch meet ups, if on your way to some other spots in the area. Take the toe path if you're wanting something scenic, or walk down Main Street for some window shopping. Loved our heuvos rancheros and Mexican omelette.

The place can be easily missed, as it is a small unassuming place in a strip mall just off the traffic circle on 118 Ave.

The inside is small and cozy and was very busy on a Saturday night (always a good sign), but didn't take us long to get a table.  Another good sign is that it is very clean.

My friends have been talking about how this place had the best peanut beef sate pho and had to take me to it to try it.  Now I won't lie, I have never had peanut sate broth before so I had this picture of a thick paste type broth, not very appetizing.  

Glad I gave it a try as it wasn't like that at all.  Apparently this is their most popular dish ($12).  I do admit, the broth was very spicy and I loved it.  Maybe I've been spoil from my fave go to pho place, Co Do Hue, where you get ample meat in the pho, but I did find this lacking in that area.  If they added more beef to it, this would easily be one of my fave pho's due to the broth.

As for service, we were served by the owner and no complaints there.  Service was excellent, friendly and was always coming by to check on us (also had a nice sense of humour).  If there is a reason for me to come back to try it again, this would be the number 1 reason.  I did not get to try any other items on the menu, but would be willing to go back to try some other things to give this place a fair chance.

As Nashville continues its Los Angelesification, some things are inevitable.* Traffic will get worse. Home prices will increase. Ever more tourists will stop in to our friendly town in hopes of seeing famous people. More celebrity food/clothes shops will pop up. Sprinkles belongs to the last category (and sits next to another one). When Candace Nelson changed the cupcake world forever, she wasn't messing around. These cupcakes were huge, had interesting flavors, addictive icing, and managed to be gourmet, chic and accessible all at the same time. I don't know how she did it, but she did it. She created an empire.

I first discovered Sprinkles back when I lived in Chicago. When it popped up in the Gold Coast, I had some doubts but the first bite made me a believer. When it popped up in 12 South (again, great location scouting), I was thrilled to check out the opening and fill my belly with all sort of cupcake (and ice cream!) wonders. I was so so happy.

And then I developed a gluten issue.

For a fatty who loves cake, brownies and beer, this is definitely no bueno. There have been a lot of businesses I have had to say good-bye to in the time that's passed since my body revolted against Frankengrains. But of all the sacrifices, my dessert black hole hurt the most. The sweet cut is the deepest. But it came to pass that I had a guest in town and she wanted (needed!) to check out Sprinkles. Being the consummate host, I obliged but I was already jealous of the happiness she was about to experience while I had an air sundae. We walked in and were greeted by the typical cheery Sprinkles staff (kudos to whoever hires and trains). Off-handedly, I asked if there was anything available for someone gluten-free. I expected a 'oh, poor you' face, head tilt and a no. I received a 'yes.' Wait. What?? There was a gluten-free red velvet cupcake I could go to town on or I could avail myself of the chocolate chip cookies. Even better: I could get either (or, both) with ice cream.

Staahhhhpppp it. This changes everything. Sprinkles is back in play? Game on. I ordered a chocolate chip sandwich with peanut butter cup ice cream. What I received was a gargantuan hunk of sweet chocolatey goodness that may have changed my life. It absolutely raised my endorphins. The cookies were massive. Each cookie were much bigger than my hands and I can easily palm a basketball.** They were packed with chocolate chips, thick and had a chewy consistency that matched well with the ice cream. Not too hard. Not too soft. Just right. And the ice cream? Ridiculous. Between both cookies was a slab of creamy, rich, cup-laden peanut butter ice cream that stuck to the cookie and oozed out of the sides with every bite. To house the sandwich, it came in paper that had to be engineered by NASA. This paper never broke or wilted with the wetness of the ice cream. Nor did it leech cold on to my hand. The spoon I had to help each the sandwich came into its own once the cookies were gone and I could scoop out the leftover ice cream IN THE PAPER THAT HAD THE PROPERTIES OF A CUP. I'm telling you: NASA.

This gluten-free happiness changes everything. Everything. For those of you who can tolerate gluten without issue, you have no excuse. Sprinkles is your jam. Cupcakes, ice cream and cookies... what are you waiting for? 

*Can an increase in TV/film production be one of them?
**DM me.

My wife and I have been here a handful of times and have had a great experience every time. The staff is friendly and very helpful; we took my parents there a couple of weeks ago and they raved about it. We love the fact that they use a lot of local ingredients in their dishes. And my mom enjoyed it so much that we actually went their for breakfast within a week of her visit!

I, honestly, enjoy their dinner more than their breakfast.

For dinner- the burger is unbeatable along with the meatloaf.

Great little spot in St. Louis ! Hidden gem for sure! Get there soon and enjoy the ambiance and the food!

THEE. MOST. DELICIOUS. BEAUTIFUL. DONUTS. EVER.

Stumbled into Duck Donuts one day while visiting the area. All my friends kept thinking I was saying i wanted to go to "Dunkin" donuts except all I kept saying was "Duck" donuts. Yes, after passing by this place a few times I realized I needed to look it up. When I did I was sold. We went there right before leaving town and despite never having been here before it was a one of a kind experience.

The young staff that works here gives off such a nice vibe and is truly inviting. The donuts are made fresh at the moment and you have many options to choose from. They're so delicious and fresh!

Not only are they adorable cute, have the cutest logo, but they are soooooo yummy and flavorful. The size isn't way too big but all the flavor is where it's at. The perfect donut texture with enough moisture yet stays firm and doesn't fall apart. We tried different flavors and were not disappointed. 

Doggies get free donuts so that's a plus! Come give duck donuts some love!

This review was solely based on our experience during their happy hour. 

We made reservations for Luke's happy hour before our dinner for more seafood nearby -- and boy did we have a good time. Our table of five ordered three rounds of raw oysters (.75/ea), a round of fried oysters (1.25/ea), brussel sprouts, and a couple orders of their stuffed oysters and plenty of drinks. All of their drink were half off (excluding bottled wine).

Raw oysters = to die for, Fried oysters = so good (not even a fan of fried oysters), brussel sprouts = stole the show -- perfect blend of crispy salty brussel sprouts with sweet honey surprises and crunchy slivered almond bites, and the stuffed oysters = ugh, so good. 

Drinks: Definitely get their Gintilly Dragon and the French 75. Also if you love tequila like me, get it! it was amazing! 

Great food and drinks and great atmosphere.

Shout-out to my yelp friend Alexis M. for suggesting Bangkokville! My Thai cravings had been let down for the past few months and I needed a fix.

The Food: I order the classic pad Thai at level 4 spice. The food for some reason didn't look as awesome as it taste. The spice was right on and the sauce was kickin'! I was also happy that they had Prik Nam Pla. Love fish sauce and chilis. My beef was nice and tender as well. 

The Service: I always find myself sweating from spice and a Thai restaurant, with an empty cup of water. Here that was not an issues. I actually had to object more water at one point. Overall very attentive staff.

Why 4 stars? Because I enjoyed my first experience and would like to check them out again.

   ---   ---   ---

My wife and I visited #HPM on the first day that it was open and after much deliberation, Hemingway's was one of the vendors we decided to patronize. While I was eye-balling the El Ultimo, my wife peer pressured me into getting a Cuban sandwich. I've pressured her into ordering what I want to try, many times in the past, so I obliged. Plus, I'm never upset when "forced" to eat a Cuban sammy.

But then I got a little crazy and also ordered chicarones and the guava & cheese empanadas. Not to mention, yuca fries on the side with my Cuban. I don't have a lot of self-control.

Ultimately, it was probably a bit too much fried food for one sitting. If I could have gone back, I probably wouldn't have ordered the chicarones. They were a-okay, but probably not worth ordering again. My wife loved the dessert empanadas, while I thought they were pretty solid. 

I think we shared the same opinion on the Cuban sandwich that we did on the empanadas. She seemed to really love it, while I thought it pretty tasty. I like when all of the meat in the middle is at least warm, rather than the outside of the bread being toasted, with a colder center. Maybe that violates some kind of traditional Cuban laws, but I just enjoy a consistency in temperature. Don't get me wrong, I still enjoyed it though! And I actually really loved the yuca fries!

While I'm still working to make my way around to every HPM vendor, I really want to return to Hemingway's for that steak sandwich!

I've been here about 3 or 4 times and I've liked everything that I've had everytime. I really love their guacamole it's so fresh and delicious! The last time we were here I actually got the Guacamole as my meal and we also ordered the Taco Truck taco plate. The Taco Truck taco plate came with 3 delicious tacos, rice and black beans. The steak in the tacos was really well seasoned and I loved the little bit of Cotija cheese that they put on top. The only thing that I wasn't too crazy about were the black beans, they were just missing something. I was hoping that they would be really good but they lacked flavor. They could've used some onions, cilantro, garlic or pepper I don't know some kind of something in them but no biggie I just mixed in a little salsa in with them and it did the trick. The service is always on point and all of the employees are always really nice so I always end up here.

We are still waiting for our pictures to come back, but pending those, I couldn't wait to say how awesome Jump On The School Bus is.  We used the service for our wedding to transport guests from downtown Santa Barbara to Glen Annie Golf Club in Goleta.  Throughout the entire process, Darin and Sierra are just awesome people.  They are truly one of a kind and I wish I had words that adequately encompassed how sincere and rad they are.

They made planning fun and arranging the schedule with them was easy.  Darin and Sierra provided guidance where and when I needed it.  They also offered to pick up the wedding party separately from guests early - I can't say what a blessing that was to us.  On the day of our wedding, they had a text message chain with some of the wedding party to keep everyone posted.  Well organized and well orchestrated with so little stress involved.

The buses were fun, amped with music and lights, and clean.  Of all the wonderful things from our wedding weekend in Santa Barbara, we will always remember Jump On The School Bus as one of the best memories and investments.  If you are having any sort of event, I recommend getting to know Darin, Sierra, and their lovely chariot.

We made the biggest Valentine's faux pas which is, deciding last minute to go out for Valentine's Day. Luckily thanks to the Open Table app, we were able to secure a reservation Saturday night for a peak hour seating. The restaurant doesn't look like much from the outside as it is housed in a large, commercial style building, but the inside is fresh, brightly lit and minimally decorated. 
I award three stars for the experience, as service was friendly, accommodating, timely and food was executed to the best of their ability. Where I found it lacking, was taste and temperature, general atmosphere. Too picky?
We ordered the Blue Crab Dip with Parmesan Cream for our first course, second the Cream of Mushroom Soup and Complimentary Salad for the Special Entree, and Entrees were Eggplant Vincent and the Fish of the Day, Redfish, served whole with potatoes and vegetable of the day. 
The soup was served first, and was under seasoned and not very hot. Crab Dip came next and though gooey, bubbly and tasty, was slightly overshadowed by the pools of oil on top. 
The entrees were also good, my boyfriend loved the simplicity of his fish and it was cooked correctly. My Eggplant Vincent was  a cup of eggplant breaded and fried and stuffed with crab and shrimp, served over a butter cream sauce and angel hair. Again, slightly under seasoned, but over all a good, tasty dish.
Overall, not my pick for a romantic evening or food to write home about, but suitable for an affordable, seafood orientated craving.

We were here for the Predators playoff game against Dallas. Our seats were the second to last row up high and were still great seats. There are no bad seats in this arena. The live music between periods was awesome, and Smashville sure loves their team. It was so much fun!

I was lured by a friend to attend a singles mixer...had no idea it was in the private room in the back (behind double doors) and it was a speed dating event!  HAHA

I was late, happy hour ended at 6:30, I rushed to review the limited happy hour menu and was super happy to get a sangria and a carnitas taco and quesadilla pollo.

Luis, our server, was super nice, quick and attentive.  He brought me my sangria and it was lovely.  I ordered another later (just with less ice!).

My carnitas taco came and it was soooooo good......and the quesadilla was a lot larger than I thought it would be.  I think the food here, from the taste I had, was a perfect teaser for me to return because I enjoyed it all!

Besito also has an outdoor area, I think I would enjoy dining out there.... will return! Hopefully soon!

We hit Edley's this afternoon for lunch. I'm a BBQ lover and have tried pretty much every place in Nashville. I was hoping to get ribs, but they're not served at lunch so I went with a brisket plate with mac n' cheese and slaw. The brisket was a solid A, nice char on the outside (my sister let me have the coveted end-piece), with a smoky flavor and wasn't too dry. I also enjoyed the mac and vinegar-based slaw. We split an order of wings that everyone agreed on as top-notch. 

It's a cool place with plenty of tables, a bar, flat-screen tv's, and an outdoor patio for once the heat wave subsides.

Food was good. I had the chicken (not hot) and biscuit with a fried egg. I knew it was chicken thigh. I also know I don't like chicken thigh but I wanted to try it anyway. It's confirmed. I don't like chicken thigh, even if it's fried. But that's not their fault. The breading was so delicious. The sausage gravy was perfect. The biscuit was different than what I expected. It was lighter than your typical biscuit. Perfect layers. I love being able to peel away the layers of a biscuit.

The Donuts were tasty. My brother in law hyped them up so much but they just didn't quite live up to the hype for me. They weren't bad but they weren't so good that I felt compelled to have more than 1/2 of one. 

The coffee was very good. And the service was impeccable. Overall a good spot to visit for the tourists in town but I'm not sure I'd categorize as "the best" southern breakfast I've had.

I love everything about this non-profit. 1.) they're super organized (and professional-go figure); 2.) they offer training and skills that help women establish themselves in careers (financial planning, suits, resume review, personal shoppers to help select professional attire ranging from shoes and purses to jewelry and bras). They even have national partnerships with haircare products to send ladies home with all of the necessities. Their location on Meridian Street makes them easy to locate and parking alongside the building makes dropping off donations easy. Note: by appointment only. I highly recommend lending your skills and excess professional accessories/attire to this fantastic organization. Hoping I can find more time to contribute more to their work.

I have been coming to Sid Bookers late night shrimp corner for years. The shrimp here are usually pretty consistent. I think they are good because they do one thing and keep it simple. Since I've been coming here I have seen the price per Dozen rise. They are now at $21 per Dozen. The size is sometimes varies. The ladies at the counter move really quick and they are always nice. I love the fact that they are made to order and are hot when you get them. Plus, they are open late! Really late!

Reggie was awesome & friendly, served me a nice bubbly Rosè.  Two days ago, also had excellent service & food!  Sometimes tho, I've noticed the bartender slow & gone for a long time w/ no one in the restaurant, won't name him.  The hostess is a sweetheart also.  

The Rotisserie Chicken Salad Slider was delish!!  Very nice roasted chunks of chicken, fresh lettuce, tomato & the perfect amount of Dijon Truffle Dressing on a soft Brioche roll.  Nice olive, cocktail onion & cherry tomato garnish.

Patatas Bravas w/ Pickled Jalapeño were absolutely beautiful.  Firm colorful little tomatoes & jalapeños w/ a nice dressing.  A must side dish! 

Lamb Stew Au Gratin was very hearty & a perfect Irish Signature Dish.  Loved it & soak up the bread mmm!

Tasso Hushpuppies comes in four.  Sweet & savory w/ sweet corn, pimento, cheddah fried w/ honey cane syrup. 

My driver told me that Public Service was where you'd pay your electric bills a long time ago.  Every where here has history & I love that you can walk to so many places.  The sidewalks suck & need help like the potholes in the roads, but the food has been delicious so worth it.

Next time will try the Crab Cake Rex which looks like a Scotch Egg wrapped in crab on top of Avocado, Roasted red pepper & corn w/ aged balsamic & hollandaise.  

BEST IN NOLA FOR: 
All three & possibly the Crab Cake Rex since about four orders go out.

It doesn't get any better for breakfast in STL than this.

Even the normal drip coffee from their massing coffee selection is fantastic; I haven't found the need to get a hand-brewed cup.

The biscuits are out of this world; as such, I recommend the biscuits and gravy or the sausage biscuit sandwich.

My wife loves the oatmeal, so if that is your thing, it comes highly recommended.

If you get there early with a small group, just hop on to the bar and get your breakfast on!

I'm a breakfast lover.  Nothing beats a toasted bagel, buttered, with one scrambled egg and ham or sausage.  Manhattan Bagel gets it right every time.  They also have fresh squeezed orange juice (not from concentrate) which also gets a big thumbs up from me.  The service is always fast and friendly and the prices can't be beat.

Fresh off of dinner last night, I wanted to get this review out there, amidst all the positively unshakeable 5 star reviews. 

Listen, Suraya is GOOOOOOOOD. The food was delicious, we were absolutely full, and the staff is suspiciously nice. The restaurant itself is beautiful, both inside and out, and service was impeccable. So why not 5 stars? 

Well, first and foremost, it is EXPENSIVE. This is a common theme you have no doubt, or will no doubt read in other reviews, but I think it bears repeating. This place does not play around with the prices. And although the food IS good, it's also basically a bunch of dips. 

Oh, which also reminds me; another reason for the not 5 stars, is that you are FORCED to eat the $65 tasting menu on Fridays and Saturdays. You ALSO don't get to pick dessert, which was weird. It was like a big, kind of sweet, but not really sweet, mozzarella stick type dish. And listen, I love fried cheese as much as the next red blooded American, but it's not something I think of when it comes to dessert. It definitely left me a little perplexed, as I couldn't decide if I liked it or hated it, so I just stopped eating it all together. Looked nice though. *shoulder shrug emoji*

Back to the cost thing; a glass of wine is $12. That's what a bottle costs in the stores. A BOTTLE of wine is like $70, which is what a CASE of wine costs in stores. A CUP OF HOT TEA, was FOUR DOLLARS!! That's hot water and a tea bag. That's like a 2000% markup. I can buy TWO BOXES; about 200 tea bags, for $4. Don't misconstrue; the food IS awesome, which is the only reason I didn't flip a table on the way out, but for what was essentially 5 dips, some middle eastern fries (the batata harra, my hands down favorite dish!), 4 little kibbeh (too minty), a piece of roasted lamb, and some chicken thigh pieces, we dropped almost $200. They don't even refill your drink. You want another orange blossom iced tea, that'll be another $4 please.

Another thing that I didn't like was that the only reservation that was available for us was 4:30, but when we got there at 4:25, we were told that they "weren't quite ready yet," and we had to stand around and wait until about 4:40ish before we were sat. Not a BIG deal, but you'd think if your first reservation was 4:30, you wouldn't wait until 4:29 to get everything started. 

I don't want this review to come off negative though. Almost everything was done right, and they hit a lot of high notes too.

As I mentioned, the staff was perfect. Everyone was super nice, knowledgeable and helpful. They wore all PPE and took things seriously. I even really liked the ordering through QR code thing. I hope that sticks around after Covid!

Bottom line, I would absolutely come back to Suraya, or recommend it as a place to try, with the caveat that it's ONLY for "special occasions." Unless you just got it like that, and can afford to drop $250 every time you get a hankering for some baba ganoush.

Doesn't look like much when you walk up to the building but the workers are sweet and welcoming. Brisket was very moist and delicious inside of the Texas breakfast Sandwich, the bacon apple fitter was something amazing. I love it! Definitely glad I tried a staple spot in Philly.

Love the feel when I first walked in but the crew was slow to react or even acknowledge customers had walked in. Might I add being a first time customer, my impression was not good. I wanted to love this place and have my egg rolls too, I guess I'll be ordering takeout from now on. 

Soooo I wanted duck sauce and the bartender stated he never had it hmmm YOU ARE OF ASIAN DESCENT WORKING IN A RESTAURANT IN NEW ORLEANS MAN STOP ACTING STUPID. So I asked if he had anything to substitute it with and he said "I never had it so I would not know how it taste". Now I did not ask if he new what it taste like or if he had it. 

Now just being in an Asian inspired restaurant he should know off the top of his head an alternative or told me what sauce they had, maybe that's just my opinion? So again I had to ask if there is sauce for the egg rolls and he said yes.

Well got damn we have a winner cha ching. Can I have some of that please, goodness! I didn't even get any utensils, whatever though. The food was awesome but I felt racially profiled in here. 

New Orleans has a massive Asian community and I have always been pleasured with service and food that the culture has to offer. But there was something wrong about this place. Im not sure exactly what it was and the food was awesome. I just felt dirty leaving this place and will not return for personal gain due to negative vibes.
 
The food and the place deserve 3 maybe 4 stars depending on your love for this particular style of food, but the service was a complete bump down to a 2 star review. 

I do not expect the Vietnamese people to know what Chinese people eat or vice versa so please do not come for me in the comments or direct messages. New Orleans has a major Asian community and a lot of competition. The corner stores, bodegas, and restaurants are flying open left and right.  

In New Orleans you will find that most maybe 90% of Asian restaurants they all say Vietnamese and Chinese cuisine , that is common in New Orleans. I believe they know what their competitor is serving up, that includes prices, food quality, and sauces IMO.. 

Please do not feel offended by my review it is just my opinion. I have not categorize any resturant as something it does not say on their sign. I have not called a Vietnamese only restaurant a Chinese restaurant. I have not called a Chinese restaurant a Vietnamese restaurant unless the outside of the restaurant sign says both. I also find that the culture pratices are different in each state. It is different in Southern Louisiana than sunny Cali, so please keep that in mind. Again this is not to offend any culture as I am not an expert on either.

This place is great! I've enjoyed Fresco's food on several occasions. I like their chocolate chip cookies ! Super soft baked to perfection. Hands down the best Calzones in Tucson, I love that you have different size options. What I enjoy the most about Fresco's is that their is size for everything on the menu to your liking. So small medium large are all going to fit your needs whether it is with pasta salad or pizza! Over all the quality of the food here never disappoints and is always fresh, I enjoy the service that is always given. The employee's inside the establishment are always positive and provide you with excellent service! A insider is to get on their little rewards program, you will get emailed with coupons and great deals! :)

Strange donuts is one of those places I go more for my dog than for myself...

I could take it or leave it, but my dog means a lot to me... So four stars it is.

The maple bacon is one of my dog's favorite things ever... She knows it by appearance and will bark trying to get me to give it to her she adores it so much. Personally, I prefer Vincent Van Doughnut's version... But Strange's is cheaper and since my dog loves it, I go with it. You can't deprive a dog named Moscato, right? So on special doggie days (her birthday, the day I brought her home, the day we reunited after she got lost, etc) she gets one.

I personally only get excited about the Campfire donut. And even then I think it's more nostalgia related than taste related. I certainly don't bark/gruff or dance on my hind legs at the sight of it. We can't all have the joys in our lives that dogs do though... But seeing it in their eyes is nearly as good

Whoever said you couldn't have heaven melt in your mouth goodness!?  OMG
The coffee ice cream shake A MA ZING...
At first look I fell in love immediately...not only was it in a nice pretty glass, it had piles and piles of whip creamy goodness on top!

The food: typical diner food...if your drunk which I doubt you are when you come here since it closes at 3, but you get the idea.  It's basically like any diner food.

Back to the ice cream you must freaking order right now before you regret it!

LOVE the acres of land dedicated for dogs! If your little one doesn't do well off leash I wouldn't recommend this place this they will take off. 

They have plastic bags in case you forget to bring your own and there are water spots. Dogs of all sizes are welcome! Sophie loves going to the park.

Love the prices for movies here! I get to see the movies I wanted to see during their cinematic release but missed, for a super cheap price! Judging by how many people show up there,  I don't think that this place needs my endorsement, but it sure deserves it. We saw Cowboys and Aliens, loved the movie, thrilled that I got to see it on the big screen.

Just wish they'd ease up just a smidgen on concessions ($4 for a small soda....really??)

I LOVE Thai food. I mean LOVE LOVE. But this place is such a huge let down. I've come here about 3 times now hoping the food was just off the time I got their food. But no. Their food is either too sweet, too salty or too rich. Thai food should not be overly heavy; the herbs and ingredients should all sing together but it doesn't here. I think they have Americanized their food so much that it has lost its authentic touch. This last time I got their Pad See Ew... the sauce, was more like super heavy gravy. The noodles were mush and just sad. I want to cry because I usually say you can never go wrong with Thai food. The food is pricey here. I guess this place is still around only because of the busy location. I would suggest driving a little further and trying out Thip's Thai Cuisine.

After receiving some information about this restaurant from my other go-to, Thrillist, my boyfriend and a friend of ours decided to go here.  

We called about 2 hours before going, and were told that we did not need a reservation.  However, when we arrived, we were asked to wait so that the hostess could call a large party to see if they could come later (because of us).  I guess they were fine with it, because we ate!  Buuut if I were that other party I would have been a little confused.

Anyway, besides that small mix-up, I loved our meal and the staff.  We ordered a bunch of different appetizers, soup, rolls, and sashimi to share.  My favorite things were the seaweed salad, and the spicy salmon roll.  I'm sure the spicy tuna roll is great as well, considering it's the same ingredients except the change of fish.  The yellow tail sashimi was delicious, and I usually don't even like sashimi.  

Highly recommend this new joint!  Remember to BYOB.

Omg. This place is amazing. I was a huge fan of jen Carroll but had been disappointed in her post Too chef days.... until now. 
It always makes me feel a bit odd to go to a restaurant in the lobby of a hotel, but this isn't that. So first off the space is amazing. I may be in the minority here but I love how roomy everything is. There is an amazing amount of space between tables and so servers aren't trying to squeeze by, and I don't feel like I have to listen to anyone else's conversation. Win. 
Let's get to the food--it's Mediterranean inspired and done oh so well. I would go back for the baked cheese alone. Can this be my happy hour? A drink and baked cheese? I do wish it came with some bread as opposed to being 2$ extra. 
The octopus was cooked perfectly and while I loved everything else on the dish (squash, sauce, mushrooms)--I just wanted more octopus! 
The cauliflower was executed so well. 
But... my favorite part of my meal was the lamb shank. I am normally not a person who chooses lamb on the menu.... but this I would do a billion times over. It's perfectly cooked and fall off the bone. It gives zahav's a run for its money!

I'm super excited to have this restaurant to impress guests!

Definitely a mustEats! Best Shrimp & Grits & Crab Au Gratin I've ever had and I don't even like Shrimp or Grits! Delicious Brussels Sprouts, Corn/Crab Bisque & drinks had generous alcohol pour too. Atmosphere is nice, old southern, home some vibe. Ask for Chi Che to be your Server!‍ #hellohelloeats #eattheworld #foodporn #musteat #livetoeat #eatswithlovedones #withmybb#icjourneys #eatwithcin #flexitarian #ourchoice #NOLA

I wanted to go here as I had heard so much about it and I wanted some hardcore Cajun food.

However NO food is worth waiting 2.5 hours for in a crowded restaurant that has the bar space of a thumbnail. 

We ended up ordering our food to go and eating it at a nearby bar. 

We ordered the alligator shrimp cheesecake (surprisingly good), crabmeat stuffed shrimp (amazing), fried eggplant (also amazing) and I had the blackened catfish. The catfish was good but honestly I've had more flavorful blackened catfish in NYC. That said I loved the apps and the vibe was fun (at least during the brief time we were there). But the whole lack of reservations thing really put a damper on the whole experience.

Well..  this review is hard for me. It's like a beautiful marriage gone terribly wrong. I placed an order on the online app they advertise for you to use. I was given a time for pickup. I showed up about 15 minutes later than scheduled to give time to have it ready. 
 Here is were the cheesesteak place I have been patronizing for over a decade and I always promote them when people ask where to get a good sandwich from, showed me exactly how much they care about their customers. 

I walk in I'm not greeted. The lady at the register acted as if she didn't see me.. meanwhile her co worker continues to write on a note pad. When the lady at the register finally acknowledged me I say "good morning" and I tell her I have a pick up order. 
I give her the name she goes we didn't take your name. I explained the app takes the name. So after several exchanges of you don't have an order I show them the receipt. 

She still denies it but, the young lady working with her asked to look at my receipt. I show her. They will now begin to make my order, however they have to manually take the order. I give the younger lady my phone she wrote down the order. I do notify them I had a flight to catch and I put the order in early so I could head straight to the airport after I leave(as I always do).
I asked for it to be packed to travel.. they used to be really good at doing this. Trust I know, I take cheesesteaks home to Tennessee every-time I come to Philly.  This time They didn't bother. They barely wrapped them. The one piece of aluminum foil they wrapped around my sandwich unraveled. So now the cheesesteaks are all inside the bag they threw it. 
Wow Larry's this is what we are doing now...... 
I won't be returning. I don't care how much my father loves this place... 
Never an apology for the mishap. But, what could I expect when the lady at the register isn't even friendly.

Let's be real, who doesn't love cemeteries?!
Just me? Can't be! I'm a sucker for spooky places like this, and was determined to set foot inside its walls.

Itching to see the famous Voodoo Queen, Marie Laveau's tomb, marked with xxx's, and adorned with gifts brought by fans and admirers.
COME HERE!  (As she was a New Orleans hero - as she didn't practice "hoodoo", but good voodoo and helped to free lots of slaves! The most commonly left item left at her tomb - hair ties -which goes back to her days as a hair dresser.)

Interested in brushing up on your New Orleans history, learning of former plantation and slave days, and all about the archdiocese?
COME HERE! (Take a tour, which will fill your head with all the knowledge you need! Also stop by the visitor center, as it's filled to the brim with maps, pictures and artifacts!)

Wanting to feel like a VIP and have access not everyone has?
COME HERE! (The cemetery used to allow all visitors, but due to the amount of the vandalism, all visitors must be accompanied by a tour guide - unless you have family members inside the cemetery!)

Dying to see where Nicolas Cage will be buried?
COME HERE! (He purchased a plot of land for $250, featuring a HUGE white pyramid structure for his body to be laid to rest!)

Looking for a fun way to spend an afternoon and engross yourself with all things  tombs/cemeteries and voodoo.
COME HERE! (no really! people are dying to get in!) 

Let's face it, there is no better way to spend your afternoon!

Regrub is one of those places you really, really want to love. It's new, it's been trendy somewhere else (Calgary), it's colorful, its menu is full of funny names, and it's convenient to the Whyte Ave walking stretch of pavement.

I was excited to "drop a pin" into this nouveau burger experience, doubly so with a bit of the hangry. So the other half did the ordering while I soaked in the ambiançe: it's like the Teletubbies grew up to high school, got to plan a menu, decorate a space, pick a soundtrack and make social media accounts. Yeah, it's like that.

That part is all good. It's a fun, colorful space with happy, shiny staff. The fail parts are the execution of the food and the value-for-money propositions. Those could use a lot of tweaking.

She wanted the Lutter, a 4 oz Alberta Beef patty with bacon, egg, and cheddar surrounded by a bun of split glazed donuts. I liked the contrast of the sweet and savoury, whereas the 'bunny felt the donut didn't meet up to her Tim Horton'y expectations. (It tasted to me like a Krispy Kreme regular glazed donut, FYI.)

The Cheesy Jr., a 4 oz patty topped with mac n' cheese with bacon bits, arrived looking (seriously) like those Halloween caricatures of a pumpkin vomiting out its insides. Yes, there's pale creamy pasta with bits covering most of the serving tray... in a competition, this contestant would have been sent home. It's a presentation that screams "I'm so drunk I can't even bother looking for flatware. I'm using my hands and lots of paper towels." Still, it's the taste that counts (mostly) but this explosion wasn't rescued: it was under-salted and nowhere as cheesy as it *needed* to be.

My ultimate measure of a restaurant's worth to me comes down to whether it (1) delivers a food that I can't easily make at home along with (2) an experience that's memorable at (3) a rationalizable price. Regrub fails on the former; I can whip up dorm-quality meat patties & KD without any effort. The middle; okay, interesting location slash vibe slash space. The latter; meh. Everyone felt mugged.

The worst thing of all? This is *so* close to executing well. Krikey, taste the damn food on the way out of the kitchen! Tighten up food design and assembly; try to be impressing someone...

Oh, and your Instagram counter behind the till is broken. Even that narcissistic rush doesn't work. Meh.

OK so it's not much to look at on the outside or inside however the food is amazing.

They have Chicken and Ribs with Rice and Beans and salad. They do keep it simple but they DO IT RIGHT!
