There are a few small tables in the back with the groceries if you want to eat here but they are set up for carry out. My chicken and ribs was so good, flavorful and tender. I also got an Aqua Fresca hibiscus water. I love, love, love that stuff and the large is like a small JUG so I had plenty to share with my friend.

For about 12.00 I had an amazing lunch and enough to have it again the next day for lunch! They are now open 7 days a week and the staff is very nice. They do accept cash or credit here as well.

GO here if you love great BBQ grilled chicken and ribs!

Butcher & Bee is one of the best restaurants I've been to in Nashville. If you're a foodie and/or a hipster, forgo the meat and three and BBQ and meander over to East Nashville for a dining experience. Here's why I loved Butcher & Bee:

1) The food- It's a small plate concept with the majority of dishes being vegetable based (though they do have some meat options). My friend and I ordered four small plates and a dessert to share and we left content. A few stand outs: The whipped feta is their signature. It is good, but if you don't like feta to begin with, order something else. Avocado crispy rice- It's more salad with a whole avocado mixed in and crunch North Carolina rice. Butternut squash soup- Bold flavors with a pomegranate seed garnish. Meat balls- comes in a triad and has cheese and bread crumbs mixed in. The chocolate pot de creme with chili was good, but not sweet (In case you're obsessed with sugar like me).

2) The atmosphere- It's slick and the simple art around the restaurant is perfectly placed. We sat at the small table in front of their logo painted on the wall and several Instagrammers stopped by to snap a photo. Warning: The light is low so it doesn't make for the best photos.

3) The location- It's just off of Main Street in East Nashville within walking distance to other Nashville finds like Edley's BBQ and Family Wash. 

4) The service- It's the South so it was friendly, but not in a fake or annoying way.

If you want a good Nashville dining experience that's on the cutting edge of Nashville's food scene pivot, go to Butcher and Bee. Just don't Google it because you'll find it's NOT a local joint (It's from Charleston, South Carolina).

Great market they carry all my favorite things. 
I come here buy Mexican bread and a few other treats that I can't find at Walmart or Kroger. 
Love to come walk around the plaza as well

My go-to place for authentic Vietnamese food! Usually I eat in but this time I got carry out. I've been craving for some Banh mi so I ordered BBQ Banh mi. I love this toasted Vietnamese sandwich. It's full of flavor and they don't skimp on the meat either. When eating in I usually get the Special pho with all the tendons, tripe, flank meat, and meatball. The broth is perfect and requires little seasoning. The Spring Rolls with the peanut hoisin sauce is a great appetizer to start with. 


While the food is good and cheap the service is another thing. Expect to be greeted and waited on with an attitude. Also expect to pay with cash only. No cards!

An amazing hotel.

The best hotel courtyard in the French Quarter.

Fantastic breakfast included each morning (a very nice assortment of bacon, sausage, eggs, grits, pancakes, pastries, juices, coffee, etc and everything was delicious).

Great location near all the good stuff. The area is obviously busy and noisy but the hotel is quiet and tranquil (especially that courtyard).

A good cocktail bar (vouchers for a drink included with your stay) plus a great looking wine bar that I didn't get a chance to go to. That's TWO bars.

Good, friendly service.

Nice, clean rooms.

Those really cool gas lamps that I love.

Did I mention the courtyard?

Oh, Rocky's, how I once loved you.  Your delicious pizzas, your yummy salads, your interesting music choices.  But then you got sloppy; I would get a pizza with someone else's ingredients slopped over on one edge.  The service got...odd.

Then that whole Katrina thing happened, and you abbreviated your menu.  OK we all had to adjust but you never returned to your pre-K menu and you eliminated all my faves.  

Yes it is decent pizza but I go to Theo's or Reginelli's instead now.

I really like this place. I went in not really knowing what to expect, but it was awesome. I get the fried butterfly shrimp, which are great, and the fries are also seasoned super good. My family got the fish special and they were big portions and they all loved it. If you're looking for a casual place to have some quality fried seafood in Nashville, this is definitely it. Parking can be a pain in the five points area but it's not too bad. Extra bonus the sweet tea!

Whenever I pick up the City Paper I go right to the "I love you I hate you" section. This always entertains me to no end. Vulgar messages of lust and passion and then total disgust and extreme anger.  People venting their most primal urges- Gotta love it. They even published the one I wrote when somebody broke into my car- Yee ha!! 

Other than the love/hate column. I also enjoy the Bell Curve, and the Ice Pack as mentioned by Bill M. If you need to fuel your body with food or live music check here. You can find whatever floats your boat. There used to be an enteraining sex column Paper Doll, before that Ask Isadora. If I want to read crazy sex stories now I read Savage Love in the (Phila)Weekly.

I live 6 blocks away and pass this business daily, so when I saw a $10 off for new customers deal it lured me in! 

I'm sold. They do a nice job. Their prices are right in line w/competitors.

Pros:
-Parking right in front of entrance
-Friendly staff
-Use the Spot On app (loyalty program and earn free dry cleaning)

Cons:
-Traffic on Illinois can be a bit daunting. 
-They advertise free delivery but don't offer it in my neighborhood

Question: Whey don't any dry cleaners post their prices? I'd love to walk in and see them in the way nail salons post theirs?

I thought the food here was excellent. I had dinner and drinks here. The drinks are very good. 

I had the lemon hummus and the wild mushroom tart. The hummus was a bit too lemony for my taste, but my friend (who is an avid lemon eater) really liked it. So if you're a moderate lemon-lover, I'd try something else. The mushroom tart was very, very good. 

My favorite part was the dishware. The plates had sketches of apartment blue prints on them.

I came here for the first time for one of my Meet Up group gatherings. I like that they allow you to bring in outside food, if you want to. I had the seasonal cider - Sail Away, which is made with mango. It was so delicious. Everyone who ordered the flight said that they really loved it. I've been back once more with a friend, and had the Lil' Sunshine this time around. It was also very nice, but the Sail Away is my favorite.

On both occasions, the staff made us feel welcome and we were not rushed at all. I'll definitely be back soon.

I went here for the first time yesterday with my mother and I will say that it was amazing. The place from the outside doesn't look appealing, however, the inside is much better. It is not a fancy steakhouse but it is dark and clean and reminded me of a old time steakhouse which I loved. 

My mom and I both got the prime rib lunch special and it was AMAZING. It is an 8oz prime rib(which seemed much larger to me, more like 10 or 12oz). It also comes with a few mushrooms and a side. I got the prime rib medium and grilled which makes the fat much more charred and delicious. It was cooked perfectly and the flavor was amazing. It laid in a bed of Au jus and it was plenty, didn't need to ask for more which I usually do. There wasn't a whole lot of fat on the prime rib so it was trimmed nicely but still had plenty to eat multiple small bites with the meat which I love. They have the lunch specials Monday-Saturday until 3pm and this was the most expensive thing on the menu and cost $10.95 which is an awesome price. 

I got a baked potato which was $1.25 up charge and it was the best baked potato I've ever had. Very soft and cooked perfectly and a great size. I will probably upgrade for the baked potato every time. 

My mom and I also shared a bowl of French onion soup and it was wonderful. They put a bunch of cheese on it and boil it to such a perfection that when you bite into it there is a wonderful crunch. The flavor was amazing too. It was $6.50 for a small bowl which is expensive to me but so worth it!!

I asked for a drink menu when I first got there and the waitress told me they do not have a drink menu but told me they had a 2 for 1 wine special going on so me and my mom ordered two white zinfandels and they were a great size, more like 9oz instead of your usual 6oz. It was kind of expensive to me for a glass of wine at $9.95 but the sizes were great so it was worth it. 

I cannot wait to go back and will probably get the prime rib every time!
I love the kuchi for two deal!! Only $49! Ask for chef Andy he's funny and makes the best hibachi!
This location discontinued my Darphin face cream. I'm mad. I'm deducting 2 stars for it. But I must say that the restrooms on the second floor are quite lovely.  Clean and comfortable.

Great Chilli Dogs..I love DQ plain and simple. This is the only location I get to go regularly so I only wish they would make their great Hamburgers here as well, they are making Grilled Sandwiches now so that's a start.

You pay for what you get. I've lived at the Biltmore for a long time and it's been enjoyable. They promptly respond to maintenance requests (fixed my sink within 12 hours, fixed the breaker on the electricity in 2 hours, fixed miniblinds/windows in 3 days).  Neighbors are nice and keep to themselves.  The only thing is that in our building, packages don't get delivered (whether it's USPS, UPS) you have to pick them up which can be a pain. The bathroom is small, and the kitchen sink doesn't have a garbage disposal. All else is well-kept up, clean, and comfortable. I love it here: close to downtown, quiet, city-like. Neighborhood is more urban, but I have never felt unsafe.

While in town for a wedding, a group of us stopped here to have some drinks and hang out. They do both beer and wine flights so there was something for everyone in the group. I absolutely loved the strawberry blush wine, it was sweet with a light strawberry flavor. The guys had a few flights to sample all the beers then had a few pints. It was a beautiful day and the breeze through the brewery was enjoyable. If we are ever in the area then we will return!

One of the best pizza places I've been to - great thin crust and superb Chicago-style pizzas made with fresh ingredients and an interesting array of toppings and spices. I loved the Cherokee Street pizza with chorizo, goat cheese and spinach. I also enjoyed their Berkshire sausage pizza. It's hard to get a table on Friday and Saturday night so I'd suggest making reservations. But the food is truly worth the wait...

We really enjoyed Indy Tacos! It was a pleasant surprise! We go the steak and chicken tacos and their queso and salsa and loved every bite! You could tell they used good ingredients and were made fresh to order! The atmosphere at the restaurant is not great, so we ordered our food to go. The restaurant was out of their most famous tacos, mole, so we will come back another time to try those! If you like white queso you'll LOVE theirs! Decently priced and friendly staff!

Location: At the corner of Congress and Church Street
The Skinny: Great Location and very fresh food. Went on a Saturday as soon as they opened up and had the place to ourselves. The tortas were delicious, the burritos were delicious and loved the chips. 
The Restaurant: The restaurant is easy to find at the corner of Congress and Church Street. I was there with my family during the day so I didn't really get to drink but they look like they had a great beer scene. This looks like a place I'd love to hang out with the guys. The food was delicious and I loved their unlimited chips. 
What I did not like: The meat was nothing to write home about when it came to Carne Asada but it was good don't get me wrong. 
Should you go: Most definitely! I know that I will be going back to try some of their other items!
My Kids Review: We have to go back for the Quesadillas!

love that this is only 10 minutes from my house.  We try to go on a Sunday right before / after sunset, to avoid the long lines. They do offer a fast pass for an additional cost  ($15 I believe) but it's not really worth it, unless you are going right before Halloween. They also offer discount coupons locally or online.  Parking is usually $5.00. 

They offer a few attractions with your combo ticket, which is worth it. The hayride could be a little longer, but the scenes and actors are amazing. They have a few haunted houses/ walk thru's even a "Forrest" it's always a great time. 

I love that they offer snacks and drinks for sale, so you can sit and enjoy the live music and huge bonfire. They even offer a photo with a zombie and Valley of Fear as a backdrop. I usually think it's too much for one photo but we had a decent size group and I'm happy we got it!

Federal Donuts is like home to me.  The employees are always pleasant, and the donuts are ALWAYS delicious.  I love love love the strawberry lavender hot donuts.  Do yourself a favor and dip at least one bite in some coffee.  Their coffee is not to be overlooked, either.  I believe they brew Elixr, which is straight delicious and oh-so strong.  I look forward to more fancy donuts.  I just want them to bring back the delightful Lemon Meringue, but I guess not all good things can last forever.

Their chicken is a whole other animal, duh.  The sandwich is a classic.  I'm frequently tempted to snag one before work.  It's portable, hot and packed with flavor.  I have also tried the chili garlic chicken pieces, which I made two meals out of.  

I can't rave about this place anymore or I will start to look like a stalker-fan.  But I am one.

Cajun Chicken with Crisp Waffles

I've stopped in for breakfast several times and its always fantastic.  This visit I was staying at a hotel in Franklin and got very hungry after my run.  I was in my running clothes and I didn't want to sit in a restaurant.  Good news: Puckett's does to go orders.  You get the same great food but you miss the awesome live music.

I loved the spicy but not too spicy cajun chicken.  You won't need a gallon of tea to eat it.  It was the perfectly seasoned for me.  The crisp waffles that come with it were very yummy, so yummy I saved one for breakfast the next morning.  It wasn't as crisp but still good.

I'd walk a mile for their bagels and I just did! Been going there since the were on N 5th st. near Cheltenham Ave. A nice Sunday morning walk now to the new location( a bit tricky to find) across from the Elkins Park Train station. It's in the bottom of a house. Really tiny; more than three people and it's crowded.

As far as I know thet are the ONLY ones in the Philly area that make a REAL bagel.Chewy. crisp on outside, soft within. Be prepared for a jaw workout, It's a good thing though. They are the best. No two are identical.  You get to choose your own.They also have bialys and whole wheat varieties.Their breads are good too; especially the challah. Love the cinnamon buns, muffins and pies as well..

They are Kosher and close early on Fri. and all day Sat. I have tried lots of bagels and no place comes close to these. Not even the gourmet "Montreal style" @ Spread($2 for a bagel is too much. sorry).

Oh Kohl's how do I love thee?  Let me count the ways!

1. Your Kohl's $cash keeps me coming back for more things I never knew i needed.
2. Your return policy -- no receipt needed, is AWESOME for someone like me who loses that bit of paper the second i walk out the door.
3. Your never ending sales on everything! Great kids clothes, household goodies and pocketbooks are a constant draw!
4. Friendly service (shout-out to the cashier who recently went all out to help me buy makeup for a teenager)

I will see you VERY soon...a $70 Kohl's $Cash certificate is screaming to be spent from the pit of my purse as I write this!

What a killer place! We came here with a giftcard not sure what to expect and were just blown away. We had an excellent waiter who explained the craft cocktail set up (his exact words were "Don't expect to look at the bar and see any liquor you could find at a grocery store."). He provided consistently excellent service without being intrusive. The inside is decorated really nicely and creates a great vibe. It's 21+ at the door.

I asked for some advice on which drink to get, and after the waiter asked about my liquor preferences, I landed on a drink called "Let's Have a Tiki" or something like that. It wasn't your typical frou-frou rum drink, but it was pretty tasty (and strong). My husband's first drink was the Indiana English, which he got because it was made with Pimm's (and the only other similar drink we've ever had is the traditional Pimm's Cup). It also had whiskey, which he enjoyed. His second drink was the Eldermonk, which he liked but I loved. When (not if) we go back, that's the drink I'll get. I'm not sure how to describe it (minty? a little fruity? aromatic?), but it was one of the waiter's recommendations and it didn't disappoint. Our only food sampling was the onion rings, and they were fantastic. When they arrived at our table I was intrigued, since they had bordelaise sauce and a fried egg on top, but they were awesome. The order was a good size for two people, although I wouldn't say no to more!

When we got home my husband said, "So how often are we allowed to go back?" It's obviously pricey (about $10 per drink), but we felt that it was well worth it. We're looking forward to going back and taking friends and family. This is a great place to show off Indy!

Absolutely loved this market! We got the broiled combo which had half a lobster tail, scallops, shrimp, crab cake, and your choice of salmon or flounder. The seafood was all delicious (the crab cake was my favorite) and what made it even better was it was only $30! The salmon was very juicy and tender, the shrimp and scallops were great, and the lobster was meaty. The two of us also got the sashimi tacos, which were sooo good. I don't think you can go wrong with any of the dishes here, especially with such fresh seafood. We also bought a pound of shrimp to go to cook at home and they were very plump and flavorful.

The market itself is pretty cool with informative diagrams about how to order seafood and has all supplies/ingredients needed to make your own meal. The option to buy any fresh seafood in the store and have then cook if for an additional $4 is cool! We will definitely be back to try that and other items on the menu.

The location is close to the Broad Street Line as well as other restaurants and bars on Passyunk. Seating area is very casual and staff are all very friendly and helpful. Can't wait to try more seafood here!

Ordered this as takeout and I agree with what most reviewers have said so far, that Bareburger is a new kid in town and needs some time to work out the kinks. 

The good: An extensive burger menu with a lot of options for vegans, vegetarians, and meat lovers alike. I cannot remember the last time I saw goat on the menu at a non-Indian restaurant. There are also a lot of interesting options for cheeses and toppings, and the sauces also all sounded appealing. I enjoyed the brioche bun that I chose for my build-your-own turkey burger, the aged cheddar paired nicely with it, and I liked the leafy greens and wild mushrooms. 

Needs work: The one element that was lacking in flavor for me was the patty itself. The outside had a nice char on it, but the patty was overcooked making it kind of dry. The meat mixture also tasted like it had no seasonings whatsoever mixed in. Not sure if that's a deliberate decision, or something to consider working on. But with a patty sans flavor, sauce is a must. 

Also got an order of fries and rings, while the fries were mushy I can't really criticize them for this as I did get them as takeout, and also, I kind of like mushy fries. 

Would be willing to try this place again a few months from now.
ahhhh hello new favorite lunch truck - i love you.

Yum yum, give me some . . . more!  I'm already looking forward to going back to Han Dynasty!  I LOVED the Dan Dan noodles (I'm a carb freak - esp pasta and noodles!) - the sauce wasn't sweet or too spicy - just uniquely perfect!  It was a really nice sized portion for an app too!  

Our host gave us a great overview of the place and menu and welcomed any questions.  Our server, Alex, was super nice as well.  Both seemed to really believe in their food and restaurant whole hardheartedly, which fueled my appetite!    

We shared the 'three cup chicken,' which was good, but not crazy good like the noodles or the dumplings that we got for appetizers.  

Looking forward to going back :)

Seafood counter: 
The seafoods section is awesome! And the employees who work there knows everything I asked, because I eat salmon almost everyday, and I read it in the newspaper that some of the salmon from Atlantic is not healthy to eat, it triggers flamations in your body because the fish grew in a bad condition and is being feed a lot of drugs to keep them not to get sick in crowded farmed conditions. And some seafood from some places contain heavy metal. So naturally i'm worried so i asked that Asian lady who works there about this, and she told me everything I wanted to know, and she knows what cut you need for different dishes. 

Coffee bar:
Oh don't forget to grab an iced Chai latte on your way out at the coffee bar, omg it tastes so good although it is from a bottle......

Hot/Cold/and Salad bar:
The only thing I am not so happy about is that round 9:30PM they will take foods trays off the hot food bar, why!!!!! You still got 30 mins away from closing!  And also, I buy lunch and dinner almost everyday there, and you guys rarely change things around don't you? I'm getting sick and tired of most food you guys have in the hot food bar.  
And who thought it is a good idea to put a spoon for us to get noodles from the hot bar???? Give us clamps for the love of god! 
And the dressing bottles in the salad bar, i strongly recommend you guys change the bottles, because i feel awkward doing jerking motion for a good half minute during rush hour just to get some dressing in my salad, plus do you realize how hard it is to shake some of the dressing out of the bottle? Dressings like caesar is too sticky for us to get it out of the bottle.  Some the olive oil bottle is often too slippery to hold on to due to there is oil all over outside of the bottle. 
Also, if you guys can cut the kale a bit smaller into mouth-size that'll be nice, so i don't have to open my mouth to its limit just to put it in my mouth.  Another thing is that ice chips in the kale salad is not pleasant.

Can't believe it's been 6 years since I last reviewed! Always a favorite of mine when I'm looking for lunch - they've got an amazing selection of soup, salad, and sammies. The prom queen, tough love, and picnic basket are regulars in my rotation for salads - pretzel or whole grain still reign supreme for my bread choice. You can't pass up the treats! Cookies, brownies, and granola bites are all amazing ways to end your meal. A bit on the pricier side but portions are generous and ingredients are fresh and real!

I went here sometime last month with my husband before a movie and I can honestly say this has to be one of the best restaurants we've been to. The ambiance was nice and quiet with someone playing the piano and we both loved the kind of intimate feel this place gives off. The waitress gave us a complimentary pumpkin bisque soup which was AMAZING. So good, that I didn't even realize there was crab in it and I don't like seafood. It was definitely a little pricey but anywhere that makes good "Sex On The Beach" cocktails makes me want to go back. I strongly recommend giving this place a try!

We were in town visiting for a few days, when my husband saw an ad/poster for a show here. An acquaintance of his happened to be playing, so within a few hours we were here watching him! 

I had no idea what to expect because I had never been to a venue in Nashville. I was pleasantly surprised, though intimate and quaint, the rustic charm of brick walls, high ceilings, and windows all around with views of the city, made it anything but an ordinary boxed up venue. I have honestly never been to anything like it and was impressed.

Though I did not order a drink, the bar menu made it easy for ordering with every spirit and beer they offer listed on a chalkboard menu.

My favorite feature was the elevated sitting area to the side with bar stools and tables. 

Would love to see my favorite bands play here, as I prefer small venues.

Had a lovely, belated Valentine's Day dinner at The Love, where we particularly enjoyed the Purist Poke with salmon, rainbow radishes, olive oil, and Hawaiian salt (perfectly seasoned!) and the whole grain, cast-iron baked parker house rolls with chive butter (mm, chive butter)! The Cedar Smoked Whole Carolina Trout was perfectly smoked (head on!) and the Pork Chop was well-seasoned. Terrific overall decor and vibe. Would definitely return for a special occasion!

So excited to have this place on our side of the bay. I love their location in Saint Pete so I was very happy to see they were opening one on McDill. I had one sushi roll and it was really good. Sorry that I can't remember the name. They have happy hour from I think 5 to 7 and wines on tap! They're red wine they had on tap was delicious!  My only critique was that the temperature inside was uncomfortably cold. For this reason we requested to sit outside, there's no way we could have made it through dinner, and I am not someone who gets cold easily.

TL: DR - inside the exit corridor of home Depot. No frills, but surprisingly amazing food for a food stand. Few warm seating options in the winter, outside picnic table in the summer.

I can't believe I'm writing a review for a hot dog stand, but this place really is amazing. You have to be some kind of special to make a living on a hot dog stand. But this really is my go to place for a hot dog, I've been to Steve's hot dogs in Tower Grove and found their hot dogs almost too big and ended up having to eat them with a fork and knife like a casserole dish. First off, this place is inside the exit corridor of home depot. Dirty dogs has great combinations, ample toppings, and still allows me to eat my hot dog like a civilized human being eating a hot dog outside a Home Depot.

They have like 20 sauces (i.e., mustards, ketchups, and hot sauces) you can top your hot dog with, I really ever go for like the same 4, and sometimes you don't want any of the sauces cuz it'll mess with your existing toppings. Plus the sauces look a bit old. But what really makes this place is their super soft buns, o geez... Anyways, I've had the chilli dog (amazing), the jalapeno and cream cheese dog (surprisingly amazing), and the St Louis (provel and pizza sauce) dog (not surprisingly bad). The gf always gets the Chicago dog and loves it, craves it dare I say.

Few other things to note, if it's winter time (which today was), there's not always a warm place to eat. Sometimes they have a bench inside (today they did not). If it's warm enough though, they usually have a picnic table outside. 

Decor, it's home depot-y. Price, not bad, bout $3.50 for a regular grocery store Frank with all the fixins, and about $5 for a larger dog with all the fixins.

I found the winter event via Facebook last year, and was glad I did! This year was just as good, if not better, as I came a little more prepared. I was also happy to find out that there is a summer event, too! Glad I can purchase local goods all in one location twice a year. 

The building is a little confusing, and there are a lot of vendors (just under 60 according the website!), so I recommend giving yourself plenty of time to peruse. I parked on a side street both times, and wasn't too far from the venue, but I could see one might end up somewhat far if they came during peak time.

I arrived early enough this time to pick up a goodie bag, which included a couple of items from vendors (wearing the nail polish I received right now - thanks Different Dimensions!) as well as some coupons (didn't see these until I got home - check your bag before you shop!). I checked out the vendor list before I came to expedite things, since it can be a bit crowded. Worked out great - I had purchased a ring last year from Sloane Jewelry and lost it, so wanted to get another because I loved it. I didn't see my ring at her booth, but I asked just in case, and sure enough she had the ring I was looking for behind the booth! So if you don't see quite what you're looking for, check with the vendor. 

There are lots of great things to see and buy - make sure you make it to both the gym and the basement! Various artist's studios, as well.

such a sweet place! you'd never guess such charm and tastiness are tucked away in this mini mall, but once you're in yah mon, you know you're in for a truly wonderful experience. 

upon entering, you're greeted by the lovely couple behind the establishment, and it's clear from the start that they care deeply about food and its presentation. this is not a place where you rush through your meal. items are brought out slowly, fresh from the kitchen, where they were lovingly coaxed from various ingredients into a beautifully presented supper.

my curried tofu with veggies was stellar, and the portion was enormous, serving me well as a second lunch the next day. super flavorful, and the veggies were perfectly done-just crisp enough but without a raw crunch. my dining compadres enjoyed their fish and steaks, and the bread pudding and coconut cake two of them took to go were reportedly stupendous.

i unequivocally recommend yah mon for anyone's dining needs!

This is now my favorite Mexican restaurant around Indy. I tell them this every time I visit! The service is amazing and the food is great. I love their tamales and margaritas. The atmosphere is so welcoming and I love being served by the same people every time. This family is incredibly sweet! This style is more tex-mex, and it's delicious. I would recommend this to anyone who wants to have a fun and laid back evening.

I love this place. I adore it. It's like a toy store for my inner food snob. Stacks of produce that look picture perfect.. fresh whole fish on ice that remind me of the markets I love in coastal areas.. all sorts of beautiful meats of every description.. and a better cheese selection than I've seen at anywhere in Tennessee, period. In short, the fresh foods here look like food that would be used in photo ads or commercial shoots. Yes it's pricey, but that's just a function of carrying beautiful, fresh, organic, and often local food. 

What's REALLY awesome about this place is the little cafe back by the seafood section. A ton of people eat at Whole Foods by buying stuff at the hot bars and salad bar, and while those are quite tasty, the cafe in the back serves what could possibly be the best darn burger in Nashville. Local beef, local buns, even local goat cheese and local fried eggs as toppings if you wish. They don't have to bother with gimmicky burgers topped with crazy ingredients; just fresh, simple, local, and superb. If you enjoy a good burger, you owe it to yourself to try the ones here.

This is a very impressive new brewery. I tried 8 out of the 10 of their beers they had on tap. They have nice $2 sample sizes or larger sizes for those who want to enjoy a full glass. The owner was tending bar and was great with info about the place and their beers. It was not crowded at all but I can't imagine it staying that way once people know about how good the beer is. Very relaxed atmosphere with interesting artwork, chairs, and light fixtures.

While you probably didn't care about that stuff...the beer...I didn't have a bad one. Usually you'll find one you love, some that are average, and many you don't like. I wouldn't say I disliked any of them. They have a wide selection and several IPAs for the hop heads like me. German Chocolate Cupcake Stout was solid, as were their IPAs and Red Ale.

You might think parking is tricky but there is a large paved lot next to it and a dirt lot across the street. They always say don't park on Fern. They don't serve food but you can bring it with you or have it delivered there. Make sure you visit this brewery.

HH on Monday was great - $5 wines and great snack deals. Wish they included more cocktails on their HH list, but that's a minor point.Tried the chickpea & sesame chips with charred onion dip. Very interesting, kind of Indian inspired. Sesame chips were super spicy, which I loved! Great atmosphere, dark & warm & inviting. Remains one of our favorite happy hour spots!

Just visiting from Seattle, but my hubby's back was acting up. We found this place on Yelp. Nestled between other businesses, so don't drive too fast because you'll pass them and have to circle back. 

The place is nicely decorated...mini fountains, products to purchase, tasteful furniture. Their front door is amaaaazing. Love the style!! 

Prices were competitive. His massage was excellent. Deep tissue all the way! 

I would highly recommend this place. Too bad we live out of state.

Just moved to the area and a friend of mine luckily tried the place out first and recommended it. So, I set my appointment up online (which I love...I won't even consider a place if it does not have online booking) and scheduled a single color process and cut with Ryan. What a great experience! I brought along a couple of pics with me, told Ryan I wanted to go shorter and darker to celebrate fall, and he delivered with a super cute cut and a pretty darker, warmer color which was exactly what I asked for. I told him that I'm in a medical program and spend even less time doing my hair than I used to (which was always not long) so he gave me a cut that will look nice with my natural waves without requiring much effort. He even shared some styling tips with me. It was actually the shortest in duration hair experience I have ever had but I don't think that should be used as a marker for quality...it probably is just because he knew what he was doing. I was actually relieved that it did not take more than 2 hours! Also, I found the price quite reasonable (unlike others who have posted on here), but maybe that is because I just moved from an inner city area where prices are inflated. 

Great experience here and will definitely be back.

Even though I work right around the corner, I finally had the chance to check out the Good Oak Bar w/some friends. I feel like we lucked out because we got there around 830ish on a Friday night and were able to snag one of the big wooden booths. I had the old fashioned and it was pretty good. Like others have written about, the attention to the local Arizona detail is what really sets this place apart. If most nights also have around the amount of people tonight did, I think it also really hits the spot since it wasn't crowded and was just a lovely hang. Recommend!

I met a fellow Sporting Club member last night who informed me that she gets the most basic cable package so she can afford to go to the gym.  I told her I'd eat ramen noodles for lunch if I had to.  Last night I took a 75-minute Zumba class with a live bongo drummer.

I LOVE THIS PLACE.

My dog and date found a table outside, while I went in to order and grab some drinks. I ordered the Cobb salad with half an avocado, chicken, sprouts, veggie baco bits, and tomato with lemon herb dressing. Very crispy and refreshing lunch! My date ordered the tostada salad with chicken ranchero (marinated chicken in spicy sauce). The salad was packed with brown rice, black beans, guacamole, sour cream and all the veggies - equipped with a whole wheat tortilla underneath. I love that the salads came in wooden bowls, reminded me of my mom, she has the same bowls - so cool. We sat outside on a super windy day, but we had the pup so it wasn't that bad.

Decided to go check out Scotty's downtown last Saturday evening before a show at the Murat. My wife and I arrived around 5:30 and were told it would be an hour wait. Wow, no thank you. We checked out the bar and luckily were able to grab two seats next to each other as a couple was leaving. Not 10 minutes later, my phone buzzed letting us know that our table was ready....what? That was a quick hour. I'm not sure if they were just trying to turn people away because it was getting crowded, but we decided to stick it out at the bar.

Having had the burgers before, I thought I would try something different and got the BBQ grilled chicken wrap with a side of mac 'n cheese. My wife had the ultimate grilled cheese with tator tots. The food was good, nothing astounding. I think I will stick with the burgers next time though. The food came out quickly enough and the bartenders were very pleasant and attentive, even with an almost full bar. The price wasn't that bad for a downtown Indy restaurant/bar of this type. We each had one drink with our meals and ended up paying about $28 bucks. 

There was an NCAA game on at the time, so it was pretty loud with people cheering for their respective team. It was difficult to talk to my wife at times even though we were sitting right next to each other.

The outdoor area looked really cool with the fire pit and lounges all around. I am definitely interested in going back later in the year when it is warmer and checking it out. It was a little too cold to be outside when we were there (that didn't stop some people from playing corn hole though). If you are looking for a good place to hang out downtown and love hamburgers, I would check Scotty's out. I would definitely go back.

I love this place.  Trendy, upscale and delish.  Last night we started off the their clam special appetizer.  It had everything I love in life. Sea food, chorizo, curry, and garlic bread.  I can see why they said that people come back for that dish alone. for our main courses  i had the Chicken and Waffles and he had the foie gras burger.  The chicken was moist and tasty, however i did not care for the outer glaze.  the grits and waffles were also delish.  His burger was amazing and i kept stealing bites off his plate.  I love me some truffle fries so I had to tell the server to take those away from me or i'd eat them all.   This was our second time there, last time we had the rib eye and the catch of the day... no complaints with that meal either.  You know when I head out in that direction, i'll be at z grille.

This hotel was great! Great location for what we wanted, clean, courteous staff, comfy bed.

If you're looking for a hotel within walking distance of about 15 bars and even more restaurants then this is where you want to be.  The idea of the trip was to experience the real Nashville and not all the tourist traps.  What better way to experience Nashville and the people than drink?  Just take a left out of the parking lot, walk a couple blocks past the piano man, hang a right and you're where you want to be to drink & eat.  And it's an easy stumble back or cheap cab ride after several cocktails.

The one thing when I stay in a hotel that I rarely like are the showers. Some shower heads are clogged up with very little water pressure, the curtains are funky, and the towels are too small.  Not here at the Best Western!! The shower head was nice and big with plenty of water pressure and it was easy to get the perfect temperature.  The towels were hotel size but for some reason I was ok with them. Usually it takes me 2 to get dry, maybe I'm getting older and know how to use a towel now ;)

What's the first thing you do when you get in the room?.......Jump on the bed of course.  It was rock hard to jump on but then I started to sink in...MEMORY FOAM!!! I loved it, it was an amazing 3 night of sleep, but I'm sure the alcohol helped.  I didn't want to get out of bed in the mornings, it was just that comfortable.

Really the only down side was that the fitness center was a bit sparse, but if you're just looking to get some cardio in then they have 4 very nice machines.  If you lift weights like me it will be a bit of a challenge.

Next time I'm in Nashville I know where I'm staying!!

I Love festivals in Reno and who doesn't love beer and chicken wings. So I had some of the wings with the Alabama white sauce and I thought those were good which they were. Then I tried some from another place. And you think since I yelp often I would have remembered the name of the 2nd place or the sauce type but I didn't. But I do know that it was a spicy Korean sauce on plump chicken wings. They were messy and sweet and spicy and probably the best chicken wings I ever had. And I thought that nobody could beat the wings   from this spot in my hometown but they did. Good job on the chicken wings Un named wing place. Bad job on remembering on me. Other than that live music, chicken wings, beer, craft vendors, and good time with the family. Right outside the casinos so eat some chicken wings in the sun then head inside the casino in the air conditioning.

Fabulous selection. Eclectic and one-of-a-kind! Customer service was so inviting and here I was just walking through on my way to the coffee shop next door LOL 

So yup... I started holiday shopping a bit early as I stayed at the Holiday Inn hotel next door to this place and was on my way to have some tea or coffee on a winters day. Walked out with banging silver earrings and ring (mexican crafted - the good heavy silver) and also a cute heavy sweater for my Tiny bit Christmas gift. 

Jewelry, blankets, dresses, bags, purses everything speaks crafted with care. The 3 lovely shop owners that I encountered were so delightful and absolutely NO HELP WHAT-SO-EVER for convincing me to tread softly hahaha I ended up staying longer and speaking with them about shipping items if I needed them in the future. I had vowed not to purchase jewelry here again, I had been spoiled by Oaxaca jewelry, yet this place has changed my mind I eagerly anticipate buying from them come Little Bit's Birthday and Mother's Day.

Respectfully Reviewed

I hesitate to downgrade my review for this place because it's a decent bar with a lot of good beers and decent food but the service my last visit is a good reason to do so. The chipotle hummus was good, a nice spiced spread with pita chips, carrots and celery. I really enjoyed my blue gouda stout burger with the horseradish a cool, creamy spread with a bit of kick and I love the sauteed mushrooms and onions in it. 

Our server though was really slow and I swear there were times that she just out right ignored us. We waited on her to give us menus and then she walked away and it took time for her to come back for drink orders and she was about to walk away before she took our food order-she gave me enough time to figure out what I wanted. She went around the area twice before she even came back with our beers and the food did come out all at once but waited and waited for our check to come and get my cc and then return with my check-enough that I was concerned for a little bit that my identity was being stolen.

Might check out the other bars in Nashville before coming back.

Went here to listen to some bands and hang with friends.  What a great day, our waitress was fabulous and courteous, all the staff were that we spoke too.  The place was packed because they were having a benefit, wow to the entertainment.  My hubby and I didn't eat but our friends had nachos and devoured them lol so I'm going to say they were really good lol.  I definitely want to go back - only complaint I can even suggest is that mother nature released the love bugs which drove us nuts - we ordered beer by the buckets and they have to uncap them, which is fine except you have to use napkins to keep out the love lol.  Great job will definitely go again!

The coffee is excellent! I love the sweet little thing, the touch of bitters is perfection and it is shaken with ice to make it the perfect icy temperature without being watered down.  The atmosphere is industrial but warm and friendly. The only downside is the noise from the workout studio next door and it is a little pricy for speciality coffee. That said all the drinks are hand crafted with love!

Favorite acai spot! Friendly employees and a super cute atmosphere in the store! They are quick to make bowls and everything is always fresh! Love the order ahead option too. My personal go to is the manayunk vice but I've never had anything I didn't love!

5 STARS x 2! 10 STARS! And a HUGE KUDOS to Chef Lisa & her very friendly Army veteran brother Brian, the co-owners of this exceptional casual eatery that opened its doors in June 2020 in the midst of Covid restrictions. TRULY AMAZING fresh flavors & textures! 

Everything you'll eat here is prepared on site, & the blue crabs are flown in weekly. Prices are somewhat higher than you may find elsewhere, but I can pretty much guarantee you will NOT get the same level of flavor and quality elsewhere as you will here. 

I am almost beyond words; this restaurant SERIOUSLY SCREAMS QUALITY! The menu is jam-packed w/ so many delectable offerings-- seafood appetizers, entrees, soups, salads, sandwiches, along w/ wings & sides. There's even dessert on the menu (such as Banana Pudding & Pound Cake, providing you'll still have room in your belly).

After much time staring at the downloaded menu (& practically drooling over the many choices), we ordered the North Ave Crab Balls (4) @ $16. They were by far the BEST CRAB BALLS (or cakes) we've ever tasted! Unlike others, upon every bite we saw & tasted fresh crab-- very little breading. SEE THE PICS! Seriously, GREAT CRAB BALLS! Our Prince George Shrimp Tacos @ $15 were Very Good-- light & flavorful (see pic). Yummy. 

According to very friendly Niki, the following menu items are extremely POPULAR: North Ave Crab Balls (Yes, ma'am!); Crab Cakes; Blue Crab Seafood Pizza; Blue Crab Nachos; Catfish Sandwich; & the Salmon Philly Cheese sandwich. 

The soups sounded amazing, & we were privileged to taste samples of the daily Maryland Crab Soup & the Rockville Shrimp & Corn Chowder (available only on Saturdays). Both were EXCELLENT, although we both preferred the creamy & rich texture of the chowder. We shall have to return to order the Crab & Corn (Fridays only) & the Cream of Crab (available only on Sundays). Niki also brought us a basket of warm, fresh Blue Crab Chips to try. A simple, yet wonderful, $4 appetizer -- SEE PIC! 

Not into seafood? There are wings on the menu in quantities of five ($7), ten ($12); fifteen ($18) & twenty ($22). 

Additional items that piqued my interest & not previously mentioned: Fish Tacos; Grilled Salmon; Crab Cake Sandwich; Soft Shelled Crab Sandwich; Blue Crab Shack Salad; Fried Shrimp & Fried Fish dinners; Shrimp Quesidias; Shrimp Po Boy (regular or spicy); Shrimp & Grits (Sunday only); & Fish & Grits (also Sunday only). I'm quite sure I omitted others that sounded & looked INCREDIBLE. (Download the menu to enjoy the vivid menu pics!) You, too, may experience great difficulty deciding what to order.

Interested in taking Blue Crabs home? WEEKLY, Brian & Lisa have 200 to 400 lbs flown in from the Chesapeake area. Customers must pre-order & pay for their Crab on Monday, Tuesday, or Wednesday to receive them Thursday thru Sunday.

Have you checked out this business's webpage? It's bright, organized, & easily navigated. Patrons may order online for easy pick-up. Catering is available. This seafood restaurant participates in fundraising; Brian & Lisa select one organization monthly to receive 15% of all net sales; use the online form to have your organization considered. 

Due to the small, sparse, very casual dining room (see pics), this restaurant may not be where some would want to take a love interest on a first date; however, if s/he were wanting to impress a guest by feeding him or her SUPERIOR seafood cuisine, this is the place to come-- hands down MY FAVORITE SEAFOOD EATERY IN MY FIVE YEARS ON YELP! 

Chef Niki may not be professionally trained, but this woman can run circles around the Best of the Best! 

I have driven up to Nashville 3x over the past nine months. I shall drive up again-- & EACH AND EVERY TIME I will stop in to try more of Lisa's remarkable creations. Born & bred in Maryland, but here via Atlanta, she is Madison, Tennessee's (& our) win!

First time trying a poke bowl, I have always wanted to try one! I got the traditional tuna poke bowl and my husband got the large mixed tuna and crab poke bowl. We loved them! The only thing I would recommend next time is asking for it to be less salty, if that is possible! Besides that I was pleased with everything. I also LOVED their red velvet cookies that Andrew makes. 

Our friends got a side of the kimchi, chips and salsa, beans and rice and added the famous "table sauce" to their entree and they couldn't stop raving about it. The owner also gave my friend a side of the spicy carrots on his way out, very sweet of him!

Also, I like that you can draw on the tables with chalk, haha, sometimes it's nice to be a kid again! 

The highlight of the evening was the owner Andrew, such a cool guy! One of the main reasons we will be coming back. It's always nice to see when someone goes out of their way for their customers, you can tell he is a genuine dude and that he really cares about his customers and has passion for his company. 

Next time you walk past this place on Twiggs, stop in, check them out, and give Andrew a shout!
Fell in love with the breakfast here their pancakes is really mouth watering it melts in your mount, I took some home to reheat later on and it was still as fresh and when it was served to me.

Always an amazing time, we are here at least once a week, usually for Sunday funday! Love their sparkling Rosé. This time I went for the moscato and cupcake flight! So delicious. Street parking is tough around these parts, best to just catch a cab/lyft/uber or walk! 
Food trucks nearby are always a hit, this is prime location to so many amazing things!

Happened into this place when I tried to grab breakfast at Satsumas, and found myself uninterested by the long line and packed dining room. Just not what I was looking for this morning. I wandered down the street and was drawn in by the sandwich-board sign that they had on the street. 

There were only a few other people in there eating breakfast. I had the huevos and a few ($2.50, by the way...) mimosas and a cup of coffee. My food was delicious, the fluffiest eggs ever! The mimosa was alright, nothing of course to rave about, and the coffee was crappy. Eh, I wasn't expecting spectacular. I was a little disappointed by the service- two servers working 4 tables, and they spent allll of their time looking up TV's on and IPhone with an obvious regular. We all love regulars, but give everyone else a little attention!

Oh well, regardless. Good food, decent experience. May give try it again next time I find myself in the ball park.

Ughhhh... I'm going to sound like President Obama when he talks about the economy here for just a moment: 

Look, the fact that City Dogs exists and is in place for future considerations is something we're pleased to see, but there are many avenues that need to be discussed before any further elated ventures. 

It's true. I'm on the fence here -- big time. I love this place. I love that it exists. I love that they opened a location basically in our neighborhood -- East End of Mass Ave -- and they serve as downtown's only choice for organic, healthy full-supply pet food. I love the owners. I love the food they have. I love the toys, the treats, the conversations, the knowledge, the location, the service, the food options, the openness to give out samples to see what our dog likes. So what is it?

The Hours. 

I had no idea this is what 'the hours' meant when Virgina Woolf writes to Leonard -- her husband -- "To look life in the face. Always to look life in the face. And to know it for what it is. At last to know it is. To love it for what it is. And then to put it away. Leonard always the years between us, always the years. Always the love. Always the hours." 

Yeah, I'm the yelper that quotes Virginia Woolf. 

Hopefully I'll also quote Virginia Woof who says, "please extend the hours of City Dogs as closing so early and opening so late leaves dog owners high and dry when in need -- especially in a pinch. Maybe just one day a week where they can rely upon the longer hours to accomplish all tasks. I mean, hey, maybe it'll create a Friday frenzy of pet owners who come to your store to hang out, purchase and party. First Fridays, even?"

This place has he most gorgeous views! You don't often come across tasting rooms (literally) on the ocean! We came during peak time but found seating pretty easily. The staff is also friendly and knowledgeable but
I took off one star because the wine is pretty average- however, there are a few I really love. They make a tasty Syrah and Sav Blanc!
This place is great if you're trying to get away from the hustle and bustle of the funk zone where most of Santa Barbara's wine tasting is. It's super relaxing and you get to enjoy the view and ocean breeze!

Very much enjoyed a business lunch at The Love. The hush puppies and biscuits with their respective spreads were especially tasty, and, after consulting with our server, I was very happy with the burger, which was served a perfect medium on a potato bun that stayed together even though the burger was juicy and included a "special sauce" (aioli). The kale risotto looked terrific, too. Would definitely return for lunch!

I love the atmosphere here and the food is really good.  My all time fav is their pumpkin pancakes but those are only offered during the fall.  My boyfriend gets what ever the waiter likes the most because we know that everything they serve is great.  I love that they have a ton of vegetarian stuff on the menu and you never really have to wait that long.  Its quick easy and good food.  I like going time and time again.  Get the pumpkin pancakes if you are there in the fall!

Mexican food in Indy that impresses FOUR women from Los Angeles?!?!  Yup, truth!

This review is past due but much deserved to Adam and the crew at Livery for impeccable service, WONDERFUL food, and FANTASTIC tequila and mescal drinks.

Adam knows the menu!  Trust him.  He'll take care of you and pamper your whole group like your family (family he likes, that is!).  He even gave a tiny sample of dolce de leche sauce to go because I felt in love with it.  I took it back to my hotel and rubbed it on my naked body -- it was THAT good.  

Try sitting up on the patio outside upstairs.  Nice weather and an arts-district soho noho vibe.  

Beautiful decor.

Extensive menu but I'll highlight several things...

You must try the cauliflower starter.  Oh my!  A total hit with the table.  And the cheese empanadas were divine!  

For entrees --
My colleagues and I also loved the Mahi mahi tacos and skirt steak but by far the winner for dinner entrees was the Portobello Tostada.  I am noooooo where near a vegetarian, but this thing was BURSTing with flavor and a hit with everyone.

For dessert--
Get the same platter.
Beautiful chocolate flan.
Yummy tres leches cake.
And for 4 women from So Cal --- unanimous vote for best churros ever!  It was a surprise to all of us.  The dulce de leche sauce was lick-the-plate fantastic!  

Also try their version of The Cadillac Margarita - boozie and yummy!

So surprised to have such a great dining experience in the middle of Indy, but we loved it and highly recommend it to locals and travelers alike!

Non appetite!

We had another restaurant in mind on Frenchmen St. After a so-so vibe at the place we were considering -- I honestly don't remember its name -- we bailed and went with a recommendation from the bartender (bah-tenduh) at Hermes Bar at Antoine's.

The place was pretty low-maintenance with a lot of cool-looking servers in hats. It seemed like a mix of tourists and locals.

Since we never got the hang of ordering properly -- us Californians are used to smaller portions -- we asked for an ungodly amount of food. An enormous basket of fried okra, fried chicken, mustard greens, collared greens, mashed potatoes, and cornbread. Though the fried okra was pretty good (also seems hard to mess this up), and the sides were fantastic, the fried chicken stood out for me. That batter is insane. We didn't talk the whole way through the meal: a sign of a good one! Pralines to go made my day later on.

I'd love to spend more time on Frenchmen St. -- for food, music, and bars -- next time we're in town. Nicely out of the way from Bourbon Street madness.

Not totally authentic, but a slightly upscale place to have some drinks and enjoy Mexican food.

What we got:
Queso fundido - cheesy stringy, less "dippy," comes with tortillas instead of chips
Carne asada steak tacos - meh
Al pastor tacos - tasty, loved the pineapple mixed in
Elotes - good! Grilled nicely and sweet. A lighter  version than the street vendors, any less mayo.
Ceviche del dia -market price, for ours good amount of shrimp, was worth the $13

Their happy hour includes $5 margaritas , regular or frozen, and sangria. Good deal as great tasting and ratio of alcohol to other fillers. 

Bottom line: great place to chill and get decent Mexican food
I came back a few more times and my experience has been much better.  I also love the air purification system that takes most of the smoke out of the air.

For the seven year anniversary of when we met, we decided to try somewhere we hadn't yet. 
When I need to find a new place to try I look on Yelp. The pictures, menu and reviews for M3 reeled me in...but the reason we chose M3 was for their Stroganoff. My husband LOVES stroganoff and I hardly make it at home. You should've seen the look of excitement he got when I mentioned it! And that was that. 
The entrance is clearly stated in previous reviews and someone we still managed to get a little lost looking! Inside is warm woods and deep booths. The dining room was separate from the bar which makes it a bit more private. The two TVs add a pub feel. 
First I ordered a Moscow mule, and while it wasn't bad it wasn't special like some I've had...the menu is simple yet inspired. The Grilled Artichokes and the Brie cheese skillet caught our eyes. The artichoke was tender and flavorful grilled and the curry mango Brie bruschetta skillet was decadent and delicious!! My husbands not a big fan of Brie so I got ...all... of it HA! 
Next I ordered the creamy mushroom soup. The soup was earthy, and super creamy with huge slices of fresh mushrooms. Everything you would want in a creamy mushroom soup, it was the best! Finally my hubby got his stroganoff and I got the lamb. He says the meat in the stroganoff was very tender and the whole dish was perfect. 
The lamb was perfectly cooked with a sweet yet tangy fig balsamic reduction. Out of this world. And the Marscapone polenta was very creamy (The consistency of mashed potatoes) and very very good. Finally the veggies were fresh, crisp and garlicky. A perfect addiction. 
By the end I was stuffed to perfection! The waiter was on top of things, perfectly timing our entrees to come out right after our appetizer. He was great, and so was his bus boy, who was definitely on top of dirty dishes. 
Five stars. We will definitely be coming back!

The office went again, sans the vegetarian. We all got the strip steak . . . lucious steak, a little fatty on the outer rims, but isn't that what gives it flavor? The outside grill crustiness was divine, and the steaks were all done beautifully medium rare!!

Salads were great . . .various dressings: creamy Italian, bleu cheese and the Biggie's White French (similar to Thousand Island).

Sides: baked potato with sour cream was a massive missile of carbs, which he loved; I got lots of broccoli perfectly cooked, can't remember the other diner's side.

I got a to-go vessel of the fried chicken dinner: $10 for half a chicken, and I got two sides instead of a side and a salad -- at the recommendation of our server. Evidently, Thursday and Sunday are fried chicken days! And I had that lovely specimen for dinner!!! Sadly, though, it was underseasoned . . . so, while crunchy and juicy, it was rather bland.

Beyond that, I had a wonderful to-go vessel of half of my broccoli and more than half of my steak for another day! That salad was filling. Not to mention the bread!

And I must mention that everybody is so nice here! Greeting you! Happy you're there! Fabulous service! Saying goodbye and come again! It's nice to know your patronage is appreciated!

Fancy! 

Surreal murals, chandeliers, all the great tacky wonderful stuff that casinos are made of. 

Many people will love this place and call it a five star! Hot hot hot tub, pool, lots of restaurants, clean clean clean, sparkly, great service, fancy spa, massages, etc. 

Just, a bit expensive IMO, and I HATE the expensive snacks left out on the counter to temp you. I prefer a more beat down casino hotel!

We got the Total Eclipse pizza off the not so much secret "secret" menu. 
It's supposedly all their toppings minus anchovies. 
We also asked for no onions.
Super good! Love that the veggies were still somewhat fresh, like they didn't put them on the whole bake. 
The crust is good too!
Adorable spot if you want to enjoy your pizza there, outside.

My girlfriend takes our yorkie here regularly. I've never actually gone myself, but chewie always comes back extremely soft and smelling great for at least a whole week (this is a big deal cuz she smells funky almost all the time). But this last time she came back looking cuter than ever, so I just wanted to say thank you to Michelle who was the groomer. I feel like I've fallen in love with the dog all over again!

Located in O'fallon. It is a cute location with ample space inside. We ordered the special which was Lg pizza, large salad, and breadsticks for $24.95. Thought it was a great deal for the amount of food. We had a large group so we also tried half alfredo/buffalo chicken pizza (bonus points for allowing half and half). We aren't used to the sweet sauce, so if you don't like it, I would prefer asking for original sauce. I did not care for the sauce, but a couple of my friends loved it. I did however really like the specialty pizza. So I would go out on a limb and try something different, if you enjoy the tradition style flavor pizza. Service was good. They got really busy but were still attentive.

I found the place with the gold triangle
..came in to good mix of 90s music. Nice rustic speakeasy vibe with a twist. Went to the bar to chill. Convo with a couple of regulars and they introduced me to the bartender Will. Will was kick ass! He made me a Paper Plane at 1st and then I told him to make me whatever he wanted with Bourbon. He made me a different version of an Old Fashioned. Conversation was chill with the staff and patrons at the bar. He was efficient and held good convo. I can tell he knows his thing. I will be back at the least to see him. Much love!

LGBTQ friendly

I was actually a bit disappointed to find out later that The Habit is a franchise restaurant.  I was led to this restaurant because my bf had worked out our travel itinerary for Santa Barbara and a yelper had described this place as having the best burger in SB.  Really now?

My bf got the Teriyaki Charburger.  He said it was good and it surely did look good.  But he said the teriyaki sauce was a bit overpowering and he wasn't able to taste the burger itself.

I got the Veggie Burger sandwich, as I am a vegetarian.  I got it on grilled sourdough with cheese.  It was average.  The patty was just a regular Gardenburger patty they probably took out of the freezer.  

What I did love was the onion rings.  Amazing onion rings!  Seriously, what kind of batter did they use?  My bf felt like it tastes like the same batter used for crunchy fried shrimp.  The onions were cooked perfectly so that when you bite into the ring, you actually bite off the onion cleanly without dragging any of it out of the breading.  Perfectly crunchy with flavor... mmMMmm!

This location made it look like a hole-in-the-wall place, with it's outdoor seatin and order-at-the-window and pick-up-at-the-window style service.  Convenient parking lot in back.

My husband and I visited Steak 33 and had a remarkable time. My husband really likes steaks, so I thought this would be the perfect place for our date night. First things first,we selected and enjoyed the sparkling wine. For appetizers, we chose the Jumbo Lump Crab Cake and Baked Oysters. Both were delicious, but I really enjoyed the crab cake. Remember, MAMA LOUISIANA!!! My husband got the Filet Steak. He was highly impressed with the quality. He says it was one of the best steaks in the city. I chose the poultry, which was the Daily Fish. I have photos below of the (seasoned to perfection) fish. I love, love, love the sauce on the fish. For sides, we got potatoes au grautins and creamed spinach. Even though I am a foodie, I still like to incorporate veggies when I can. The Au Gratin menu at Steak 33 is pretty extensive. You can get anything Au Gratin from Spinach, Cauliflower, Potatoes, Peas, Crabmeat, Lobster and Broccoli. We topped off our date night with a Rum Rasin bread pudding. That was just the 'creme De La creme'.  Magnificent!! 
​
The restaurant is located on Bourbon Street. Perfect for getting out there then grabbing a good dinner to soak up all of the drinks! The waiters were extremely helpful and accommodating to us. We will be back for the Fried Chicken Brunch in September.

Sooo glad I made it to Milk and Honey during my trip to Nashville. The food really is worth the hype, so don't let the wait deter you. They don't take reservations, but I got there around 10:30 AM on a Monday and only had to wait for a half hour (party of 2). Plus, you don't have to wait outside like you do at Biscuit Love! 

I started with the Lavender Honey Latte and all I can say is WOW. It was delicious and just the right amount of sweet. We also ordered the Prosciutto, Egg & Smoked Mozz sandwich on the biscuit and the Roasted Mushroom Omelet. The biscuit was probably the best I've had. Seriously good and I've never had a sandwich like it. The omelet was great too and was a very generous portion. Make sure you try the breakfast potatoes too, I couldn't get enough of them.

This was the only Thai place on EatGrubGo.com for delivery.  My office (10 people total) were all looking forward to Thai food!  However, most of us were more than a little disappointed.  I ordered the Crab Rangoon and the Curry Noodle. The Crab Rangoon had very little stuffing in it and was essentially tasteless.  Most restaurants have a 1/2 to 1/2 ratio of wanton to stuffing, this didn't even come close. The Curry Noodle dish would have been decent, however, the noodles were terribly overcooked. I absolutely love rice noodle dishes, but these were so limp and tasteless I ended up throwing away most of the meal.  No one in my office would recommend Rearn Thai.

Stopped in here while I was early to an event next door. Loved the Barrio Blonde straight from the tab, ice cold and smooth. Waitress was super busy and a little forgetful, she passed back by us twice before remembering to drop off our menus. Will be back for sure when we have more time and the weather is warmer for an outside sitting experience. Great looking building and love that they have revitalized this area down here. Keel up the great work.

This place is terrific!  I love sipping a good cup of coffee while reading, or chatting with friends or family.  I love doing this in Ybor and I am adding  the Blind Tiger to my rotation.  The staff is pleasant, accommodating, and seem genuinely happy that you are there.  The menu has a great selection of coffee to choose from.  I had a scoop of vanilla ice cream doused on 2 shots of espresso.  I've never had it, but I will have it again.  Yum!

The place is set up as a good coffee shop should be, with random type seating and trendy decorations.  There aren't a lot of seats which is the only drawback of the Blind Tiger.  Easy 5 stars here!  Give it a try.

I don't know how I haven't reviewed Buddy Brew before!

Their COLD BREW is one of my favorites in the state. Super smooth and flavorful. I've unfortunately never tried the food - but every time I see it being brought out I wish I was hungry. I imagine it's a pretty great lunch stop from the looks of it.

The ATMOSPHERE at this location is great. There is tons of seating and it's super trendy inside. Good for groups, for working, or just stopping in to have a coffee with friends. There are comfy couches and a big table / work space.

The SERVICE: the people aren't overly friendly but they're not the coffee snobs you'll find at a lot of other great places around the nation. I imagine I haven't had the chance to talk to the people behind the counter much because they're always super busy.

If you've never had Buddy Brew coffee and you like cold brew I'd definitely recommend stopping it to try! It's delicious and really well done. And who doesn't love a great local coffee shop?!

My daughter had a blast here! She is only 16 months old, but she loved running around and playing and the snacks and seeing all the kids. My husband took her the first time and she was wearing her slippers with no socks so when he discovered she would have to take off her shoes, she didn't have any socks. Well they had it covered! They had socks for her to wear which was great. Then they had lots of awesome free snacks for her to enjoy too. They arrived about 9am which was perfect. Around 10 it started to get really busy. They only let so many people in at a time so then a line forms and as people leave they let others in. We will definitely be back! Such a great place to burn off some steam indoors when it's cold out!

If you don't know by now, Tzin Wine and Tapas on 104 St in downtown Edmonton is one of my absolute favorite restaurants. Of all time. Not only is the food always delicious, the staff there are the definition of hospitality. There was a time when Joe and I went nearly every month and with us trying to eat out less and new restaurants opening all the time, Tzin slowly became a once in a while treat. We were able to visit earlier this month, and although it has taken me this long to write about it, the food still makes me drool just thinking about it.

The menu gets updated almost every couple of months, but hopefully this is still available. The grilled chorizo sausage is housemade with Irving Farm pork, with my first taste of it in the hot pot alongside tomatoes and gnocchi when I first started writing. It was nice to see it featured on its own, with simple sides of smoked garlic aioli, jalapeno jelly, and a violet mustard. A "deconstructed hotdog", in Chef McGuire's words. My favorite topping was the jalapeno jelly, and although similar in concept to Dadeo's infamous green jelly, definitely packing more heat and not as sweet. Tzin needs to start selling these in the alleyway, honestly.

Second to arrive was the baked brie with red wine reduction, a dish that has been on the menu since I've started dining here. With good reason too because it's one of my favorites. Although the dish has evolved in presentation in the past visits, it's still oozing creamy goodness. I much preferred the apple and Saskatoon berry compote on the side though! I like my cheese pure!

New on the menu for the month was a braised duck leg. It was super moist and beautifully done. The roasted and smoked potato puree stood out though and alongside the lentils, it was a solid accompaniment to the duck.

Three dishes is our usual and we always save room for dessert. That night featured panna cotta stuffed poached pear and a chocolate mousse tart. I really couldn't decide between the two. I'm a chocolate lover, no doubts about that, but a refreshing, palate cleanser like a sorbet or lemon tart will always win me over. A panna cotta stuffed poached pear sounded interesting, but was it refreshing? My indecisiveness and Joe's indifference led us to allow Chef McGuire to choose the dessert for us. Surely he had a favorite. This is what happened next...

Both were served! Ahh why must you do this to me?! One bite of each and I could understand why though. Both had their merits and both would make me want to order more. The poached pear, served cold, was surprisingly very refreshing and the panna cotta, not heavy. It wasn't overly sweet either which is my preference for desserts! A "cake waffle donut" was served on the side, a cute concept. Moreso on the cake donut side, in a waffle shape, made from almond flour which makes it a fantastic gluten-free option for guests! Joe's favorite was the chocolate mousse, which we've had before. This time though, it was served with a chocolate cooking crumb crust and almond brittle. I really had to fight him for the last bite! (I already finished off the poached pear, haha!) Chef McGuire even remember Joe's "allergy" to peanuts and asked if the nuts were okay before plating. If you don't call that hospitality, I really don't know what is. Good call on both desserts!

Every meal ends with a quote slip with the bill. This particular quote was quite fitting for the night. Tzin Wine and Tapas, I will never forget what you did or said, and definitely never forget that you guys make me feel so happy! Food is superb, as always, and the service remains A+ as the team hasn't changed one bit. Except for Melissa's hair, which is now a short, chic bob! (She's the fabulous, upbeat server you will have alongside the equally fabulous Kelsey, owner of Tzin). Much thanks to Chef McGuire, as well as Sous Chef Greene, for the meal (and desserts!). Strongly considering ordering both desserts now for future meals. Maybe one to go.

Nothing fancy about the restaurant, but the food is fantastic and the staff is super friendly.

Vindaloo (even though Medium) is a lot spicier we've had at other Indian restaurants.  My husband enjoys it regardless.

I get the chicken tikka masala like it's going out of business and it's great at this location.  (I like to get it mild and mix in a little of the vindaloo sauce in it...yum!)

Their onion and chicken pakora appetizers are both tasty too.  

I've never seen it super busy here, which is a blessing and a curse.  Blessing for me of course, b/c it's easy to get a table and the food comes reasonably fast.  Curse for the owners though.  They are so so so nice and I'd love to see them get busier!  

When you're in the mood for a tasty treat come on over and support them!  Cool Indian grocery store next door too.

Words cannot express the love that I have for this place! Their ice cream is so delicious! Never a frozen aftertaste. Always fresh ingredients useD. The staff is always nice. They have four locations now (The latest one opened in Marana on memorial day). They have punchcards. Every scoop you get a punch until you're eligible for a free scoop. I love their milkshakes! Their flavors are always changing, but I'm in love with their classic butter pecan. I frequent their establishments often

We loved it! First time here and we are out of towners! It seems like a local spot. Doesn't seem like it's in a good area, but the prices were so good and the seasoning was so good!  They have boiled seafood (crawfish, whole crabs, snow crab legs, shrimps) poboys and other Cajun items.

The Yellow Submarine has been serving up sizeable sandwiches with a side of sass, sense of humor, and sarcasm for almost 40 years in the Reno-Sparks area! The story is a sweet one, and one I love to hear in our community. 

The original owner had grown the business from one successful shop to three in about 20 years. When he decided to retire, he sold two and was approached by an employee who'd been there for almost 20 years who was interested in buying the original business. He told her to make an offer, so she did and, in response, he cut her number in HALF and said the place is yours! Rumor has it he's now off sailing the world, not in a submarine, but a photo of him on his boat sits up on a shelf watching over everything. I was told he still calls to check in and give the new owner a hard time, and I'm sure that's how this place has kept up the witty and gritty sarcastic vibe and spirit all these years. 

Under that tough exterior is a business run on dedication, love, and camaraderie and you feel that as soon as you walk in. I showed up a little after 7 (they close at 8), and there was one other customer there picking up, what I learned was her usual Thursday order. The nice gal behind the counter made me feel right at home, and said she'd be with me ASAP. I went ahead and explored the shop a little more, which was when I noticed the half priced beer on Thursdays ($1.50!). I grabbed one and started looking at the fun trinkets, crafts, signs and photos all over the walls, including a large collection of Wizard of Oz memorabilia, all of which really give you a sense of who runs this place. 

When it was my turn to order, I was excited, and asked her what's good. She said the Yellow Sub was the way to go. This thing sounded like a monster with ham, salami, and pastrami, provolone and swiss cheese, lettuce, tomato, onion, sprouts (I didn't get these), mayo, oil & vinegar, and parmesan cheese. I came in hoping for an Italian sub, so I asked to sub capicola for pastrami, which she was happy to do, and she even offered to sprinkle some oregano on for a little more Italian flair! I had seen the 12" sub go home with the other lady, and it could feed 4, so I opted for the 6" and it was massive! The bread was fresh and had that chewy texture I look for in a sub roll, the meat plentiful (at least 1/2lb!), and the veggies crisp and delicious with just the right amount of "dressing" from the oil & vinegar, parmesan, S&P and oregano.

I'm amazed it took me almost 7 years to find it, but I'm so glad I took Yelper Amanda M's suggestion and went in last night. I will be back soon and I'll be bringing others to meet this institution face to face.
They have the BEST BURGER in Hernando County by far!!!!! I love coming here to watch football :)

Went for lunch on Labor Day and it was pretty busy! I had the wet burrito and a watermelon margarita as well as a cucumber margarita. I was impressed by all. It's a very dark setting inside, would have loved to sit outside in the back "garden" area. Loved their chips and salsa. I would definitely go back.
Great taco place! My bf really liked the short rib tacos and I loved the cauliflower tacos. I will definitely go back.  It's pretty much a low grill place but it was all I needed for a perfect lunch!

Parking can be a bit troublesome to find 

The wait on a Saturday afternoon was about fifteen minutes. Once you order, the food is out in just minutes. We were checked up on twice. 

The ribs were tender, moist and fall off the bone. I recommend buying a half rack of ribs plus two sides to share between two.
